instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Convenience Store Shopping AssistantRe1 The system should allow customers to search for product names or categories through touch screens or voice commands.Re2 The system should instantly display all products that match the search keywords, along with product images, prices, and stock status.Re3 When search results are empty, the system should notify customers via screen prompt or voice message that no relevant products were found and suggest similar products or recommend new arrivals.Re4 The system should support quick account registration using mobile phone numbers or social media accounts.Re5 The system should verify the registration information of new users through SMS verification codes or third-party platform authentication.Re6 The system should allow logged-in customers to view their purchase history and current shopping cart contents.Re7 The system should store customer basic information, such as name and contact details, for subsequent services and marketing activities.Re8 After completing a purchase, the system should send an electronic receipt and order details to the customer via SMS or email.Re9 The system should provide convenient shopping cart management functions, allowing customers to add, delete, or modify the quantity of items at any time.Re10 The system should display multiple payment options, including but not limited to mobile payments and credit card payments, ensuring the security of the payment process.Re11 For supported stores, the system should offer an 'order online, pick up in-store' option and clearly inform customers of the pickup time and location.Re12 The system should allow customers to select the most suitable pickup time and remind them of the pickup via SMS or in-app messages after the order is confirmed.Re13 The system should provide an order status inquiry function, enabling customers to track the progress of their orders at any time.Re14 The system should have an automatic recommendation feature, suggesting related products based on customer purchase history and browsing behavior.Re15 The system should support customer reviews and feedback on purchased products and services to enhance user experience.Re16 The system should regularly push discount information and promotional activities to customers to increase repurchase rates.Re17 The system should have data analysis capabilities to analyze customer purchasing behavior and optimize product layout and service processes.Re18 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of customers from different language backgrounds.Re19 The system should provide an accessible mode to ensure that people with disabilities can use it easily.Re20 The system should have robust security and privacy protection measures to ensure that customer data is not leaked..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Travel Itinerary Planning SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input search criteria such as destination, date range, and travel preferences on the screen.Re2 The system should display all matching travel itinerary suggestions based on the user's search criteria, including information about attractions, hotels, transportation, and activities.Re3 When no matching travel itineraries are found for the search criteria, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window and provide suggestions for modifying the search criteria.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles and set login credentials to save and manage personal travel plans.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure that only authenticated users can access their personal profiles.Re6 The system should display a list of saved travel plans, booking records, and historical travel records in the user's personal profile.Re7 The system should require users to provide a valid email address when creating a personal profile to receive system notifications and service information.Re8 The system should send confirmation information and important reminders for travel plans to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to add interesting travel itineraries to a wish list for future viewing or booking.Re10 The system should offer multiple travel itinerary booking options, such as individual attraction tickets, hotel accommodations, transportation tickets, and all-inclusive travel packages.Re11 The system should allow users to customize travel itineraries, including adjusting schedules, adding or removing activities, etc.Re12 The system should provide detailed cost explanations, including prices for various services, discounts, and taxes.Re13 The system should allow users to view other users' reviews and ratings before making a reservation to aid decision-making.Re14 The system should support multiple payment methods, including credit cards, debit cards, and third-party payment platforms.Re15 The system should allow users to select a payment method for booked travel itineraries and complete the payment process.Re16 The system should provide a function for users to review and rate travel itineraries and services after the trip.Re17 The system should collect user reviews and ratings to improve service quality and provide references for other users.Re18 The system should allow users to update their travel arrangements during the trip, such as changing hotels or adjusting activity times.Re19 The system should provide travel guides, including destination introductions, cultural customs, safety tips, and more.Re20 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users from different countries and regions.Re21 The system should provide customer service features, including online chat, phone support, and FAQs, to resolve issues users encounter while using the system..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Parking Payment SystemRe1 The system should allow users to enter the parking lot via license plate number or QR code scanning.Re2 The system should automatically recognize the license plate number of entering vehicles and record the entry time.Re3 When vehicles enter or exit, the system should be able to capture images of the vehicles through cameras for future reference.Re4 The system should support multiple payment methods, including but not limited to credit cards, mobile payments (such as Alipay, WeChat Pay), prepaid cards, etc.Re5 The system should allow users to complete payment at the exit through a payment interface on the screen.Re6 The system should be able to automatically calculate parking fees based on the vehicle's parking duration and fee standards.Re7 After a user successfully pays, the system should automatically raise the barrier to allow passage.Re8 The system should provide an online recharge function, allowing users to top up their prepaid cards.Re9 The system should support remote payment of parking fees via a mobile application.Re10 The system should allow users to view historical parking records and payment details.Re11 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities, and when equipment malfunctions occur, it should promptly issue an alarm.Re12 The system should support administrator login for device maintenance and system management.Re13 The system should provide real-time monitoring functions, allowing administrators to check the real-time status of the parking lot from the backend.Re14 The system should support multi-parking lot management, enabling administrators to manage data from multiple parking lots on one platform.Re15 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re16 The system should support monthly rental space management, including registration, renewal, and cancellation functions for monthly rental users.Re17 The system should provide report generation functions, allowing administrators to generate reports on parking revenue, traffic statistics, etc.Re18 The system should have anti-cheating functions to prevent illegal means of evading fees.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to facilitate use by users with different language backgrounds.Re20 The system should have a well-designed user experience, with a simple and clear interface and smooth operation processes..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Taxi Dispatch SystemRe1 The system should allow passengers to enter their destination address via a mobile application or web page.Re2 The system should display in real-time a list of available unmanned taxis along with their estimated arrival times.Re3 When no unmanned taxis are available, the system should notify passengers through a pop-up and provide an estimated wait time.Re4 The system should allow passengers to register for an account and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify passengers' login credentials to ensure secure access to personal accounts.Re6 The system should display the current trip status and history of trips in the passenger's personal account.Re7 The system should maintain passengers' contact information (such as phone numbers or email addresses) as essential account details.Re8 The system should send trip confirmations and important updates to passengers via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow passengers to cancel trips and adjust charges when necessary.Re10 The system should offer multiple trip options, such as economy, comfort, and luxury classes.Re11 The system should automatically calculate trip costs based on passenger selection and display them to the passenger.Re12 The system should allow passengers to choose payment methods, such as online payments, credit cards, or e-wallets.Re13 The system should display real-time tracking information of the trip so that passengers can monitor vehicle movements.Re14 The system should allow passengers to rate and review services after the trip.Re15 To improve service quality, the system should collect data on passenger ratings and reviews.Re16 The system should have an emergency contact function to enable passengers to quickly reach customer service centers if they encounter problems.Re17 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of passengers from different regions.Re18 The system should be capable of handling a large volume of requests during peak hours to ensure the stability and responsiveness of the service..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling Appointment PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to input search keywords for counselors on the screen.Re2 The system should display all matching counselors based on the search keywords.Re3 When no matching counselors are found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to create a personal profile and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access the personal profile page.Re6 The system should display a list of scheduled and/or completed counseling sessions in the user's profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's email information as an essential part of the personal profile.Re8 The system should send appointment confirmations to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to view each counselor’s introduction, professional background, and user reviews.Re10 The system should provide options for online and face-to-face counseling.Re11 The system should allow users to select appointment times based on their schedules.Re12 The system should display available time slots for each counselor.Re13 The system should allow users to cancel or reschedule appointments.Re14 The system should display available payment methods (such as credit card, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.).Re15 The system should allow users to choose a payment method for their appointment.Re16 After the consultation, the system should allow users to rate or review the counseling experience.Re17 To collect user feedback, the system should provide a simple rating and review interface.Re18 The system should allow users to have a brief communication with the counselor before making an appointment to determine compatibility.Re19 The system should protect user privacy by ensuring all communication content is encrypted.Re20 The system should provide a frequently asked questions (FAQ) page about counseling services..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Ship Cargo Tracking SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for specific cargo information by entering the ship ID or cargo number.Re2 The system should display all cargo tracking records that match the search criteria, including but not limited to the origin, destination, and estimated arrival time.Re3 When no matching cargo information is found during a search, the system should notify the user with a pop-up message stating 'No related cargo information found.'Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set credentials such as a username and password.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure that only authorized users can access their account information.Re6 The system should display on the user's profile page a list of all sent and received cargoes, along with the status of each item (e.g., in transit, arrived, signed for).Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email address and phone number) as a necessary part of the profile to promptly notify users of cargo status updates.Re8 The system should send notifications of cargo status updates to users via email or SMS, including but not limited to departure notices and arrival notices.Re9 The system should provide real-time cargo location tracking, allowing users to view the current position of the cargo on a map.Re10 The system should allow users to query historical cargo tracking records, including all transportation details over a certain period.Re11 The system should support multiple language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re12 The system should have data encryption capabilities to ensure the security of user information and cargo tracking data.Re13 The system should provide API interfaces to allow third-party logistics platforms or enterprise systems to integrate, achieving seamless data connectivity.Re14 The system should be able to handle reports of exceptional situations, such as lost or damaged cargo, allowing users to submit reports online.Re15 The system should provide customer support, enabling users to get help through online chat, phone, etc.Re16 The system should allow users to rate and provide feedback on cargo transportation services, including aspects such as service quality and speed.Re17 To improve service quality, the system needs to collect user ratings and feedback information and analyze it regularly to refine service processes.Re18 The system should have an automatic update function, prompting users to update when new software versions or security patches are available.Re19 The system should support multi-device login, allowing users to sync and view cargo tracking information across different devices.Re20 The system should have an offline viewing function, allowing users to view recent cargo tracking records even when they are in a network-free environment..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Collaborative Design SoftwareRe1 The system should allow users to register accounts and set up personal profiles.Re2 The system should support multiple login methods, such as email, social media accounts, etc.Re3 The system should provide a secure password protection mechanism, including password strength checks and regular change prompts.Re4 The system should allow users to upload and manage their profile pictures and bios.Re5 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re6 The system should provide project creation functionality, allowing users to customize project names, descriptions, and privacy settings.Re7 The system should allow users to invite team members to join projects and assign different roles and permissions.Re8 The system should provide version control features, automatically saving different versions of design files.Re9 The system should support real-time collaboration, allowing multiple users to edit the same design file simultaneously.Re10 The system should provide a chat tool to facilitate communication among team members within the project.Re11 The system should integrate a library of commonly used graphics and design elements for easy user access.Re12 The system should support custom components and templates to improve design efficiency.Re13 The system should provide design review functions, allowing users to comment on and suggest changes to design files.Re14 The system should allow users to export design files in multiple formats, such as PNG, JPEG, PDF, etc.Re15 The system should support cloud storage and backup of design files to ensure data security.Re16 The system should provide design specifications and style guides to help teams maintain consistent design standards.Re17 The system should support integration with third-party tools and services, such as Slack, Trello, etc.Re18 The system should provide detailed usage help and tutorials to assist new users in getting started quickly.Re19 The system should have performance monitoring and optimization mechanisms to ensure a smooth user experience.Re20 The system should provide channels for user feedback to collect opinions and suggestions, continuously improving the product..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Environmental Monitoring and Early Warning SystemRe1 The system should monitor environmental parameters in real-time, such as temperature, humidity, air quality (PM2.5, PM10), noise levels, etc.Re2 The system should be able to display historical environmental data in the form of charts and data tables.Re3 When environmental parameters exceed preset safety ranges, the system should automatically trigger alarms and notify designated managers via SMS, email, or app push notifications.Re4 The system should support multi-user login, allowing each user to access different functional modules based on their permission level.Re5 The system should provide user management functions, including adding, deleting users, and modifying user permissions.Re6 The system should record all user login logs, including login times, IP addresses, etc., for security audits.Re7 The system should support the connection of multiple devices, such as temperature and humidity sensors, air quality monitors, etc., ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of data.Re8 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to prevent data loss.Re9 The system should provide data analysis functions, such as trend analysis, anomaly detection, etc., to help users better understand environmental changes.Re10 The system should support remote control functions, such as turning on/off air purifiers, adjusting air conditioning temperatures, etc.Re11 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities, capable of issuing timely warnings when hardware malfunctions occur.Re12 The system should provide API interfaces to support integration with third-party systems, such as smart city platforms, enterprise management systems, etc.Re13 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re14 The system should have a well-designed user interface to make operations more intuitive and convenient.Re15 The system should support access from mobile devices, such as smartphones and tablets, allowing users to view environmental data anytime, anywhere.Re16 The system should provide regular report generation functions, including daily, weekly, and monthly reports, to help users understand long-term environmental change trends.Re17 The system should support custom alarm thresholds, allowing users to adjust alarm conditions according to actual needs.Re18 The system should have data encryption functions to ensure the security and privacy protection of user data.Re19 The system should support multi-area management, suitable for large enterprises and park environmental monitoring needs.Re20 The system should provide environmental improvement suggestions, proposing specific improvement measures based on current environmental data and historical data analysis..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Delivery Robot Navigation SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input destination coordinates or addresses on the interface.Re2 The system should be capable of automatically planning the optimal route from the current location to the target location.Re3 If the entered destination is unreachable, the system should prompt the operator through the interface.Re4 The system should support multiple map data sources to operate in different environments.Re5 The system should update the robot's current position in real-time and display it on the map.Re6 The system should provide obstacle detection functionality to prevent collisions between the robot and obstacles.Re7 The system should have obstacle avoidance algorithms that enable automatic detour when encountering obstacles.Re8 The system should record detailed path information for each task for subsequent analysis.Re9 The system should have multi-task scheduling capabilities to handle multiple delivery requests simultaneously.Re10 The system should support remote monitoring, allowing operators to view the robot's status in real-time.Re11 The system should be able to automatically identify and handle common environmental changes (such as temporarily closed roads).Re12 The system should have an anomaly reporting mechanism for situations like low battery, system failures, etc.Re13 The system should provide interfaces to facilitate integration with other logistics systems.Re14 The system should support multi-language interfaces to accommodate users in different regions.Re15 The system should have permission management functions to ensure that only authorized personnel can operate it.Re16 The system should log all operations for easy problem tracking and auditing.Re17 The system should support online software upgrades to continuously improve performance and security.Re18 The system should have self-diagnostic functions to check the status of key components before startup.Re19 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical documentation to help users get started quickly.Re20 The system should support various communication methods, such as Wi-Fi, 4G/5G, etc., to ensure communication stability in different environments..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Campus Library Management SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input search keywords via the screen (such as book titles, authors, ISBNs, etc.).Re2 The system should display all matching books and their detailed information (such as location, availability for borrowing, etc.) based on the search.Re3 When no matching books are found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window that there are no relevant results and suggest trying other keywords.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal accounts and set login credentials (username and password).Re5 The system should verify user credentials to allow access to personal accounts.Re6 The system should display borrowing records, reservation records, and overdue reminders in the user's personal profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email, phone number) as an essential part of their personal profile.Re8 The system should send borrowing confirmations and due date reminders to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow users to renew books online and update the borrowing period.Re10 The system should display the current borrowing status of books, including whether they have been borrowed out and the expected return date.Re11 The system should support the reservation function for books, automatically notifying reserved users when the book is returned.Re12 The system should allow administrators to manage the book inventory, including adding new books, modifying book information, and deleting books.Re13 The system should provide a feedback channel for users to submit feedback about books, services, or other issues.Re14 The system should support multiple authentication methods, such as campus cards, QR codes, etc., to facilitate user entry and exit from the library.Re15 The system should be able to generate various statistical reports, such as book circulation status, popular book rankings, etc., for administrator reference.Re16 The system should provide an interface for accessing electronic resources, allowing users to access e-books, journals, and other resources online.Re17 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of different user groups.Re18 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security and integrity.Re19 The system should provide help documents and FAQs to enable users to quickly understand how to use the system..

users encounter during the payment process.Re14 The system should support multi-terminal access, including PC and mobile devices, ensuring a consistent user experience across different devices.Re15 The system should regularly undergo performance optimization and security updates to ensure stable operation and security.Re16 The system should provide detailed settlement reports to help merchants understand their financial status, with export functionality supported.Re17 The system should support balance management for multiple currencies, allowing users to store balances in different currencies within their accounts.Re18 The system should provide risk control features to automatically detect and prevent potential fraudulent activities.Re19 The system should support a multi-level account structure to meet the permission management needs of different roles within an enterprise.Re20 The system should provide customized services, offering personalized payment solutions based on the specific needs of merchants..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Fitness Equipment Data Analysis ToolRe1 The system should allow users to register and log in to an account to save personal fitness data.Re2 The system should allow users to connect their intelligent fitness equipment through a device ID or other unique identifier.Re3 The system should synchronize data from the intelligent fitness equipment to the user's profile in real time.Re4 The system should provide data visualization features, such as charts and trend lines, to help users intuitively understand their fitness progress.Re5 The system should support multi-dimensional data analysis, including heart rate, exercise duration, calories burned, etc.Re6 The system should provide recommendations and personalized training plans based on the user's fitness goals (such as weight loss, muscle building, endurance improvement).Re7 The system should allow users to set personal fitness goals and track their completion status.Re8 The system should provide a historical data query function, allowing users to view fitness records for any time period.Re9 The system should allow users to export fitness data in formats such as CSV, PDF, etc., for saving or sharing with third-party applications.Re10 The system should have social functions, allowing users to invite friends to join challenges or share achievements.Re11 The system should provide health reminders, such as regular prompts to rest or drink water.Re12 The system should support multiple language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re13 The system should protect user data privacy, ensuring the security of data transmission and storage.Re14 The system should provide help documentation and frequently asked questions to assist users in quickly getting started.Re15 The system should allow users to customize the data display interface, such as selecting data indicators to focus on.Re16 The system should support offline mode, allowing fitness data to be recorded even when the device is not connected to the internet.Re17 The system should regularly push updates to optimize performance and add new features.Re18 The system should provide channels for user feedback, collecting user opinions and suggestions to continuously improve the product..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Farm Management SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to log in and access the backend management system.Re2 The system should support real-time monitoring of environmental data in the fields (such as temperature, humidity, light intensity, etc.).Re3 The system should automatically adjust the operation status of the irrigation system based on soil moisture and weather forecasts.Re4 The system should provide visual charts of the crop growth cycle to help farmers understand the growth conditions of crops.Re5 The system should record and display historical operation records for each plot of land, including sowing, fertilizing, pesticide spraying, etc.Re6 The system should support remote control of devices such as drones and autonomous tractors.Re7 The system should be able to predict the occurrence of pests and diseases and provide corresponding prevention and control recommendations.Re8 The system should support crop yield prediction based on historical data and current environmental conditions.Re9 The system should allow users to set alarm thresholds, and when environmental parameters exceed the set range, the system should automatically send alerts.Re10 The system should integrate meteorological information, including weather forecasts for the next few days, to facilitate agricultural planning.Re11 The system should support multi-user permission management to ensure that users with different roles can only access data and functions within their permission scope.Re12 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re13 The system should support mobile applications to allow farmers to view and manage the system conveniently while in the field.Re14 The system should provide detailed user guides and online help to assist users in getting started quickly.Re15 The system should support data exchange with other agricultural IoT platforms to achieve information sharing.Re16 The system should regularly generate reports automatically, including crop growth status, environmental data analysis, operation logs, etc.Re17 The system should support user-defined report templates to meet personalized needs.Re18 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate integration with third-party applications and services.Re19 The system should support multiple language interfaces to accommodate international usage scenarios.Re20 The system should have good scalability to facilitate the addition of new features or upgrades to existing features in the future..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Lawyer Case Management SystemRe1 The system should allow lawyers and clients to enter search text on the screen to quickly find cases or related information.Re2 The system should display all matching cases based on the search, including key data such as case number, case name, and party information.Re3 When no matching cases are found from the search, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window and provide an option to create a new case.Re4 The system should allow users (lawyers and clients) to create personal profiles and set credentials, including name, contact information, authentication, etc.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access personal profiles, ensuring that only authorized users can access sensitive information.Re6 The system should display a list of cases in the user's personal profile, including ongoing cases and closed cases, along with basic status information for each case.Re7 The system should maintain the user's email information as an essential part of their personal profile for receiving important notifications and updates.Re8 The system should send case update notifications to users via email, such as changes in case status, hearing dates, etc.Re9 The system should allow lawyers to upload case-related documents, such as legal documents and evidence materials, and manage these files through categorization.Re10 The system should support multi-user collaboration, allowing different lawyers or team members to view and edit case information for the same case.Re11 The system should provide a case timeline view, showcasing key events and progress from the start to the end of the case.Re12 The system should allow lawyers to record and track all communications related to a case, including phone calls, emails, meetings, etc.Re13 The system should offer budget and cost management functions for cases, helping lawyers track and manage case expenses.Re14 The system should allow clients to pay legal fees online and provide multiple payment options.Re15 The system should support a case calendar function, enabling users to set and manage dates and reminders related to cases, such as court appearance dates, deadlines for filing documents, etc.Re16 The system should allow lawyers and clients to sign documents online, supporting electronic signature functionality to simplify the document signing process.Re17 The system should provide case reporting functions, automatically generating progress reports, financial reports, etc., to help users stay informed about case developments at any time.Re18 The system should allow users to set privacy permissions to control who can view or edit specific case information.Re19 The system should provide data backup and recovery functions to ensure the security and integrity of user data.Re20 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users in different regions..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Warehouse Logistics Scheduling SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to record incoming inventory information through the interface by entering or scanning the barcode of goods.Re2 The system should update the inventory status in real time and be able to display the location information of all goods.Re3 When the inventory level falls below the preset threshold, the system should automatically send a replenishment reminder to the corresponding management personnel.Re4 The system should support multi-warehouse management and be able to handle the entry, exit, and inventory queries of different warehouses simultaneously.Re5 The system should provide automated scheduling for outbound goods, automatically allocating picking routes based on order priority.Re6 The system should have the ability to handle exceptional situations such as equipment failure and lost goods, capable of promptly alarming and logging records.Re7 The system should support data exchange with external logistics systems, achieving seamless integration from storage to delivery.Re8 The system should allow setting multiple picking strategies, such as nearest distance first, time window optimization, etc., to improve picking efficiency.Re9 The system should provide a cargo tracking function, enabling real-time viewing of the movement trajectory of goods within the warehouse.Re10 The system should include a data analysis module that can analyze key indicators such as inventory turnover rate and picking efficiency to help optimize operations.Re11 The system should support user permission management to ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive information or perform specific operations.Re12 The system should have a report generation function, capable of regularly generating reports on inventory, entry and exit, performance, etc.Re13 The system should support mobile device access, allowing operators to remotely monitor and control warehouse operations via smartphones or tablets.Re14 The system should have security measures to prevent unauthorized access and data leakage.Re15 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet international business needs.Re16 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate integration with other enterprise systems (such as ERP, CRM).Re17 The system should support historical data backup and recovery to ensure data security and integrity.Re18 The system should have self-inspection and diagnostic functions, capable of periodically checking the health status of the system and reporting potential issues.Re19 The system should support cargo packaging and unpacking management to ensure the integrity and safety of goods within the warehouse.Re20 The system should provide training and help documentation to assist new users in getting started quickly..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Catering Ordering SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input search terms for dish names or keywords via the screen.Re2 The system should display all matching dishes and their detailed information, such as price and images, based on the search.Re3 When no matching dishes are found from the search, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window or prompt message.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles and set login credentials, such as usernames and passwords.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure access to personal profiles.Re6 The system should display the user's order history and current order status in their personal profile.Re7 The system should require users to provide valid contact information, such as a phone number or email address, to receive order updates.Re8 The system should send order confirmation messages to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to add dishes to the shopping cart or remove them from it.Re10 The system should offer multiple options for meal collection, such as dine-in, delivery, and pick-up.Re11 The system should display corresponding operational instructions based on the user's selected method of collection, such as filling in the delivery address or selecting a pick-up time.Re12 The system should allow users to choose different payment methods, such as online payment or in-store payment.Re13 The system should support users in viewing the current status of their orders, such as being prepared, ready to serve, or in transit.Re14 For delivery orders, the system should provide real-time tracking information.Re15 The system should allow users to rate and review dishes and services after completing an order.Re16 The system should collect user reviews and ratings to improve service quality and dish quality.Re17 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re18 The system should have a recommendation feature that suggests suitable dishes based on the user's ordering history and preferences.Re19 The system should provide promotional information and coupon features to attract users to place orders.Re20 The system should support online seat reservations and allow users to select specific time slots..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Automated Control System for Unmanned PortRe1 The system should allow remote operators to monitor and control all automated equipment within the port via a console.Re2 The system should display in real-time the location and status of all cargo within the port.Re3 When cargo stacking errors or safety risks are detected, the system should automatically trigger alarms and notify operators through the screen.Re4 The system should support automatic identification and recording of vessel information entering and leaving the port, including vessel name, nationality, carrying capacity, etc.Re5 The system should be able to automatically schedule the optimal berthing positions and unloading sequences based on the arrival times and types of cargo of the vessels.Re6 The system should provide cargo tracking capabilities, allowing users to query the current location and historical movement paths of specific cargoes.Re7 The system should have automated dispatching capabilities, scheduling transport vehicles (such as AGVs) automatically based on the priority and destination of the cargo.Re8 The system should support data exchange with customs systems to enable automatic declaration and clearance of cargo information.Re9 The system should be capable of handling exceptional situations, such as equipment failures or weather impacts, and automatically adjust work plans.Re10 The system should provide detailed operation logs, recording the time, operator, and content of each operation for audit and issue tracing purposes.Re11 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of international ports.Re12 The system should have advanced security features, including user permission management, encrypted data transmission, and regular backups.Re13 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate integration with other logistics systems or supply chain management systems.Re14 The system should support wireless communication technologies to ensure efficient communication between devices within the port.Re15 The system should have self-diagnostic functions, regularly checking the status of hardware and software and promptly reporting potential issues.Re16 The system should be able to generate various reports, including operation efficiency reports, equipment utilization reports, and cost analysis reports.Re17 The system should support mobile access, allowing managers to view port operations at any time and from anywhere.Re18 The system should have environmental monitoring capabilities, real-time monitoring of air quality, noise levels, and other environmental parameters within the port.Re19 The system should support drone inspections to enhance the safety and operational efficiency of the port.Re20 The system should have intelligent prediction capabilities, forecasting port operation trends for a certain period based on historical data..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Weather Forecasting API ServiceRe1 The system should allow users to query weather information by entering a city name or postal code.Re2 The system should provide real-time weather data, including basic information such as temperature, humidity, and wind speed.Re3 The system should offer a 7-day weather forecast, including high and low temperatures, weather conditions, etc.Re4 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re5 The system should be able to automatically provide weather forecasts based on the user's geographical location.Re6 The system should provide Air Quality Index (AQI) information to help users understand air quality.Re7 The system should provide UV index information to help users take appropriate sun protection measures.Re8 The system should provide precipitation probability to help users plan outdoor activities.Re9 The system should have a weather alert function that can notify users promptly when extreme weather occurs.Re10 The system should allow users to save frequently queried locations for quick access.Re11 The system should provide API documentation to facilitate the integration of weather forecasting features by developers.Re12 The system should support retrieving historical weather data via API for data analysis use.Re13 The system should have an error handling mechanism to return clear error messages when requests fail.Re14 The system should support multiple data format outputs, such as JSON, XML, etc., to accommodate different application requirements.Re15 The system should provide user authentication mechanisms to ensure data security.Re16 The system should log API call records for issue tracking and performance optimization.Re17 The system should provide detailed usage statistics to help users understand the status of API usage.Re18 The system should support weather forecasts at multiple time scales, such as hourly, daily, weekly, etc.Re19 The system should provide customizable notification functions, allowing users to set weather alerts under specific conditions.Re20 The system should allow users to subscribe to weather updates for specific areas and receive notifications via email or SMS..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Lighting Energy-saving Control SystemRe1 The system should allow users to control the lights in their home remotely via a mobile application or web interface.Re2 The system should be able to automatically adjust the indoor lighting brightness based on ambient light conditions to save energy.Re3 When the system detects that no one is in the room, it should automatically turn off the lights to reduce unnecessary power consumption.Re4 The system should support setting schedules, allowing users to preset different lighting modes for various time periods (such as morning, daytime, night).Re5 The system should provide multiple scene modes (such as reading, party, sleep, etc.), enabling users to easily switch between different lighting effects with simple operations.Re6 The system should support voice control and be compatible with mainstream smart speaker devices, such as Amazon Echo, Google Home, etc.Re7 The system should be capable of integrating with smart home platforms to achieve coordinated control with other smart devices.Re8 The system should provide energy consumption reports, regularly showing users the energy usage of the lighting system to help them understand the energy-saving effects.Re9 The system should support multi-user access control, allowing multiple family members to log in and manage the lighting system with their own accounts.Re10 The system should have security measures in place to ensure user data safety and prevent unauthorized access.Re11 The system should support self-diagnosis functions, notifying users promptly when hardware failures are detected so they can make timely repairs.Re12 The system should allow users to customize the color and brightness of the lights to meet personalized needs.Re13 The system should have a well-designed user experience, with a simple and clear operation interface that is easy to use.Re14 The system should provide customer support services, including online help documents, FAQs, and a customer service hotline.Re15 The system should support firmware updates to continuously optimize performance and add new features.Re16 The system should have an emergency lighting mode that automatically activates a backup power supply in case of a power outage to ensure basic lighting needs.Re17 The system should support manual overrides of automatic control functions, allowing users to directly control the lights in specific situations.Re18 The system should record user usage habits and use machine learning to optimize automatic control strategies, thereby improving energy efficiency..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Garbage Classification Recognition RobotRe1 The system should allow users to take pictures of garbage waste (other waste).Re3 The system should display specific classification descriptions and handling suggestions for each type of garbage.Re4 The system should allow users to manually select the category of garbage to correct any errors in automatic recognition.Re5 The system should provide voice input functionality, allowing users to describe the garbage verbally, and the system will classify it based on the description.Re6 The system should record user usage history so that users can view their past classification records.Re7 The system should allow users to create personal accounts to save personal classification records and preference settings.Re8 The system should provide personalized garbage classification guidelines and recommendations through user accounts.Re9 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of different users.Re10 The system should have internet connectivity to regularly update the garbage database and classification rules.Re11 The system should be capable of processing blurry or hard-to-recognize garbage images and prompt users to retake the photo or provide more details.Re12 The system should include an educational module on garbage disposal knowledge to help users understand the importance of garbage classification and related laws and regulations.Re13 The system should support integration with community or city garbage classification management systems to provide data support.Re14 The system should have an energy-saving mode to reduce power consumption and extend the device's lifespan.Re15 The system should have self-diagnosis and alarm functions to notify users or administrators promptly when the device malfunctions.Re16 The system should allow users to provide feedback on classification errors or other issues to continuously optimize system performance.Re17 The system should support multiple users using it simultaneously, ensuring the independence and privacy protection of each user's data.Re18 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical support to help users get started quickly..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Parking Lot Smart Vehicle Search System  Re1 The system should allow users to input search text using license plate numbers or other vehicle identification information.  Re2 The system should display all vehicle location information that matches the search criteria.  Re3 When no matching vehicle is found in the search, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.  Re4 The system should allow users to register and create personal accounts.  Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure secure access.  Re6 The system should record the user's parking history and display it in their personal account.  Re7 The system should support multi-user queries, allowing parking lot staff to query the location information of all vehicles.  Re8 The system should provide a map view, enabling users to quickly locate their vehicles through the map.  Re9 The system should offer walking navigation functions to guide users from their current location to where their vehicle is parked.  Re10 The system should support reverse vehicle search requests, meaning users can issue a vehicle search command via the app, and the system will automatically guide them to the vehicle's location.  Re11 The system should provide real-time updates on parking space information, including the number and location of available spaces.  Re12 The system should allow users to reserve specific parking spaces and hold them for a certain period.  Re13 The system should provide a reservation reminder function to prevent users from missing their reservation times.  Re14 The system should have an automatic vehicle entry and exit recognition feature to minimize manual intervention.  Re15 The system should provide a vehicle abnormal status alarm function, such as for unauthorized movement.  Re16 The system should support user feedback functions, allowing users to report issues or make suggestions.  Re17 The system should periodically send users parking fee bills and payment links.  Re18 The system should support multiple payment methods to facilitate user payments.  Re19 The system should provide 24/7 online customer service to answer user questions and handle emergencies.  Re20 The system should have data backup and recovery capabilities to ensure data security..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Bus Scheduling SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to input bus routes, stops, and schedules through an interface.Re2 The system should automatically plan the most optimized bus driving routes, taking into account traffic conditions, weather, and other factors.Re3 When the system detects vehicle malfunctions or delays, it should immediately notify administrators via pop-up windows or SMS.Re4 The system should allow passengers to query real-time bus locations and estimated arrival times through a mobile application.Re5 The system should support multi-language interfaces to accommodate passengers with different language backgrounds.Re6 The system should be able to dynamically adjust departure intervals based on passenger flow to ensure efficient operation.Re7 The system should record operational data for each bus, including but not limited to mileage and power consumption, for subsequent analysis.Re8 The system should provide historical data analysis functions to help optimize future service plans.Re9 The system should allow passengers to reserve seats through the application to enhance the riding experience.Re10 The system should have emergency handling mechanisms, such as quickly adjusting routes or suspending operations in case of sudden accidents.Re11 The system should provide detailed vehicle maintenance reminders and recording functions to ensure vehicles are in good condition.Re12 The system should allow passengers to rate services and provide suggestions, continuously improving service quality.Re13 The system should support integration with urban traffic management systems to achieve information sharing and collaborative management.Re14 The system should have high security to protect user data and transaction safety.Re15 The system should support multiple payment methods to facilitate ticket purchasing and fee payments for passengers.Re16 The system should be able to recommend optimal travel plans based on passengers' travel habits.Re17 The system should have strong data processing capabilities, supporting big data analysis and machine learning algorithm applications.Re18 The system should provide multi-channel customer support, including online chat, phone, and email, to resolve passenger issues.Re19 The system should support barrier-free design to ensure that people with disabilities can also use it conveniently.Re20 The system should regularly update software to fix known issues and add new features..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Plant Protection Drone SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input flight mission parameters through the interface, such as flight altitude, speed, and spraying area.Re2 The system should be able to automatically plan the optimal flight path and display it on the map for operator confirmation.Re3 The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities, capable of displaying key data such as the drone's current position, altitude, and speed.Re4 The system should ensure that the drone accurately reaches the designated operation area through GPS positioning technology.Re5 The system should support multiple plant protection operation modes, including but not limited to uniform spraying, spot spraying, and variable rate spraying.Re6 The system should have an automatic obstacle avoidance function, capable of identifying and avoiding obstacles to ensure flight safety.Re7 The system should provide fault detection and alarm functions, promptly notifying the operator when the drone malfunctions.Re8 The system should allow the operator to remotely control the drone's takeoff, landing, and emergency stop.Re9 The system should record logs of each flight mission, including flight time, path, and operation area information.Re10 The system should support data export functionality to facilitate the operator's analysis of plant protection effectiveness.Re11 The system should have environmental monitoring capabilities, adjusting operation parameters based on factors such as wind speed and temperature.Re12 The system should provide drone maintenance reminders, prompting the operator to perform necessary inspections and maintenance based on flight frequency and duration.Re13 The system should have multi-drone collaborative operation capabilities, supporting multiple drones executing different plant protection tasks simultaneously.Re14 The system should integrate with agricultural management software to achieve data sharing and synchronization of operation plans.Re15 The system should support user permission management, where operators at different levels have different operational permissions.Re16 The system should provide a function to generate operation reports, helping users evaluate the effectiveness of plant protection and optimize future operation plans.Re17 The system should support remote software updates to ensure that the drone system always runs the latest version of the software.Re18 The system should have data encryption capabilities to protect the user's operation data from unauthorized access..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Vessel Cargo Handling SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input loading and unloading task instructions through an interface, including destination, type of cargo, and quantity.Re2 The system should automatically detect and display the current position and status of the unmanned vessel, including but not limited to battery level, load weight, and navigation speed.Re3 When the system detects a malfunction or abnormal condition in the unmanned vessel, it should immediately notify the operator via the interface and/or SMS.Re4 The system should support the simultaneous operation and management of multiple unmanned vessels and be able to distinguish and track the progress of each vessel's tasks.Re5 The system should have an automatic route planning function that can select the optimal route based on current sea conditions, weather conditions, and traffic rules.Re6 The system should allow operators to manually adjust the route of the unmanned vessel to respond to emergencies or special needs.Re7 The system should record detailed logs for each loading and unloading task, including time, location, operator, cargo information, etc., for subsequent queries and audits.Re8 The system should support remote monitoring, allowing operators to view the working status and environmental data of the unmanned vessel in real-time via the network.Re9 The system should have an automatic cargo recognition function, confirming cargo information by scanning barcodes or RFID tags to ensure accurate loading and unloading.Re10 The system should provide automated control for cargo handling, such as automatically opening and closing hatches, adjusting crane positions, etc., to minimize manual intervention.Re11 The system should automatically detect the safety of the cargo during loading and unloading, such as tilt angle, weight distribution, etc., to prevent accidents.Re12 The system should have an emergency stop function that can immediately halt all operations and sound an alarm when potential dangers are detected.Re13 The system should support integration with other logistics systems, such as port management systems and customs declaration systems, to achieve seamless connectivity.Re14 The system should provide user permission management functions, where users at different levels have different operational permissions to ensure system security and data confidentiality.Re15 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet international usage requirements.Re16 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure rapid restoration of operations in case of system failure.Re17 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical support to help operators quickly get started and resolve common issues.Re18 The system should perform regular self-checks and report its health status, including software versions, hardware status, etc., to remind operators of necessary maintenance.Re19 The system should support remote upgrades to ensure that software and firmware remain up-to-date, enhancing system stability and security..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Pet Healthcare PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register accounts and set secure login credentials.Re2 The system should provide functionality for entering basic pet information, including but not limited to species, age, gender, weight, etc.Re3 The system should allow users to upload their pet's medical records and past treatment details.Re4 The system should have a search function that allows users to search for relevant information based on symptoms, disease names, and other keywords.Re5 The system should be able to display pet health information, disease prevention methods, and treatment recommendations that match the user's search terms.Re6 When search results are empty, the system should inform users through friendly prompts and suggest alternative solutions or contact methods.Re7 The system should support online booking of veterinary consultation services, including video consultations and text-based consultations.Re8 The system should allow users to view and select available time slots, as well as specific veterinarian information for booking.Re9 The system should provide a rapid response mechanism in emergencies, such as one-click calling of nearby pet emergency services.Re10 The system should allow users to upload real-time symptom images or videos of their pets to help veterinarians better understand the pet's condition.Re11 The system should support electronic prescription functions, issued by certified veterinarians and sent directly to partner pet medication suppliers.Re12 The system should offer medication delivery services, with options for different delivery methods, such as home delivery or pickup from designated locations.Re13 The system should display the progress of medication delivery and estimated arrival times to enhance user experience.Re14 The system should support multiple payment methods, including but not limited to credit cards, debit cards, third-party payment platforms, etc.Re15 The system should ensure the security of the payment process to protect users' financial information.Re16 After consulting or purchasing medications, the system should allow users to rate and review the service to help other users make better choices.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality and optimize user experience.Re18 The system should provide a pet health knowledge base, containing information on the prevention and care of common diseases, to enhance users' self-care abilities.Re19 The system should regularly send reminders about pet health, such as vaccination schedules and routine check-up dates, to help users better manage their pets' health.Re20 The system should provide community interaction features, allowing users to share their pet stories, experiences, and insights, promoting communication and support among pet owners..

actual allocation.Re4 The system should support multi-dimensional resource queries, such as filtering by department, time, type, etc.Re5 The system should have real-time monitoring capabilities for tracing.Re12 The system should support multiple data import and export formats to facilitate data exchange with other systems.Re13 The system should have high security to prevent unauthorized access should have good scalability to continuously upgrade as the enterprise grows and technology advances.Re18 The system should provide training materials and online help documents to assist new users in getting started quickly.Re19 The system should support integration with other enterprise management software (such as ERP, CRM) to achieve seamless data connection.Re20 The system should regularly undergo performance assessments and optimizations to ensure stability and efficiency..
