instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Parking Reservation SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register an account and provide necessary personal information, such as phone number, email, etc.Re2 The system should allow users to log in, verify their identity to access reservation functions.Re3 The system should provide a user-friendly interface for querying the location, availability, and price information of parking lots.Re4 The system should support filtering available parking spaces by date and time.Re5 The system should allow users to select specific parking spaces and make reservations.Re6 After a user successfully reserves a parking space, the system should send a reservation confirmation via SMS or email.Re7 The system should allow users to view and manage their reservation records, including canceling reservations.Re8 The system should provide map navigation functionality to help users quickly find their reserved parking space.Re9 The system should support online payment functions, allowing users to pay for parking fees.Re10 The system should allow users to view payment history and refund records.Re11 The system should provide customer support to assist with users' questions and issues.Re12 The system should allow users to rate and provide feedback on the parking lot services.Re13 The system should regularly update real-time information about the parking lots to ensure data accuracy and timeliness.Re14 The system should support multiple languages to meet the needs of different users.Re15 The system should have security measures in place to protect user data..
output: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' standalone='no'?><featureModel><struct><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='IntelligentParkingReservationSystem'><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='UserFeatures'><feature name='RegisterAccount'/><feature name='LogIn'/><feature name='QueryParkingInformation'/><feature name='FilterAvailableParkingSpots'/><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='SelectAndReserveParkingSpot'><feature name='SelectParkingSpot'/><feature name='ConfirmReservation'/></and><alt abstract='true' name='ReceiveReservationConfirmation'><feature mandatory='true' name='SendSMSConfirmation'/><feature mandatory='true' name='SendEmailConfirmation'/></alt><feature name='ManageReservationRecords'/><feature name='NavigateToParkingSpot'/><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='OnlinePayment'><feature name='ChoosePaymentMethod'/><feature name='CompletePayment'/></and><feature name='ViewPaymentAndRefundRecords'/><feature name='GetCustomerSupport'/><feature name='EvaluateService'/><feature name='SwitchLanguages'/></or><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='AdminFeatures'><feature name='UpdateParkingInformation'/><feature name='MaintainSystemSecurity'/></or></and></struct><constraints><rule><imp><var>ManageReservationRecords</var><var>CancelReservation</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>LogIn</var><var>IdentityVerification</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Logistics Delivery SystemRe1 The system should support manually entering or selecting the origin and destination on the map interface.Re2 The system should automatically plan the optimal delivery route and display the estimated arrival time.Re3 When the system cannot find a suitable delivery route, it should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure account security.Re6 The system should provide a user interface to display the status of all pending delivery orders.Re7 The system should maintain user basic information, including but not limited to name, contact information, and default delivery address.Re8 The system should send order confirmation notifications to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to add special delivery requirements on the order details page.Re10 The system should provide multiple delivery options, such as immediate delivery and scheduled delivery.Re11 The system should support unmanned delivery vehicles in conducting cargo handover at designated locations with users.Re12 The system should allow users to select delivery times and locations.Re13 The system should update and display the delivery status and location information of orders in real-time.Re14 The system should support various payment methods, including online payment and cash on delivery.Re15 The system should allow users to choose a payment method at the time of order settlement.Re16 After delivery is completed, the system should allow users to rate and review the service.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality.Re18 The system should provide a fault reporting function, allowing users to report issues encountered during the delivery process at any time.Re19 The system should have an automatic obstacle avoidance function to ensure the safe operation of unmanned delivery vehicles.Re20 The system should be able to handle delivery tasks under adverse weather conditions, ensuring the continuity of delivery services..

name='ChooseDeliveryTimeAndLocation'/></or><feature name='CargoHandover' mandatory='true'/><feature name='DeliveryTimeAndLocationSelection' mandatory='true'/><feature name='RealTimeDeliveryStatus' mandatory='true'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='PaymentMethods'><feature name='ChoosePaymentMethod'/><feature name='ProvideMultiplePaymentMethods'/></or><feature name='PaymentMethodSelection' mandatory='true'/><feature name='ServiceRatingAndReview' mandatory='true'/><feature name='UserFeedbackCollection' mandatory='true'/><feature name='FaultReporting' instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling and Diagnosis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register an account and provide necessary personal information, such as name, age, contact details, etc.Re2 The system should provide a login function, where users need to verify their identity through username and password.Re3 The system should support a password recovery function, allowing users to reset their passwords via email or mobile SMS.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles, including mental health history, counseling preferences, etc.Re5 The system should protect user privacy, ensuring the security of all personal information and counseling records.Re6 The system should provide mental health self-assessment questionnaires to help users preliminarily evaluate their mental state.Re7 The system should recommend appropriate types of counseling services based on the results of the user's self-assessment.Re8 The system should allow users to schedule appointments with counselors, view the counselor's profile, expertise, and available times.Re9 The system should support both video and text-based counseling methods.Re10 The system should record the time, content, and counselor's feedback for each consultation session for user reference.Re11 The system should allow users to rate and provide feedback on counselors after consultations.Re12 The system should provide an emergency psychological assistance function, enabling users to quickly contact professionals in urgent situations.Re13 The system should regularly send mental health knowledge and self-regulation methods to users.Re14 The system should support the creation of online consultation rooms to facilitate real-time communication between users and counselors.Re15 The system should allow users to manage their appointments, including modifying and canceling them.Re16 The system should provide a function to download online consultation records, allowing users to save and review them.Re17 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of different users.Re18 The system should have an automatic backup feature to prevent data loss.Re19 The system should provide transparent displays of counseling service fees, including pricing standards and payment methods.Re20 The system should support multiple payment methods, such as credit cards, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.Re21 The system should allow users to upload relevant files or images during the consultation process to assist in counseling.Re22 The system should offer anonymous consultation options to protect user privacy.Re23 The system should have an intelligent customer service function to answer common user questions and enhance user experience.Re24 The system should support user community functions, where users can share experiences and insights within the community, supporting each other.Re25 The system should regularly conduct user satisfaction surveys to continuously optimize services..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Hotel Room Service SystemRe1 The system should allow guests to enter service requests through touchscreens in their rooms or via a mobile application.Re2 The system should display all available service options, such as dining, cleaning, laundry, etc.Re3 When there are no services that meet the guest's requirements, the system should notify the guest through screen prompts or SMS.Re4 The system should allow guests to create personal accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the guest's login credentials to access their personal account.Re6 The system should display the status of current service requests and history in the guest's personal account.Re7 The system should maintain the guest's contact information (such as phone number or email) as part of the personal account.Re8 The system should send service confirmation information to the guest via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow guests to add special requests or cancel existing requests in their service requests.Re10 The system should display the estimated response time for various services.Re11 The system should allow guests to select the execution time for services.Re12 The system should display the estimated arrival time of service personnel at the room.Re13 The system should provide a service progress tracking feature so guests can understand the current status of their service.Re14 The system should support multiple payment methods, including but not limited to credit cards, debit cards, mobile payments, etc.Re15 The system should allow guests to choose a payment method and complete online payments.Re16 After the service is completed, the system should allow guests to rate or review the quality of the service.Re17 To gather feedback on service quality, the system should encourage guests to submit reviews and ratings.Re18 The system should provide emergency contact options, such as medical emergencies, security alarms, etc.Re19 The system should be able to recommend services based on the guest's historical preferences.Re20 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of guests from different countries and regions.Re21 The system should have high availability and security to ensure data protection and privacy compliance..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Vessel Cargo Tracking PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to search for specific cargo information by entering the cargo number, waybill number, or other identifiers.Re2 The system should display detailed information about all cargos that match the search criteria, including but not limited to the name of the cargo, weight, volume, origin, destination, estimated arrival time, etc.Re3 When no matching cargo information is found, the system should inform the user through a pop-up window or page prompt that the search result is empty and suggest checking the correctness of the input or trying other search conditions.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials to access more detailed cargo tracking information and personalized services.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure that only legitimate users can access the information in their accounts.Re6 The system should display on the user's personal page all tracking records of their cargos, including those being transported and those that have reached their destination.Re7 The system should require users to provide valid contact information, such as an email address, when registering to receive important notifications and service updates.Re8 The system should send cargo status updates to users via email or other designated communication methods, such as notifications when the cargo has been shipped, arrived at a transfer station, is approaching the destination, and other key milestones.Re9 The system should allow users to view and download transport route maps and historical transport data to help them analyze and optimize logistics arrangements.Re10 The system should provide multiple ways to query the status of cargo, such as through the website, mobile application, or telephone customer service.Re11 The system should support real-time updates of cargo location information using technologies like GPS to ensure the accuracy of the location information.Re12 The system should allow users to set reminders to automatically notify them when the cargo reaches a specific location or when its status changes.Re13 The system should provide a fault reporting function where users can report any issues or abnormal situations related to cargo transportation, and the system will respond and handle them promptly.Re14 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of users from different regions.Re15 The system should have high security to protect user personal information and cargo information from unauthorized access.Re16 The system should allow users to rate the transportation service, including aspects such as service quality and punctuality, to help improve the service.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and feedback for continuous improvement of service quality and user experience.Re18 The system should provide detailed help documentation and FAQs to assist users in better utilizing various functions of the platform..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Bus Electronic Stop SystemRe1 The system should update and display the arrival times and location information of buses in real time.Re2 The system should provide multiple bus route options so that passengers can view information on different routes.Re3 The system should support querying specific route or stop information through touch screen or voice input.Re4 The system should display the nearest bus stops and arrival times to help passengers plan their trips.Re5 The system should be able to show the real-time occupancy level of buses to assist passengers in making travel decisions.Re6 The system should provide information on surrounding facilities and services, such as restrooms and restaurants, to enhance user experience.Re7 The system should have a weather forecast function to remind passengers to bring umbrellas or sun protection items.Re8 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of passengers with different language backgrounds.Re9 The system should feature barrier-free design, such as large fonts and high-contrast modes, to facilitate use by passengers with poor vision.Re10 The system should be capable of updating bus route and service change information via network connections to ensure the accuracy of the information.Re11 The system should provide an emergency assistance button for passengers to quickly contact relevant departments in case of emergencies.Re12 The system should have a fault reporting function, allowing passengers to report equipment issues or suggest improvements.Re13 The system should regularly perform self-checks and automatically notify maintenance personnel when faults are detected.Re14 The system should support integration with the city's transportation card system, enabling passengers to obtain boarding information by swiping their cards.Re15 The system should offer a night mode to reduce light pollution and protect passengers' eyesight.Re16 The system should have an advertising playback function, but it must ensure that the ad content does not interfere with the display of primary information.Re17 The system should be able to recommend optimal travel plans based on passengers' frequently used routes.Re18 The system should provide a historical query function for bus routes to help passengers review their past travel records..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Pet Adoption Service PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to enter search criteria (such as type of pet, age, gender, etc.) to find suitable pets.Re2 The system should display all matching pet information based on the search criteria, including photos, age, gender, breed, health status, etc.Re3 When no matching pets are found, the system should notify the user via a pop-up and suggest trying broader search criteria.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles and set login credentials to save personal information and adoption preferences.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure access to personal profiles.Re6 The system should display the status of submitted adoption applications in the user's profile (such as pending, approved, rejected, etc.).Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email, phone number) as an essential part of their profile.Re8 The system should send adoption application confirmation and progress updates to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to bookmark pets of interest for easy future reference.Re10 The system should provide links to educational and care resources related to pets to help users better prepare for adoption.Re11 The system should allow users to schedule visits to shelters or meetings with pets.Re12 The system should offer map and navigation features to help users locate the nearest pet shelter or rescue organization.Re13 The system should allow users to submit adoption applications along with necessary documents and information.Re14 The system should support volunteer registration for participation in pet care and adoption promotion activities.Re15 The system should allow users to donate funds or supplies to shelters to support animal welfare efforts.Re16 After a successful adoption, the system should allow users to share their adoption stories and recent updates about their pets to foster community interaction.Re17 The system should collect feedback and suggestions from users regarding the adoption process to continuously improve services.Re18 The system should provide online consulting services to answer various questions users may have about pet adoption.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re20 The system should periodically push notifications about adoption events and promotional offers to encourage more people to adopt pets..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Fault Diagnosis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for fault information by entering the device name or a description of the fault.Re2 The system should display all fault cases and their solutions related to the search keywords.Re3 When no relevant fault information is found, the system should prompt the user through a pop-up that no matches were found and suggest trying other keywords or contacting customer service.Re4 The system should allow users to create an account and set login credentials to save historical query records and personal preference settings.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure that only legitimate users can access their personal profiles.Re6 The system should display in the user's profile their history of queries, resolved fault issues, and a list of unresolved issues.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email) as part of their profile for subsequent service support.Re8 The system should send fault diagnosis reports and solutions to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should provide online chat support, allowing users to communicate directly with technical support personnel.Re10 The system should allow users to upload fault images or videos to help diagnose problems more accurately.Re11 The system should automatically analyze possible causes of faults based on uploaded images or videos and provide preliminary diagnoses.Re12 The system should allow users to schedule home repair services and select suitable time slots.Re13 The system should display an estimated cost for repair services, including material and service fees.Re14 The system should allow users to view the qualification certificates and reviews of repair technicians.Re15 The system should provide preventive maintenance suggestions to help users reduce the risk of similar issues occurring in the future.Re16 After repairs are completed, the system should allow users to rate and provide feedback on the quality of service.Re17 The system should collect user feedback to improve service quality and optimize the fault diagnosis algorithm.Re18 The system should regularly send reminders for equipment maintenance to help users maintain the good operating condition of their devices..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Enterprise Sales Data Analysis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to upload sales data files through the interface (such as CSV, Excel formats).Re2 The system should be able to automatically parse the uploaded data files and import them into the database.Re3 When the data file format is incorrect or the content does not meet expectations, the system should display error details to the user through the interface.Re4 The system should provide data cleaning functions, such as removing duplicate records, handling missing values, etc.Re5 The system should support multi-dimensional data filtering and screening, for example, by time, region, product category, etc.Re6 The system should provide data visualization tools, such as charts, dashboards, etc., to help users analyze data intuitively.Re7 The system should allow users to define their own report templates and support the automatic generation of reports on a regular basis.Re8 The system should support exporting analysis results in formats including but not limited to PDF, Excel, etc.Re9 The system should have user management capabilities, including creating, editing, and deleting user accounts.Re10 The system should assign different permission levels to different users, such as administrator, analyst, viewer, etc.Re11 The system should record user operation logs for tracking and auditing purposes.Re12 The system should provide data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re13 The system should support real-time data updates so that users can access the latest sales data.Re14 The system should provide predictive analysis tools to help users forecast future sales trends.Re15 The system should integrate machine learning models for advanced analysis, such as customer segmentation, product recommendations, etc.Re16 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of international users.Re17 The system should have good scalability to expand with business growth.Re18 The system should provide API interfaces to support integration with other business systems.Re19 The system should have high-performance data processing capabilities to ensure rapid response to user requests.Re20 The system should provide detailed user guides and technical support to help users get started quickly..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Waste Management Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to log in and manage accounts.Re2 The system should monitor the fill level of waste bins in real-time and upload data to the cloud.Re3 The system should be capable of identifying different types of waste (such as recyclables, hazardous waste, etc.).Re4 When a waste bin reaches a preset fullness threshold, the system should automatically send an alert to the management department.Re5 The system should provide a historical data query function to analyze waste generation trends.Re6 The system should support monitoring multiple locations simultaneously and display the status of each waste bin on a map.Re7 The system should allow users to report abnormal situations, such as waste overflow or illegal dumping.Re8 The system should track reported issues and record the progress of their resolution.Re9 The system should provide data analysis tools to help optimize waste collection routes and times.Re10 The system should support mobile device access for remote monitoring by managers.Re11 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities to promptly detect and report hardware issues.Re12 The system should support multiple language interfaces to meet international needs.Re13 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate integration with third-party systems.Re14 The system should ensure the security of all data transmission, using encryption technology to protect data.Re15 The system should regularly back up data to prevent data loss.Re16 The system should allow setting different user permissions to ensure data security.Re17 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical support to help users get started quickly.Re18 The system should support remote firmware updates to keep the system in its latest state..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Security Warning SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register accounts through a mobile application or web interface.Re2 The system should support multiple login methods, including but not limited to username and password, mobile verification codes, and third-party accounts (such as WeChat, QQ).Re3 The system should provide a device binding function that allows users to associate security devices with their accounts.Re4 The system should be able to monitor the status of all bound devices in real-time and display it on the interface.Re5 The system should have an anomaly detection function that automatically triggers an alarm when intrusion, fire, or other abnormal conditions are detected.Re6 The system should promptly notify users of any anomalies via push notifications, SMS, or phone calls.Re7 The system should allow users to customize alarm rules, such as setting alarm sensitivity during specific time periods.Re8 The system should provide remote control functions, allowing users to operate security devices over the internet.Re9 The system should record all alarm events and user operation logs for easy review and analysis after the fact.Re10 The system should support video surveillance functions, enabling users to view live conditions at home through the app.Re11 The system should provide video recording storage functions, automatically saving video clips from before and after abnormal events.Re12 The system should allow users to set access permissions, managing family members' access and operation rights to the system.Re13 The system should support integration with other smart home devices, such as automatically turning on lights when an intrusion is detected.Re14 The system should have good compatibility and scalability, supporting the addition of new types of security devices in the future.Re15 The system should provide user guides and help documents to assist users in quickly getting started with using the system.Re16 The system should have data encryption and privacy protection measures to ensure user information security.Re17 The system should regularly conduct security checks and software updates to address newly emerging security threats.Re18 The system should provide customer service support, allowing users to contact customer service through online chat, phone, or email to resolve any issues they encounter..
output: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' standalone='no'?><featureModel><struct><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='SmartHomeSecurityWarningSystem'><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='UserManagement'><feature mandatory='true' name='AccountRegistration'/><feature mandatory='true' name='MultipleLoginMethods'/><feature mandatory='true' name='DeviceBinding'/><feature mandatory='true' name='SaveAndAccessPersonalProjects'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='MonitoringAndAlerts'><feature mandatory='true' name='RealTimeMonitoring'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='AbnormalityDetection'><feature name='IntrusionDetection'/><feature name='FireDetection'/><feature name='OtherAbnormalDetection'/></or><feature mandatory='true' name='AlarmNotification'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='AlarmActions'><feature name='SendNotification'/><feature name='AutomaticallyTurnOnLights'/></or><feature mandatory='true' name='CustomizableAlarmRules'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='RemoteControl'><feature mandatory='true' name='RemoteOperation'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='EventLogging'><feature mandatory='true' name='AlarmEventRecording'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserOperationLogs'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='VideoSurveillance'><feature mandatory='true' name='LiveViewing'/><feature mandatory='true' name='VideoRecordingStorage'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='AccessControl'><feature mandatory='true' name='SetAccessPermissions'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='Integration'><feature mandatory='true' name='SmartHomeDeviceIntegration'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='CompatibilityAndScalability'><feature mandatory='true' name='SupportNewDevices'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='UserSupport'><feature mandatory='true' name='UserGuides'/><feature mandatory='true' name='CustomerServiceSupport'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='Security'><feature mandatory='true' name='DataEncryption'/><feature mandatory='true' name='RegularSecurityChecks'/></and><and abstract='true' mandatory='false' name='AdvancedFeatures'><feature name='Use3DModelingTools'/><feature name='ImportExport3DModelFileFormats'/><feature name='RealTimePreviewFunctionality'/><feature name='CustomizeInterfaceLayout'/><feature name='MaterialEditor'/><feature name='LightingShadowSimulation'/><feature name='UndoRedoFunctions'/><feature name='CreateManageMultipleProjects'/><feature name='VersionControlFeatures'/><feature name='AccessOnlineTutorialsResourceLibraries'/><feature name='MultiUserCollaborationMode'/><feature name='PerformanceOptimizationTools'/><feature name='CloudStorage'/><feature name='SubscribeToAdvancedFeatures'/><feature name='ProvideFeedback'/><feature name='RegularUpdates'/><feature name='SecurityMeasures'/><feature name='DetailedDocumentationSupport'/><feature name='MultilingualInterface'/></and></and></struct><constraints><rule><imp><var>AnomalyDetection</var><var>AlarmNotification</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>DeviceBinding</var><var>RealTimeMonitoring</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>VideoSurveillance</var><var>VideoRecordingStorage</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>CustomerServiceSupport</var><var>UserGuides</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>LoginSystem</var><var>RegisterAccount</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>LoginSystem</var><var>SaveAndAccessPersonalProjects</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>LoginSystem</var><var>Use3DModelingTools</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Customized Travel Itinerary SystemRe1 The system should allow users to enter travel information such as destination and date range in the search box.Re2 The system should display matching travel itinerary options based on the user's search criteria.Re3 When there are no matching travel itineraries for the search criteria, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to register and create a personal account.Re5 The system should verify the identity of new users via email.Re6 The system should allow users to log into their personal accounts.Re7 The system should provide a secure password reset function.Re8 The system should display booked and past itineraries in the user's personal account.Re9 The system should allow users to save preferences, such as accommodation type and mode of transportation.Re10 The system should allow users to customize itineraries according to their preferences.Re11 The system should offer various travel packages for users to choose from.Re12 The system should allow users to add interesting itineraries to their favorites.Re13 The system should allow users to view detailed information about each itinerary, including price, included services, cancellation policies, etc.Re14 The system should allow users to contact customer service personnel via online chat or phone.Re15 The system should support multiple payment methods, including credit cards, debit cards, third-party payment platforms, etc.Re16 The system should send booking confirmation and itinerary details to users via email.Re17 The system should allow users to modify or cancel bookings.Re18 The system should provide user review and rating functions for reference by other users.Re19 The system should allow users to upload travel photos and share travel experiences.Re20 The system should provide travel insurance options for users to choose from.Re21 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users from different countries and regions.Re22 The system should provide real-time currency conversion functionality to help international users understand costs.Re23 The system should have a recommendation feature that suggests relevant itineraries based on the user's travel history and preferences..
output: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' standalone='no'?><featureModel><struct><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='TravelItinerarySystem'><feature mandatory='true' name='SearchBox'/><feature mandatory='true' name='DisplayItineraryOptions'/><feature mandatory='true' name='NoMatchNotification'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserRegistration'/><feature mandatory='true' name='EmailVerification'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserLogin'/><feature mandatory='true' name='PasswordReset'/><feature mandatory='true' name='DisplayBookedPastItineraries'/><feature mandatory='true' name='SavePreferences'/><feature mandatory='true' name='CustomizeItinerary'/><feature mandatory='true' name='TravelPackages'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='ItineraryManagement'><feature name='ViewDetailedInformation'/><feature name='AddToFavorites'/></or><feature mandatory='true' name='ContactCustomerService'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='PaymentAndBookingManagement'><feature name='MultiplePaymentMethods'/><feature name='BookingConfirmationEmail'/><feature name='ModifyCancelBookings'/></or><feature mandatory='true' name='UserReviewRating'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UploadPhotosShareExperiences'/><feature mandatory='true' name='TravelInsuranceOptions'/><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='InternationalFeatures'><feature name='MultiLanguageInterface'/><feature name='RealTimeCurrencyConversion'/></and><feature mandatory='true' name='RecommendationFeature'/></and></struct><constraints><rule><imp><var>UserRegistration</var><var>EmailVerification</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Parking Lot Electronic Payment SystemRe1 The system should allow users to automatically record vehicle entry and exit times through license plate recognition technology.Re2 The system should display real-time available parking spaces.Re3 When the parking lot is full, the system should notify users via screen prompts or mobile app notifications.Re4 The system should allow users to register accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure account security.Re6 The system should display parking history and cost details in the user's personal profile.Re7 The system should maintain user contact information as part of their personal profile.Re8 The system should send parking fee bills to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to reserve parking spaces in advance through a mobile application.Re10 The system should provide multiple payment methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, mobile payments, etc.Re11 Users should be able to view the payment status of their chosen payment method through the system.Re12 The system should allow users to inquire about the calculation standards for parking fees.Re13 The system should support both temporary parking and long-term leasing modes, with separate fee calculations for each.Re14 The system should offer an invoice application feature, allowing users to apply for electronic invoices online.Re15 The system should have an exception handling mechanism, such as automatic retries or reminders to users when payments fail.Re16 The system should allow users to rate the quality of parking services or provide feedback.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and suggestions to improve service.Re18 The system should have data analysis capabilities to periodically generate parking lot usage reports for management reference..
output: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8' standalone='no'?><featureModel><struct><and abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='SmartParkingLotSystem'><feature mandatory='true' name='LicensePlateRecognition'/><feature mandatory='true' name='RealTimeParkingSpacesDisplay'/><feature mandatory='true' name='FullLotNotification'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserAccountRegistration'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserLoginVerification'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ParkingHistoryAndCostDetails'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserContactInformation'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ParkingFeeBills'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ParkingSpaceReservation'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='PaymentSelection'><feature name='SelectPaymentMethod'/><feature name='SelectPaymentChannel'/></or><feature mandatory='true' name='PaymentStatusView'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ParkingFeeCalculationStandards'/><alt abstract='true' name='ParkingMode'><feature mandatory='true' name='TemporaryParkingMode'/><feature mandatory='true' name='LongTermLeasingMode'/></alt><feature mandatory='true' name='InvoiceApplication'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ExceptionHandling'/><feature mandatory='true' name='ServiceRating'/><feature mandatory='true' name='UserFeedbackCollection'/><or abstract='true' mandatory='true' name='ReportingTools'><feature name='DetailedReportingAndAnalysisTools'/><feature name='GenerateParkingUsageReports'/></or></and></struct><constraints><extend base='ViewRealTimeAvailableParkingSpaces' extension='ReceiveFullParkingSpaceNotifications'/><include base='RecordVehicleEntryAndExitTimes' addition='LicensePlateRecognition'/><include base='ViewParkingHistoryAndFeeDetails' addition='QueryParkingRecords'/><extend base='ApplyForElectronicInvoices' extension='SavePaymentInformation'/><include base='MaintainPersonalInformation' addition='UpdateContactInformation'/><rule><imp><var>HandlePaymentAbnormalities</var><var>RetryPayment</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Taxi Service SystemRe1 The system should allow users to request unmanned taxi services through a mobile application or website.Re2 The system should display in real-time the locations of available unmanned taxis and their estimated arrival times.Re3 When no unmanned taxis are available nearby, the system should notify users via message of the expected wait time or suggest alternative travel options.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to access their personal accounts.Re6 The system should display current trip status, past trip records, and cost details in the user's personal account.Re7 The system should require users to provide valid contact information (such as a phone number or email address) as part of the registration process.Re8 The system should send trip confirmation and estimated arrival times to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to cancel reservations before the trip begins and clearly state the cancellation policy.Re10 The system should offer multiple payment method options, including but not limited to credit cards, debit cards, and third-party payment platforms.Re11 The system should support immediate payment functions after the trip ends.Re12 The system should allow users to rate and review the service after the trip.Re13 The system should collect user feedback to improve service quality and user experience.Re14 The system should have an emergency response mechanism, such as a one-click alarm function.Re15 The system should ensure passenger privacy and data security, complying with relevant laws and regulations.Re16 The system should provide a trip-sharing feature, allowing users to share trip information in real-time with family or friends.Re17 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re18 The system should provide accessible design to ensure that all users, including those with disabilities, can use the service conveniently..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Meteorological Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register and log in to access personalized meteorological data and services.Re2 The system should provide real-time meteorological data updates, including key indicators such as temperature, humidity, wind speed, and rainfall.Re3 The system should be able to automatically adjust and provide the most relevant meteorological data based on geographical location.Re4 The system should allow users to set specific meteorological thresholds, and when these thresholds are reached, the system will automatically send alerts.Re5 The system should provide historical meteorological data analysis functions to help users identify long-term trends.Re6 The system should support multiple device connections, such as smartphones, tablets, and PCs, ensuring that users can view data across different platforms.Re7 The system should have data visualization capabilities, presenting meteorological data in the form of charts and graphs to facilitate user understanding and analysis.Re8 The system should allow users to export meteorological data for further research and analysis.Re9 The system should provide weather forecasting functions to predict weather conditions over the next few days, helping farmers make planting decisions.Re10 The system should integrate soil moisture monitoring functions to help farmers understand soil moisture conditions and optimize irrigation plans.Re11 The system should support data exchange with other agricultural management systems to achieve comprehensive agricultural management.Re12 The system should offer a multi-language interface to support users from different regions.Re13 The system should have high availability and reliability to ensure it operates normally even under severe weather conditions.Re14 The system should have user permission management functions, allowing administrators to assign different access permissions to different user groups.Re15 The system should regularly back up user data to prevent data loss.Re16 The system should provide technical support and online help documentation to assist users in resolving issues encountered during use.Re17 The system should allow users to submit feedback and suggestions to continuously improve system functionality.Re18 The system should support API interfaces to facilitate third-party developers in creating extended applications..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register accounts and provide basic personal information, such as name, contact details, and email address.Re2 The system should support user login via email or mobile phone number.Re3 The system should enable users to search for psychological counselors on the platform, supporting keyword searches (such as counselor's name, areas of expertise, etc.).Re4 The system should display search results, including the counselor’s basic information, professional background, consultation fees, and user reviews.Re5 When there are no matching search results, the system should inform the user through a prompt message.Re6 The system should allow users to view detailed profile pages for each counselor, including service descriptions, consultation methods, appointment times, etc.Re7 The system should allow users to book consultation slots and select the method of consultation (such as online video, phone consultation, etc.).Re8 The system should send appointment confirmation messages to users via SMS or email, containing the consultation time, method, and precautions, etc.Re9 After the consultation, the system should remind users to evaluate the counselor, including aspects like service attitude and professional ability.Re10 The system should allow users to rate and provide written evaluations of the counselor, and these evaluations should be displayed to other users.Re11 The system should protect user privacy, ensuring that evaluation content does not reveal personal information.Re12 The system should provide filtering and sorting functions, allowing users to find counselors based on different criteria (such as rating, price, etc.).Re13 The system should allow users to save favorite counselors to a favorites list for easy re-booking in the future.Re14 The system should provide a payment interface for consultation fees, supporting multiple payment methods.Re15 The system should ensure the security of the payment process, protecting users' payment information.Re16 The system should allow users to cancel appointments and refund part or all of the fees according to platform policies.Re17 The system should regularly assess the quality of counselors' services to ensure the overall service quality of the platform.Re18 The system should have customer support to resolve issues users encounter while using the platform..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Hotel Smart Check-in SystemRe1 The system should allow guests to book rooms online and view available room types and prices.Re2 The system should support multiple payment methods, including credit cards, debit cards, mobile payments, etc., to facilitate guest payment for reservations.Re3 The system should provide an electronic key function, allowing guests to receive access permissions for room door locks via a mobile application.Re4 The system should allow guests to select specific floors or room types through a mobile app before arriving at the hotel.Re5 The system should automatically send check-in guides and hotel facility information to guests who have made reservations.Re6 The system should support self-service check-in and check-out processes to reduce front desk waiting times.Re7 The system should be equipped with facial recognition functions to verify guest identities, enhancing check-in security.Re8 The system should allow guests to request additional services during their stay, such as room service or car booking, through a mobile app.Re9 The system should be able to record guest preferences and service history to provide a more personalized service experience.Re10 The system should offer multi-language support to ensure that international guests can easily use all features.Re11 The system should allow guests to contact customer service directly through a mobile app to resolve any issues encountered during their stay.Re12 The system should have emergency handling functions, such as one-click calls to the front desk or security personnel.Re13 The system should support contactless check-out, allowing guests to complete check-out procedures directly through the app after leaving their room.Re14 The system should be capable of generating electronic bills and sending them to guests via email or SMS.Re15 The system should provide satisfaction survey forms to invite guests to evaluate their stay experience, helping the hotel improve service quality.Re16 The system should support points accumulation and redemption functions to encourage guests to return.Re17 The system should protect guest privacy, ensuring the secure storage and transmission of all personal information.Re18 The system should be regularly updated and optimized to adapt to new technological trends and changes in customer needs..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Boat Automatic Navigation SystemRe1 The system should be capable of receiving target waypoint coordinates input from the operator.Re2 The system should monitor the unmanned boat's position in real-time and display the current position on a map.Re3 When the unmanned boat deviates from the planned route, the system should automatically adjust its heading to return to the designated path.Re4 The system should have obstacle avoidance capabilities, able to detect obstacles ahead and change course or stop when necessary.Re5 The system should record navigation data, including speed, heading, navigation time, etc., and allow exporting log files.Re6 The system should allow remote operators to manually control the unmanned boat, including starting, stopping, turning, etc.Re7 The system should integrate weather forecasting to ensure preventive measures are taken before bad weather.Re8 The system should support fleet management, allowing simultaneous monitoring and control of multiple unmanned boats.Re9 The system should have an emergency shutdown function that immediately stops all operations when abnormal conditions are detected.Re10 The system should periodically check the battery status of the unmanned boat and issue warnings when the power is low.Re11 The system should maintain continuous communication with shore-based communication stations to ensure stable data transmission.Re12 The system should support mission planning, allowing operators to preset multiple tasks and waypoints.Re13 The system should have fault diagnosis capabilities, able to identify common hardware and software issues and suggest solutions.Re14 The system should provide navigation assistance tools, such as nautical charts and tide tables, to help optimize navigation routes.Re15 The system should support cooperative operations between unmanned boats, enabling formation navigation.Re16 The system should have data encryption functions to protect the security of navigation data.Re17 The system should allow users to customize alarm thresholds, such as speed limits, deviation distances from the route, etc.Re18 The system should provide detailed navigation reports, including distance traveled, time spent, fuel consumption, etc.Re19 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re20 The system should have self-learning capabilities, optimizing route planning through the continuous accumulation of navigation data..

You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Bus Passenger Flow Statistics and Analysis SystemRe1 The system should allow real-time collection of video data from bus stops and inside buses through cameras.Re2 The system should be capable of automatically identifying the number of passengers in the video and counting them.Re3 The system should provide a function to query historical passenger flow data, supporting filtering by date, time, station, etc.Re4 The system should be able to predict the passenger flow at specific stations for a future period.Re5 The system should have an abnormal passenger flow detection function, which automatically triggers an alarm when unusually high or low passenger flows are detected.Re6 The system should support multi-user login, with different permission levels allowing users to access different data and functions.Re7 The system should record user login information, including login time and location, to ensure system security.Re8 The system should provide a data export function, allowing users to export passenger flow statistics to Excel or other common formats.Re9 The system should be capable of integrating with existing bus scheduling systems to achieve data sharing.Re10 The system should support access from mobile devices, enabling managers to check passenger flow situations anytime and anywhere.Re11 The system should have data encryption capabilities to protect passenger privacy and data security.Re12 The system should perform regular self-checks to identify and report any issues that could affect performance.Re13 The system should provide API interfaces to support third-party applications calling passenger flow data.Re14 The system should have a log recording function, detailing all operations for easy problem tracking and auditing.Re15 The system should be able to handle large-scale data, ensuring stable operation even during peak hours.Re16 The system should support multilingual interfaces to meet international usage requirements.Re17 The system should provide user training manuals and technical support to help users get started quickly.Re18 The system should have flexible configuration options, allowing administrators to adjust system parameters according to actual needs..

search criteria in the customer database (such as name, phone number, email, etc.).Re2 The system should display all customer records that match the search criteria, including but not limited to basic information, historical contact records, and service records.Re3 When the search criteria do not find any matching customer records, the system should prompt the customer service personnel through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow customer service personnel to create new customer profiles and fill in necessary customer information, such as name, contact details, company name, etc.Re5 The system should verify the login credentials of customer service personnel to ensure that only authorized personnel can access customer data.Re6 The system should provide an interface for customer service personnel to view lists of active service requests and resolved service requests for customers.Re7 The system should maintain each customer's email information as part of their profile.Re8 The system should support automatic or manual sending of service request confirmation emails to customers, including request details and service progress.Re9 The system should allow customer service personnel to record each communication with customers, including call logs, email exchanges, etc.Re10 The system should provide multiple service request processing statuses, such as pending, in process, resolved, etc., and allow customer service personnel to update these statuses.Re11 The system should support creating and managing service requests, including assigning them to specific customer service personnel or teams.Re12 The system should allow customer service personnel to add notes or internal comments to customer profiles or service requests for follow-up purposes.Re13 The system should support sending service update notifications to customers via email or SMS, such as service completion, delays, etc.Re14 The system should provide reporting functions, including customer satisfaction reports, service request handling time reports, etc.Re15 The system should allow administrators to configure different user roles and permissions to ensure data security and access control.Re16 The system should support online submission of feedback or ratings by customers to evaluate service quality.Re17 The system should automatically collect customer feedback and ratings and integrate them into customer profiles for subsequent analysis.Re18 The system should provide a knowledge base function to facilitate quick lookup of solutions to common problems by customer service personnel.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of customers in different regions.Re20 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security and integrity.Re21 The system should support integration with other enterprise systems, such as CRM systems, ERP systems, etc., to achieve data synchronization and sharing..

You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Convenience Store Intelligent Anti-Theft SystemRe1 The system should have high-precision facial recognition capabilities for customer identity verification.Re2 The system should be able to monitor all areas of the store in real time and record video data.Re3 The system should automatically detect abnormal behavior (such as lingering for extended periods, obstructing cameras, etc.) and trigger alarms.Re4 The system should support instant communication with local police to quickly report serious security incidents.Re5 The system should be able to remind customers in the store to follow the rules through audio and visual signals.Re6 The system should be able to automatically identify whether goods have been correctly scanned and paid for, preventing unpaid items from leaving the store.Re7 The system should provide an emergency button for use by employees or customers in emergencies.Re8 The system should have intelligent access control functions, allowing only verified customers to enter.Re9 The system should be able to integrate with smart shelves and cash registers within the store to achieve automated management.Re10 The system should support remote monitoring and management, allowing managers to check the store's status at any time.Re11 The system should have data analysis capabilities, regularly generating security reports to help optimize anti-theft measures.Re12 The system should be able to send entry and exit notifications to customers via a mobile app, enhancing user experience.Re13 The system should support multiple language interfaces to meet the needs of customers with different language backgrounds.Re14 The system should have a high level of security to protect customer privacy.Re15 The system should be capable of automatic updates and maintenance to ensure long-term stable operation..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Parking Lot Guidance SystemRe1 The system should allow automatic license plate recognition when vehicles enter the parking lot.Re2 The system should update and display the number of available parking spaces in real-time.Re3 The system should be able to provide directions to the nearest available parking space via displays or mobile applications.Re4 The system should support multi-level parking lots and be able to distinguish the status of parking spaces on different floors.Re5 The system should record the occupancy and departure times for each parking space.Re6 The system should have billing capabilities, calculating charges based on parking duration and type of parking space.Re7 The system should support multiple payment methods, including but not limited to cash, credit cards, and mobile payments.Re8 The system should be able to receive payment information through a mobile application or entry terminal and generate electronic receipts.Re9 The system should allow users to reserve parking spaces through a mobile application.Re10 The system should notify users via SMS or app push notifications of successful parking space reservations.Re11 The system should have an overtime reminder function, notifying users via SMS or app when their vehicle exceeds the reserved stay time.Re12 The system should support parking space navigation to help users quickly find their reserved parking space.Re13 The system should have a parking space release detection function to ensure the validity of parking space reservations.Re14 The system should allow administrators to monitor parking space usage through a backend management system.Re15 The system should support administrators in adjusting parking space prices and setting special period rates.Re16 The system should record all transactions and operation logs for auditing and query purposes.Re17 The system should support manual intervention in emergencies, such as locking and unlocking parking spaces.Re18 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re19 The system should be capable of integrating with third-party payment platforms and navigation systems.Re20 The system should provide channels for user feedback to collect user experience and suggestions for improvement..
