instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Cleaning Vehicle Scheduling SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to mark cleaning areas and obstacles on the map.Re2 The system should display all available unmanned cleaning vehicles and their current locations.Re3 When a cleaning task is assigned, the system should automatically calculate the optimal route.Re4 The system should allow administrators to manually adjust the task routes of cleaning vehicles.Re5 The system should record the work logs of each cleaning vehicle, including start time, end time, and cleaned area.Re6 The system should display the real-time status of each cleaning vehicle (such as cleaning, standby, charging, etc.).Re7 The system should provide a fault reporting function that automatically notifies administrators when a cleaning vehicle malfunctions.Re8 The system should allow administrators to set cleaning priorities to adjust tasks based on environmental changes.Re9 The system should support remote control functions, allowing administrators to take over the cleaning vehicle in emergencies.Re10 The system should provide maintenance reminders for cleaning vehicles, suggesting maintenance times based on usage frequency and mileage.Re11 The system should be able to generate cleaning reports, including data on cleaning efficiency, energy consumption, etc.Re12 The system should support multi-user management, allowing different levels of administrators to access different information.Re13 The system should have a security authentication mechanism to ensure that only authorized personnel can operate it.Re14 The system should provide a historical task query function for easy review and analysis by administrators.Re15 The system should support data exchange with other management systems (such as urban management systems).Re16 The system should integrate weather forecasts to automatically adjust cleaning schedules to accommodate adverse weather conditions.Re17 The system should allow users to customize cleaning modes (such as deep cleaning, daily cleaning, etc.).Re18 The system should have an emergency stop function to ensure that cleaning vehicles can be immediately stopped under any circumstances.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to facilitate use by users in different regions.Re20 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Pest and Disease Early Warning SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials.Re2 The system should verify user login credentials to access personal accounts.Re3 The system should allow users to upload field images or videos for pest and disease detection.Re4 The system should use AI technology to automatically identify types of pests and diseases in uploaded content.Re5 The system should provide detailed reports on identification results, including the name of the pest or disease, severity, and recommended measures.Re6 The system should support a multi-language interface to accommodate users from different regions.Re7 The system should allow users to set specific pest and disease warning thresholds for crops.Re8 The system should automatically send warning notifications to users based on the set thresholds.Re9 The system should notify users of pest and disease warnings via SMS, email, or in-app notifications.Re10 The system should provide a history query function, allowing users to view pest and disease conditions over a past period.Re11 The system should integrate weather data and combine it with weather forecasts to provide pest and disease risk assessments.Re12 The system should allow users to mark handled pest and disease events for tracking and management.Re13 The system should support community exchanges among users to share pest and disease control experiences and methods.Re14 The system should provide online customer service support to help users solve problems during use.Re15 The system should ensure the security and privacy protection of all user data.Re16 The system should regularly update the pest and disease database to maintain the accuracy and timeliness of information.Re17 The system should support mobile device access to facilitate user usage anytime, anywhere.Re18 The system should provide user operation guides and FAQs to help new users get started quickly..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register an account and provide necessary personal information, such as name, contact details, etc.Re2 The system should allow users to log in to their accounts, using a username and password for authentication.Re3 The system should support a password recovery function, allowing users to reset their passwords via email or mobile SMS.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles, including descriptions of their mental health status, counseling preferences, etc.Re5 The system should intelligently recommend suitable psychological counselors based on the user's personal profile and counseling needs.Re6 The system should allow users to view detailed profiles of psychological counselors, including certification credentials, professional background, areas of expertise, etc.Re7 The system should provide an online consultation booking feature, enabling users to select consultation times and complete reservations.Re8 The system should remind users of their consultation booking times via SMS or email.Re9 The system should support online payment functions, allowing users to choose different payment methods.Re10 The system should allow users to rate and review psychological counselors after consultations.Re11 The system should record users' consultation histories, making it easy for users to view past consultation records.Re12 The system should protect user privacy, ensuring that user information is not leaked.Re13 The system should offer anonymous consultation options, allowing users to consult without revealing their real identities.Re14 The system should support multiple languages to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re15 The system should provide multi-channel consulting services, including video, voice, and text consultations.Re16 The system should allow users to cancel or reschedule booked consultations.Re17 The system should provide self-assessment tools to help users evaluate their own mental state.Re18 The system should regularly send mental health knowledge and advice to users to promote their mental well-being.Re19 The system should support community features, allowing users to share experiences and exchange insights within the community.Re20 The system should provide links to emergency psychological assistance hotlines so that users can receive timely help in emergencies..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Hotel Intelligent Check-Out SystemRe1 The system should allow guests to initiate a check-out request through smart devices in the room or via a mobile application.Re2 The system should display each step of the check-out process and provide real-time updates.Re3 If any issues arise during the check-out process (such as an unpaid bill or an uncleaned room), the system should promptly inform the guest via screen messages or mobile notifications.Re4 The system should allow guests to view and confirm the final bill, including all fee details.Re5 The system should support multiple payment methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, and mobile payments, to facilitate guest checkout.Re6 The system should automatically check for any damage to room facilities or missing items and notify the front desk and service staff if any anomalies are detected.Re7 The system should record the guest's check-out time and status to optimize hotel operational efficiency.Re8 The system should allow guests to choose whether they need an invoice at check-out and specify the type of invoice and the method of receipt.Re9 The system should provide an electronic signature function, enabling guests to sign the check-out form via a touchscreen or mobile application.Re10 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of international guests.Re11 The system should allow guests to leave feedback or suggestions at check-out to improve service quality.Re12 The system should automatically update the room status to 'Ready for Cleaning' or 'Checked Out' to help the cleaning team schedule their work.Re13 The system should integrate with the hotel's central reservation system to ensure that check-out information is updated in sync.Re14 The system should provide privacy protection measures to ensure the security of guest personal information.Re15 The system should allow guests to choose whether to retain their personal information to simplify future check-in processes.Re16 The system should support a quick check-out option, allowing guests with no additional charges to complete the check-out process directly.Re17 The system should provide a self-service luggage storage option, allowing guests to continue storing their luggage after check-out.Re18 The system should allow guests to obtain an electronic receipt through a mobile application or smart device.Re19 The system should provide an emergency contact function, enabling guests to immediately contact the front desk or customer service if they encounter problems during check-out..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Ship Cargo Management SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input or upload cargo lists through the interface.Re2 The system should automatically recognize and record basic information for each batch of cargo, such as weight, volume, and destination.Re3 The system should be capable of generating an optimal loading plan based on cargo information.Re4 The system should support the scheduling and monitoring of multiple unmanned ships to ensure the effectiveness and safety of cargo transportation.Re5 The system should provide real-time location tracking, allowing operators to check the position and status of the ships at any time.Re6 The system should have an alarm function for abnormal situations, such as deviation from the route or equipment failure.Re7 The system should allow operators to set navigation routes and speed limits to adapt to different navigation conditions.Re8 The system should integrate weather forecasting functions and adjust navigation plans according to weather conditions.Re9 The system should provide cargo arrival predictions to help the receiving party prepare.Re10 The system should support electronic signature confirmation of receipt and transmit the confirmation information back to the system.Re11 The system should have a cargo handover record function, detailing the time, location, and personnel involved in each handover.Re12 The system should support historical data queries for subsequent analysis and auditing.Re13 The system should provide user permission management to ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive information.Re14 The system should support remote control functions to intervene in the operation of unmanned ships in emergencies.Re15 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to prevent data loss.Re16 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet international usage needs.Re17 The system should have a log recording function to record all operations and system events, facilitating problem tracing and responsibility determination.Re18 The system should provide API interfaces to support data exchange and integration with other logistics systems.Re19 The system should have security measures to prevent unauthorized access and data leaks.Re20 The system should support mobile device access to enable operators to monitor and manage the system anytime and anywhere..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Bus Vehicle Maintenance SystemRe1 The system should allow maintenance personnel to record basic vehicle information, such as license plate number, model, etc.Re2 The system should provide an interface for entering and editing the maintenance history of vehicles.Re3 The system should automatically remind maintenance personnel of upcoming regular inspections or maintenance tasks.Re4 The system should support maintenance personnel in uploading files related to specific maintenance tasks, such as inspection reports or repair guides.Re5 The system should allow maintenance personnel to search for historical maintenance records of specific vehicles.Re6 The system should provide a function that notifies users through a pop-up window when no matching maintenance records are found.Re7 The system should allow administrators to create and manage maintenance personnel accounts.Re8 The system should verify the login credentials of maintenance personnel to access the system.Re9 The system should display a list of vehicles and maintenance tasks assigned to each maintenance personnel in their personal profile.Re10 The system should send reminders of upcoming maintenance tasks to maintenance personnel via email or SMS.Re11 The system should allow maintenance personnel to record the specific content of each maintenance session, materials used, and labor hours.Re12 The system should display the current status of vehicles, such as whether they are under repair, awaiting parts, etc.Re13 The system should provide a function that allows maintenance personnel to update the status of vehicles.Re14 The system should be able to generate maintenance reports and support exporting them in PDF or other common formats.Re15 The system should allow administrators to view maintenance statistics for all vehicles, such as average repair time, common fault types, etc.Re16 The system should support a multi-language interface to accommodate maintenance personnel from different regions.Re17 The system should have permission management features to ensure that users at different levels can only access information within their permission scope.Re18 The system should log all user operations to facilitate auditing and problem tracking.Re19 The system should support data integration with other bus management systems (such as scheduling systems) to achieve data sharing.Re20 The system should have high availability and fault tolerance to ensure that critical business operations are not affected by single points of failure..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Remote Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow users to log in to their accounts via a mobile application or web interface.Re2 The system should provide real-time video streaming so that users can view live footage from any camera in their home.Re3 The system should support multi-user access control, allowing the homeowner to grant other family members or guests temporary or permanent access permissions.Re4 The system should record all user login and operation logs for security review purposes.Re5 The system should allow users to set and manage the operating modes of devices (such as lights, door locks, thermostats, etc.).Re6 The system should be able to receive status updates from smart devices and reflect these statuses in real-time on the user interface.Re7 The system should provide an alert function that immediately notifies users when abnormal situations are detected (such as doors or windows being illegally opened, smoke alarms, etc.).Re8 The system should support controlling smart devices via voice commands, such as using a smart speaker as an intermediary.Re9 The system should allow users to configure automated scenarios, such as away mode, home mode, etc., to start multiple device operations with one click.Re10 The system should provide energy usage reports to help users understand their household's energy consumption and promote energy conservation.Re11 The system should support remote software updates to ensure all connected devices remain up-to-date.Re12 The system should have good compatibility and be able to connect with mainstream smart device brands and models on the market.Re13 The system should provide user manuals and online help documents to facilitate quick user adoption.Re14 The system should protect user privacy and not use user data for commercial purposes without permission.Re15 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re16 The system should allow users to customize the interface layout, such as the position and size of device icons.Re17 The system should provide diagnostic tools to help users resolve common technical issues.Re18 The system should have an emergency contact setting feature, which can automatically notify pre-set emergency contacts in case of severe alerts.Re19 The system should support cloud storage services, allowing users to back up important videos or images to the cloud.Re20 The system should provide data analysis functions to optimize device performance and user experience based on user usage habits..

their respective interfaces.Re2 The system should provide role management functionality to assign different permissions to users at different levels (such as administrators, department managers, regular employees).Re3 The system should support the creation and editing of basic employee information, including name, position, department, etc.Re4 The system should allow setting performance evaluation cycles (such as monthly, quarterly, annually).Re5 The system should provide a function for customizing performance metrics to accommodate the needs of different positions.Re6 The system should support multi-dimensional performance evaluations, including but not limited to work quality, work efficiency, teamwork, innovation capabilities, etc.Re7 The system should allow setting weights to reflect the importance of different performance indicators.Re8 The system should support 360-degree evaluations, i.e., from colleagues, subordinates, superiors, and self-assessments.Re9 The system should provide templates for performance evaluation forms and allow customization based on needs.Re10 The system should automatically calculate performance scores and generate evaluation reports.Re11 The system should allow administrators or department managers to review and approve evaluation results.Re12 The system should support exporting performance evaluation results for archiving and evaluation goals that align with the company's strategic objectives.Re15 The system should provide a function for formulating performance improvement plans to help employees clarify improvement directions.Re16 The system should support linking performance evaluation results with salary adjustments, promotions, etc., to motivate employees.Re17 The system should have data security measures to ensure the confidentiality of employee personal information and evaluation results.Re18 The system should provide multilingual support to meet the needs of international enterprises.Re19 The system should support mobile access to facilitate performance evaluations anytime, anywhere.Re20 The system should provide links to training and development resources to help employees enhance their skills..

You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Supermarket Self-checkout EquipmentRe1 The system should allow users to scan product barcodes or QR codes via a touchscreen interface.Re2 The system should display the price, name, and stock status of scanned products.Re3 When a product barcode or QR code cannot be recognized, the system should prompt the user on the screen to rescan or manually enter the product code.Re4 The system should support multi-language interfaces to accommodate users with different language backgrounds.Re5 The system should provide voice guidance features to assist users in completing the self-checkout process.Re6 The system should allow users to add products to their shopping cart and display the total number and amount of items in the cart.Re7 The system should allow users to remove products from the shopping cart.Re8 The system should display available payment methods (such as credit card, debit card, mobile payment, etc.).Re9 The system should allow users to select a payment method for payment.Re10 The system should display payment confirmation information on the screen and receipt.Re11 The system should print a receipt after the transaction is completed; the receipt should include a list of purchased items, total price, payment method, and transaction time.Re12 The system should support electronic receipt options, allowing users to choose to receive receipts via email.Re13 The system should have anti-fraud mechanisms, such as identifying the behavior of repeatedly scanning the same product.Re14 The system should automatically detect whether the products in the shopping cart match the scanned products to prevent missing or incorrect scans.Re15 The system should have an emergency call function to allow users to seek help from staff when encountering problems.Re16 The system should allow users to review detailed information about all selected items before checkout, including price, weight, etc.Re17 The system should support return processes, allowing users to scan return items and print return slips.Re18 The system should record data from each transaction for inventory management and sales analysis.Re19 The system should provide user satisfaction survey options to encourage users to provide feedback to improve service quality..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Automation Control SystemRe1 The system should allow users to control smart devices in their home via mobile application or voice commands.Re2 The system should support various types of smart devices, such as lights, air conditioning, curtains, security cameras, etc.Re3 The system should provide a scheduled task function, allowing users to set specific times for specific actions to be executed.Re4 The system should be able to automatically adjust device status based on environmental conditions (such as light and temperature).Re5 The system should allow users to create and manage multiple scene modes, such as away mode, home mode, etc.Re6 The system should have remote access capabilities, allowing users to control home devices via the internet when they are out.Re7 The system should provide device status reports, including operational status, energy consumption statistics, etc.Re8 The system should support multiple user accounts, with each family member having an independent account and permission settings.Re9 The system should have security measures to prevent unauthorized access and control.Re10 The system should provide fault alarm functions, promptly notifying users when devices malfunction.Re11 The system should support integration with third-party smart home platforms to achieve broader device compatibility.Re12 The system should have energy-saving optimization functions, automatically adjusting devices to reduce energy consumption.Re13 The system should offer a user-friendly interface design to ensure that users of all ages can easily use it.Re14 The system should support integration with voice assistants, such as Alibaba's Tmall Genie, to enable voice control.Re15 The system should have a self-diagnostic function, regularly checking device connections and operational status.Re16 The system should support firmware updates for devices to ensure continuous improvement in performance and security.Re17 The system should provide detailed user guides and help documents to facilitate quick user adoption.Re18 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions..

and travel dates.Re2 The system should display all matching travel products based on the search criteria, including hotels, flights, attraction tickets, etc.Re3 When no matching travel products are found, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window and provide similar or recommended travel options.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles and set login credentials, such as usernames and passwords.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure access to personal profiles.Re6 The system should display a list of booked itineraries and historical travel records in the user's personal profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email and phone number) as an essential part of the personal profile.Re8 The system should send itinerary confirmations and important updates to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow users to add and remove travel products from their itinerary planning.Re10 The system should display different travel packages, including independent travel and group tours.Re11 The system should allow users to customize their itinerary arrangements, such as selecting specific hotels, flight times, etc.Re12 The system should allow users to choose modes of transportation, such as air, train, car, etc.Re13 The system should provide a detailed schedule for the trip, including select a payment method for booking their trips.Re16 After the trip, the system should allow users to rate or review their travel experience.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality and recommendation algorithms.Re18 The system should provide pre-travel tips and advice, such as weather forecasts, local customs, etc.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of international users.Re20 The system should offer 24/7 customer support to answer user questions and resolve issues encountered..

attraction number on the touch screen.Re2 The system should display all destination or attraction options that match the input.Re3 When no matching destination or attraction is found, the system should inform the user via the screen prompt.Re4 The system should be able to automatically plan the optimal route from the current location to the destination and provide an estimated arrival time.Re5 The system should offer voice navigation features to guide passengers through each step of the journey while the sightseeing vehicle is in motion.Re6 The system should allow passengers to view the real-time location and travel path of the sightseeing vehicle.Re7 The system should support multiple languages to meet the needs of tourists from different countries and regions.Re8 The system should be able to adjust route recommendations based on weather and road conditions.Re9 The system should allow passengers to select via the touch screen whether to turn on or off facilities such as air conditioning and music inside the vehicle.Re10 The system should provide a help button for emergency situations, allowing passengers to contact staff or security departments with one click.Re11 The system should record data from each trip for subsequent service optimization and troubleshooting.Re12 The system should have an automatic obstacle avoidance function to ensure the sightseeing vehicle can safely stop or detour when encountering obstacles.Re13 The system should allow administrators to remotely monitor the status and location of the sightseeing vehicle to provide timely assistance.Re14 The system should offer multiple sightseeing routes for passengers to choose from, including but not limited to historical routes, natural scenery routes, etc.Re15 The system should support booking sightseeing vehicle services in advance via mobile devices.Re16 The system should allow passengers to evaluate and provide feedback on the service through their mobile devices after the trip.Re17 The system should regularly update map data and attraction information to ensure accuracy and timeliness.Re18 The system should provide real-time displays of the sightseeing vehicle's charging status to ensure normal operation.Re19 The system should have intelligent scheduling capabilities, automatically allocating resources based on the location and usage of the sightseeing vehicles.Re20 The system should support simultaneous use by multiple users, ensuring that each passenger can independently operate the navigation interface..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling Appointment Service SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register and create personal accounts.Re2 The system should allow users to log in and verify their account credentials.Re3 The system should allow users to update their profiles, including contact information, emergency contacts, etc.Re4 The system should provide a search function for online counselors, supporting filters such as specialty, counseling method (e.g., in-person, video, phone), etc.Re5 The system should display all matching psychological counselors based on search criteria along with their brief introductions.Re6 When no matching psychological counselor is found through the search, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window.Re7 The system should allow users to view each psychological counselor's schedule and available appointment times.Re8 The system should allow users to select consultation times and initiate reservation requests.Re9 The system should send reservation confirmation notifications to both users and psychological counselors, including the reservation time, method, and precautions.Re10 The system should allow users to cancel reservations and notify the relevant psychological counselors.Re11 The system should allow psychological counselors to accept or reject reservation requests and promptly notify users.Re12 The system should record users' reservation history, including completed consultations and canceled reservations.Re13 The system should allow users to rate and review the services of psychological counselors after consultations.Re14 The system should collect and display the overall ratings and reviews of psychological counselors.Re15 The system should provide payment functionality for consulting services, supporting multiple payment methods.Re16 The system should allow users to query and manage their payment records.Re17 The system should provide privacy protection measures to ensure the security of user information.Re18 The system should allow users to modify or delete their personal accounts at any time.Re19 The system should provide customer support to help users resolve issues encountered during use.Re20 The system should regularly back up data to prevent data loss..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Automated Cargo Loading and Unloading System for Unmanned VesselsRe1 The system should allow operators to input cargo loading and unloading task commands through an interface.Re2 The system should display in real-time the position, status, and progress of cargo loading and unloading of unmanned vessels.Re3 When the system detects abnormal conditions (such as equipment failure, unsuitable weather conditions for operations, etc.), it should notify the operator via pop-up windows or messages.Re4 The system should support multi-user login and allow users with different levels of access to use different functional modules based on their permissions.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure that only authorized personnel can operate critical functions.Re6 The system should record all operation logs, including task execution history, fault reports, and maintenance records, for easy querying and auditing.Re7 The system should provide cargo information management functions, including the entry and editing of attributes such as cargo type, weight, and volume.Re8 The system should be capable of automatically calculating the optimal cargo loading plan to improve transportation efficiency and safety.Re9 The system should support data communication between unmanned vessels and shore-based control centers to ensure timely information exchange.Re10 The system should have remote monitoring capabilities, allowing operators to monitor the working status of unmanned vessels in real-time from locations far from the operation site.Re11 The system should provide fault diagnosis functions to help quickly identify the cause of problems and reduce downtime.Re12 The system should support autonomous navigation of unmanned vessels to designated loading and unloading points, reducing human intervention.Re13 The system should be able to handle multiple types of cargo loading and unloading, including but not limited to containers and bulk cargo.Re14 The system should have environmental adaptability, enabling stable operation under various climatic conditions.Re15 The system should provide safety protection measures, such as collision warnings and emergency shutdowns, to ensure operational safety.Re16 The system should support integration with external logistics systems to achieve data sharing and business collaboration.Re17 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical support to help users get started quickly.Re18 The system should regularly perform self-checks and maintenance reminders to ensure long-term stable operation..

When no matching bus routes or stations are found for the user's input, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure secure access to their personal account.Re6 The system should display a list of favorite bus routes and stations in the user's personal account.Re7 The system should allow users to add or remove favorites from bus routes and stations for quick access.Re8 The system should send upcoming bus arrival reminders to users via SMS or in-app notifications.Re9 The system should provide a map view showing the current location of bus routes and estimated arrival times.Re10 The system should support an offline mode, allowing users to view downloaded bus route and station information.Re11 The system should allow users to set multiple reminder time points, such as 10 minutes, 5 minutes before the bus arrives, etc.Re12 The system should provide weather forecast information to assist users in planning their travel.Re13 The system should be able to handle emergencies, such as temporary changes to bus routes, and promptly notify users.Re14 The system should allow users to submit feedback or suggestions regarding bus services.Re15 The system should collect user feedback to improve service quality and user experience.Re16 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of different user groups.Re17 The system should provide help documents or FAQs to facilitate users' understanding of how to use various features.Re18 The system should have privacy protection measures in place to ensure the security of user personal information..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Scene Linkage SystemRe1 The system should allow users to control smart devices in their home through voice commands or screen input.Re2 The system should be able to recognize multiple languages and dialects to accommodate different user habits.Re3 The system should support inter-device linkage, for example, automatically turning on lights when the door lock is unlocked.Re4 The system should provide scene mode setting functions, such as 'Away Mode,' 'Sleep Mode,' etc., allowing one-button switching of multiple device states.Re5 The system should allow users to customize scene modes, setting device linkage rules according to personal preferences.Re6 The system should enable remote control of all smart devices at home via a mobile app.Re7 The system should have security monitoring capabilities, immediately notifying users if abnormal situations (such as smoke, intrusion) are detected.Re8 The system should support compatibility with third-party smart devices to ensure broad device support.Re9 The system should provide energy consumption statistics, helping users understand the power usage of various devices in their home.Re10 The system should have a scheduled task function, allowing users to set specific operations to execute at specific times.Re11 The system should support multi-user management, allowing different family members to have varying access permissions.Re12 The system should be capable of recording and analyzing user usage habits, intelligently recommending optimized settings.Re13 The system should offer fault diagnosis features, assisting users in quickly identifying and resolving issues.Re14 The system should support integration with voice assistants, such as compatibility with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant, etc.Re15 The system should ensure the security of data transmission, using encryption technology to protect user privacy.Re16 The system should provide detailed user guides and technical support to help users better utilize the system.Re17 The system should allow users to set up emergency contacts, automatically notifying them in case of an emergency.Re18 The system should support OTA (Over-The-Air) updates to ensure that the system remains up-to-date..

facial recognition or RFID cards to enter and exit the community.Re2 The system should monitor all entrances and exits in real-time and record all entry and exit activities.Re3 When unauthorized entry attempts are detected, the system should immediately trigger an alarm and send notifications to property management.Re4 The system should allow property managers to view live video streams and historical recordings through an interface.Re5 The system should support special monitoring of specific areas (such as children's play areas, swimming pools, etc.) and be able to set alert statuses for specific time periods.Re6 The system should allow residents and property managers to receive security notifications and emergency updates via a mobile application.Re7 The system should have vehicle recognition capabilities, automatically recording vehicle information entering and exiting the community, and be able to compare this information with the resident database to verify vehicle ownership.Re8 The system should provide visitor registration functionality, allowing residents to pre-register visitor information through a mobile application to facilitate quick verification when visitors enter.Re9 The system should support rapid response mechanisms in emergencies, such as a one-touch alarm button that directly connects to the property management center or local police station.Re10 The system should be capable of generating and managing electronic passes for access control in temporary or special situations.Re11 The system should have data analysis capabilities to regularly generate community safety reports, including but not limited to entry and exit records, abnormal events, etc.Re12 The system should allow residents to submit maintenance requests or complaints and suggestions through a mobile application and track the progress of handling.Re13 The system should have the ability to integrate with smart home systems, enabling residents to remotely control security devices at home, such as door locks, cameras, etc.Re14 The system should support multi-language interfaces to accommodate residents with different language backgrounds.Re15 The system should ensure the security and privacy of all data, complying with relevant data protection regulations.Re16 The system should provide user-friendly interface design to ensure that residents of all age groups can use it easily.Re17 The system should regularly perform self-checks and maintenance to ensure stable operation and promptly report any technical issues to the technical support team.Re18 The system should support remote upgrades so that property managers can conveniently update system software without on-site operations..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Library Borrowing SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for books by entering the book title, author, or ISBN number via the screen.Re2 The system should display a list of all books that match the search criteria, including basic information such as the book title, author, publication date, etc.Re3 When no matching books are found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account, fill in personal information, and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure that only legitimate users can access their personal data.Re6 The system should display a borrowing history and a list of currently borrowed books on the user's personal profile page.Re7 The system should maintain the user's email information as part of their personal data and use it to send important notifications.Re8 The system should send borrowing confirmation information to the user via email, including the expected return date and borrowing rules.Re9 The system should allow users to renew books online, provided that the book has not been reserved by another user.Re10 The system should provide a reservation function that allows users to reserve books that have already been borrowed.Re11 When a reserved book is returned, the system should automatically notify the reserving user.Re12 The system should allow users to view their personal points status, which can be earned through borrowing books and used to exchange for small gifts or extend borrowing periods.Re13 The system should provide a book recommendation feature, suggesting similar or related books based on the user's borrowing history.Re14 The system should support online queries about the availability of books, including whether they are borrowed out, the remaining available quantity, etc.Re15 The system should provide an e-reading function, allowing users to read supported e-books directly online.Re16 The system should allow users to review and rate books to assist other users in making borrowing decisions.Re17 To promote community interaction, the system should support interactions between users regarding book reviews, including comment replies and likes.Re18 The system should have an overdue reminder function, notifying users via SMS or email when books are approaching or have exceeded the return date to prompt timely returns.Re19 The system should provide detailed user guides and help documents to assist new users in quickly understanding how to use the borrowing system..

s</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>ViewHelpDocuments</var><var>ReceiveOverdueReminders</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>RegisterAccount</var><var>LoginVerification</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>BorrowBooks</var><var>RenewBooks</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>BorrowBooks</var><var>ReserveBooks</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>BorrowBooks</var><var>ReceiveOverdueReminders</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Energy Optimization SystemRe1 The system should allow users to log in to their accounts via a mobile application or web interface.Re2 The system should provide real-time energy consumption data display.Re3 The system should be able to automatically identify and connect to smart devices in the home.Re4 The system should allow users to manually add or remove smart devices.Re5 The system should provide a function to query historical device energy consumption records.Re6 The system should automatically adjust device settings based on user usage habits to achieve energy-saving effects.Re7 The system should offer energy-saving mode options, such as away mode, sleep mode, etc.Re8 The system should be able to receive weather forecasts and adjust indoor temperature and lighting accordingly.Re9 The system should provide personalized energy-saving suggestion reports.Re10 The system should support remote control of all smart devices in the home.Re11 The system should be able to automatically adjust power usage strategies based on electricity price fluctuations.Re12 The system should have fault detection and diagnostic functions, promptly notifying users of any device abnormalities.Re13 The system should support multi-user permission management, distinguishing access permissions for different family members.Re14 The system should regularly update software to ensure security and functionality.Re15 The system should provide data backup and recovery functions to prevent data loss.Re16 The system should allow users to set personalized reminders, such as upcoming electricity bill payments.Re17 The system should support voice control, compatible with mainstream smart speaker platforms.Re18 The system should have a well-designed user interface to make operations more intuitive and convenient.Re19 The system should be able to integrate with other third-party smart home platforms.Re20 The system should provide detailed help documentation and online customer support..

system should notify the user via a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access personal accounts.Re6 The system should display parking records and information about currently parked vehicles in the user's personal account.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as mobile phone number) as an essential part of the personal account.Re8 The system should send parking location guidance to users via SMS or in-app messages.Re9 The system should allow users to view the layout of the parking lot and available spaces on a map.Re10 The system should provide navigation functions to help users navigate from their current location to their vehicle's location.Re11 The system should support users controlling the entry/exit gates of the parking lot remotely through the app (if applicable).Re12 The system should allow users to set favorite parking spots for quick access to commonly used parking areas.Re13 The system should be able to record each parking session's time and calculate parking fees.Re14 The system should allow users to pay parking fees online and offer multiple payment method options.Re15 The system should send parking fee invoices to users in electronic form.Re16 The system should allow users to view historical parking records, including parking times, locations, and costs.Re17 The system should provide an emergency contact function so that users can quickly contact parking lot management when encountering issues.Re18 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re19 The system should have a well-designed user interface to ensure simple and intuitive operation.Re20 The system should regularly update data to ensure the accuracy of vehicle location information..

crop type, planting area, and soil type.Re2 The system should provide historical yield data for reference based on the input crop type and environmental conditions.Re3 The system should use weather accuracy.Re5 The system should support users in uploading custom soil test reports to optimize the prediction model.Re6 The system should provide future yield predictions based on machine learning algorithms, accompanied by uncertainty analysis.Re7 The system should allow users to set yield targets and provide management recommendations (such as irrigation, fertilization, etc.) based on these targets.Re8 The system should have user management capabilities, allowing the creation of multiple user accounts, each with independent access permissions.Re9 The system should ensure the security and privacy protection of all user data, complying with relevant laws and regulations.Re10 The system should provide data analysis reports, including but not limited to yield trends, input-output ratios, system.Re15 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re16 The system should regularly update the prediction models to reflect the latest provide interfaces with other agricultural management software to achieve seamless data integration..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register accounts and fill in personal information, including name, contact information, email, etc.Re2 The system should provide login functionality, allowing users to log in with their username and password.Re3 The system should support a forgotten password feature, enabling users to reset their passwords via email or mobile SMS.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal profiles, including uploading avatars and writing personal descriptions.Re5 The system should permit psychological counselors to upload professional qualification certificates and undergo identity verification.Re6 The system should provide a search function, enabling users to search for psychological counselors based on keywords (such as counselor names, specialized fields, etc.).Re7 The system should display search results, including basic information about the counselor, specialized fields, user reviews, etc.Re8 The system should allow users to book consultations, selecting consultation times and methods (such as video, phone, text, etc.).Re9 The system should offer a calendar view to help users view and manage their consultation appointments.Re10 The system should notify users of upcoming consultation appointments via SMS or email.Re11 The system should allow users to cancel or modify existing consultation appointments.Re12 The system should provide online payment functionality, supporting various payment methods (such as credit cards, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.).Re13 The system should record detailed information for each consultation, including consultation time, method, cost, etc.Re14 The system should allow users to rate and review counselors after consultations.Re15 The system should provide a message center where users can view system notifications, consultation appointment reminders, payment confirmations, etc.Re16 The system should support the uploading of files or images during consultations to facilitate communication and record-keeping.Re17 The system should implement privacy protection measures to ensure the security of user information.Re18 The system should provide a frequently asked questions (FAQ) section to help users quickly understand how to use the platform.Re19 The system should allow users to set consultation preferences, such as preferred consultation methods and times.Re20 The system should provide an online consultation room that supports video, audio, and text chat.Re21 The system should allow psychological counselors to view and manage their own appointment situations.Re22 The system should provide data analysis tools to help counselors understand their business status.Re23 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of different users.Re24 The system should provide customer support so that users can receive timely assistance when encountering issues during use..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Boat Cargo Delivery SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input the delivery address and cargo details through the interface.Re2 The system should automatically calculate and display the optimal delivery route based on the input address and cargo details.Re3 When the input address is outside the service range of the unmanned boat, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure login.Re6 The system should display the user's delivery history, including current and past delivery statuses.Re7 The system should maintain the user's basic information, such as name and contact information, as necessary information for delivery.Re8 After the user places an order, the system should send a delivery confirmation message via email or SMS.Re9 The system should provide options for users to cancel or modify unprocessed delivery requests.Re10 The system should display multiple unmanned boat delivery time options, such as immediate delivery and scheduled delivery.Re11 The delivery task should be assigned by the system to the most suitable unmanned boat, and track its location and status.Re12 The system should allow users to select specific delivery time slots.Re13 The system should update and display the current status and estimated arrival time of the order in real-time.Re14 The system should support various payment methods, such as credit card, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.Re15 The system should allow users to select a payment method for their order and complete online payment.Re16 After delivery is completed, the system should allow users to submit ratings and reviews of the delivery experience.Re17 The system should collect user feedback to improve service quality and user experience.Re18 The system should provide a fault reporting function that allows users to promptly contact customer service when encountering issues.Re19 The system should have weather forecast integration capabilities to avoid adverse weather affecting deliveries.Re20 The system should provide a delivery range query function to help users understand the service coverage area..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Remote Medical Consultation SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for medical questions or symptoms through voice or screen input.Re2 The system should display medical advice, articles, or videos related to the search.Re3 When no relevant medical information is found from the search, the system should notify the user via a pop-up and provide an option to contact customer service.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal health records and set access credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access personal health records.Re6 The system should display past consultation records, health data, and medication reminders in the user's personal health record.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as mobile phone number or email) as an essential part of the personal health record.Re8 The system should send consultation confirmations and appointment reminders to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow users to upload medical reports or imaging materials for doctors' reference.Re10 The system should support video call functionality to enable face-to-face consultations between users and doctors.Re11 The system should offer multi-language support to ensure smooth use by users with different language backgrounds.Re12 The system should allow users to select consultation times and automatically remind them at the scheduled time.Re13 The system should record the specific content of each consultation and save it in the user's personal health record.Re14 The system should display available payment methods, including but not limited to credit cards, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.Re15 The system should allow users to choose a payment method for consulting services.Re16 After the consultation, the system should allow users to rate or review the doctor's service.Re17 To improve service quality, the system needs to collect user ratings and reviews.Re18 The system should have an emergency call function that can automatically dial emergency services when it detects an emergency situation with the user.Re19 The system should provide mental health support services, including but not limited to stress management, psychological counseling, etc.Re20 The system should regularly provide users with health tips and preventive measures to help them maintain good living habits..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Environment Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow users to view real-time field environment data (such as temperature, humidity, light intensity, etc.) through a web or mobile application interface.Re2 The system should automatically record and store all environmental data so that users can query historical data.Re3 When environmental parameters exceed preset thresholds, the system should immediately notify users via SMS or in-app notifications.Re4 The system should provide graphical display functions for environmental parameters, such as trend charts and bar charts, to help users intuitively understand changes.Re5 The system should support user-defined settings for optimal growth environmental parameter ranges for different crops.Re6 The system should have data analysis capabilities to predict future environmental trends based on historical data and provide management suggestions.Re7 The system should allow users to remotely control field equipment, such as irrigation systems and greenhouse shading curtains.Re8 The system should provide device operation status monitoring, including but not limited to online status and fault alarms.Re9 The system should support multi-user permission management to ensure that users with different roles can only access and operate content within their permission scope.Re10 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re11 The system should provide API interfaces to support integration with other agricultural management systems or third-party services.Re12 The system should have a well-designed user interface to ensure ease of operation and improve user experience.Re13 The system should support multiple language versions to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re14 The system should regularly update software to fix known issues and add new features to continuously improve service quality.Re15 The system should provide detailed help documentation and technical support to help users quickly get started.Re16 The system should have a user feedback mechanism to collect user opinions and suggestions for subsequent product improvements.Re17 The system should protect user privacy and must not disclose any personal information without user consent.Re18 The system should support offline mode, allowing recent data records to be viewed even when the network is unstable..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Vessel Autonomous Navigation SystemRe1 The system should be capable of receiving navigation task instructions from the operator, including destination, route, etc.Re2 The system should be able to monitor the unmanned vessel's position, speed, and direction in real-time, and display this information on the user interface.Re3 When the system detects any abnormal situations (such as obstacles, weather changes), it should immediately alert the operator via the interface and automatically adjust the course to avoid danger.Re4 The system should have an automatic obstacle avoidance function, capable of identifying and bypassing both fixed and moving obstacles on the water surface and underwater.Re5 The system should be able to communicate with multiple unmanned vessels to achieve formation navigation or collaborative operations.Re6 The system should support remote control functions, allowing the operator to take over control of the unmanned vessel when necessary.Re7 The system should record navigation data, including trajectories, speed, environmental conditions, etc., for subsequent analysis and optimization.Re8 The system should provide health monitoring functions, regularly checking the status of mechanical and electronic components of the unmanned vessel to predict potential failures.Re9 The system should be able to automatically return to a pre-set charging station or safe area for recharging or docking when the power is low.Re10 The system should support multiple communication protocols to ensure stable communication under different network environments.Re11 The system should have environmental adaptability, capable of operating normally under various climatic conditions, including extreme environments such as high temperatures, low temperatures, and high humidity.Re12 The system should be able to automatically execute safety measures according to preset safety rules in emergency situations, such as stopping navigation, activating emergency buoyancy devices, etc.Re13 The system should support remote software updates to ensure that the unmanned vessel can receive the latest features and security patches.Re14 The system should have data encryption functions to protect the security of navigation data, preventing unauthorized access or tampering.Re15 The system should provide detailed log records, including operation logs, error logs, etc., to facilitate problem tracking and responsibility determination.Re16 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different countries and regions.Re17 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities, automatically checking the status of each subsystem before each start-up to ensure the system is in optimal working condition.Re18 The system should provide a user-friendly operation interface, making it easy for operators to configure and monitor the status of the unmanned vessel..

via the internet.Re6 The system should allow users to customize security zones to set different security levels based on different living scenarios.Re7 The system should record historical data of all security events and provide downloadable reports.Re8 The system should have learning capabilities to optimize security policies based on user usage habits.Re9 The system should support multi-user access permission settings, allowing family members to have different access levels as needed.Re10 The system should have robust encryption mechanisms to ensure the security and privacy protection of user data.Re11 The system should perform regular self-checks to ensure that all connected devices are functioning properly and notify users when faults are detected.Re12 The system should provide an easy-to-understand user interface, making it simple for users to configure and manage security settings.Re13 The system should support integration with third-party emergency response services, such as police and fire departments, to automatically contact relevant agencies in emergencies.Re14 The system should provide detailed help documentation and video tutorials guiding users on how to install and use each feature.Re15 The system should allow users to set automated security rules for specific time periods, such as automatically enhancing protection at night.Re16 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re17 The system should offer 24/7 customer service support to resolve issues users encounter during use.Re18 The system should have the ability to adapt to network environments, maintaining basic functionality even when the network is unstable..

You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Parking Reservation and Payment SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register online and set login credentials.Re2 The system should provide a password recovery function, allowing users to reset their passwords via email or SMS.Re3 The system should support user login using a mobile phone number or email.Re4 The system should allow users to view and edit their personal information, including contact details and vehicle information.Re5 The system should allow users to search for and select parking lots.Re6 The system should display real-time availability of parking spaces in the selected parking lot.Re7 The system should allow users to reserve parking spaces for specific time periods.Re8 The system should show confirmation information after a successful reservation, including the parking space number and time.Re9 The system should send reservation confirmation notifications to users via SMS or email.Re10 The system should allow users to cancel reservations and receive refunds according to the rules.Re11 The system should provide navigation to the selected parking lot.Re12 The system should support multiple payment methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, and third-party payment platforms.Re13 The system should allow users to pay for parking fees online before entering the parking lot.Re14 The system should provide a function to download electronic invoices.Re15 The system should allow users to view their historical parking records and detailed expense information.Re16 The system should support user evaluations and feedback on the service provided by the parking lot.Re17 The system should allow administrators to manage parking lot information, including the number of parking spaces and operating hours.Re18 The system should provide data analysis functions to help administrators optimize operations.Re19 The system should have security measures in place to protect user data privacy.Re20 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of different users..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Logistics Fleet Management SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input basic vehicle information through the interface, such as license plate numbers and models.Re2 The system should be capable of displaying in real-time the location, status (such as driving, parked, under maintenance), and current tasks of all vehicles.Re3 When a vehicle encounters a fault or abnormal situation, the system should automatically send an alarm notification to designated operators or maintenance teams.Re4 The system should support the creation and management of multiple user accounts, each with different permission levels, such as administrator, operator, and maintenance personnel.Re5 The system should have an identity verification function to ensure that only authorized users can access specific functional modules.Re6 The system should provide detailed vehicle maintenance records, including historical repair records, maintenance reminders, and component replacement suggestions.Re7 The system should be able to automatically generate and export vehicle operation reports, including mileage, fuel consumption, task completion status, etc.Re8 The system should allow operators to assign tasks to each vehicle and view the progress of task execution.Re9 The system should support multiple route planning options, selecting the optimal route for each task by considering factors like traffic conditions and weather.Re10 The system should be able to monitor cargo conditions in real-time, such as temperature and humidity, to ensure safe transportation.Re11 The system should provide cargo tracking functionality, allowing customers to query the current location and estimated arrival time of their goods through the system.Re12 The system should support data exchange with external systems (such as customer information systems and traffic management systems) to achieve information synchronization.Re13 The system should provide an emergency response mechanism, enabling rapid adjustments to task plans and vehicle dispatching when encountering urgent situations.Re14 The system should record all operation logs, including logins, task assignments, route changes, etc., for audit and issue tracking purposes.Re15 The system should support remote control functions, allowing operators to manually intervene in vehicle operations when necessary.Re16 The system should provide data analysis tools to help management optimize operational strategies and improve efficiency.Re17 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet international usage requirements.Re18 The system should have good scalability, capable of smooth upgrades as business grows..
