instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Psychological Counseling Trainer PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register and create personal accounts, including providing their name, contact information, and professional background.Re2 The system should support user login via email address and password.Re3 The system should verify that the email address provided by the user is valid and ensure that the password meets security standards.Re4 The system should allow users to modify information in their profile, including but not limited to avatar, personal bio, contact information, etc.Re5 The system should provide a course catalog displaying all available psychological counseling training courses.Re6 The system should allow users to search for specific courses using keywords.Re7 When search results are empty, the system should inform the user through a prompt message that no relevant courses were found.Re8 The system should allow users to view detailed information about each course, including the course outline, instructor introduction, schedule, etc.Re9 The system should support users in adding courses of interest to a favorites list for future reference.Re10 The system should allow users to register for courses and send a confirmation email upon successful registration.Re11 The system should provide online payment functionality, supporting various payment methods such as credit card, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.Re12 The system should record the user's registration history and learning progress, allowing users to check at any time.Re13 The system should provide an online learning environment, supporting features like video playback, real-time interaction, discussion forums, etc.Re14 The system should allow users to participate in course discussions and interact with other students and instructors.Re15 The system should provide course evaluation tools, allowing users to rate the quality of the course after completion.Re16 The system should support users in downloading learning materials related to the course, such as lecture notes, test questions, etc.Re17 The system should have a certificate issuance function, allowing users to obtain an electronic certificate upon completing the course and passing the assessment.Re18 The system should support users in managing their certificates, including viewing, downloading, and sharing them.Re19 The system should provide customer service support, allowing users to contact customer service via online chat, phone, or email to resolve inquiries.Re20 The system should regularly send notifications to users about course updates and new course launches..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Hotel Front Desk Self-Check-In SystemRe1 The system should allow guests to enter their personal information on a touch screen, including name, contact details, etc.Re2 The system should be able to read ID card or passport information for quick guest identity verification.Re3 The system should be capable of integrating with the hotel reservation system to automatically retrieve the guest's booking records.Re4 If the guest does not have a reservation, the system should provide an on-site booking function.Re5 The system should support switching between multiple language interfaces to accommodate guests of different nationalities.Re6 The system should allow guests to choose room types and floor preferences.Re7 The system should display real-time room status, such as availability and price information.Re8 The system should allow guests to make payments using credit cards, debit cards, or mobile payment methods.Re9 The system should print check-in vouchers and room cards, with the option for electronic versions.Re10 The system should automatically update the check-in information in the hotel management system.Re11 The system should provide a simple check-out process, including billing and receipt printing functions.Re12 The system should allow guests to request additional services or facilities, such as breakfast, laundry service, etc.Re13 The system should be able to handle special requests, such as non-smoking rooms, cribs, etc.Re14 The system should have an emergency contact function to enable guests to quickly seek help when encountering problems.Re15 The system should provide privacy protection measures to ensure the security of guest information.Re16 The system should support sending check-in confirmation and check-out reminders via email or SMS.Re17 The system should allow guests to provide feedback or ratings after check-in to help improve service quality.Re18 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities and be able to automatically notify technical personnel when issues arise..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Ship Cargo Handling RobotRe1 The system should be able to automatically identify and locate the position of cargo on the ship.Re2 The system should possess multi-sensor fusion technology to ensure high-precision operations during cargo handling.Re3 When abnormal conditions (such as cargo tilting or sliding) are detected, the system should immediately stop operations and alert the operator via an alarm.Re4 The system should support remote control to allow for human intervention in special circumstances.Re5 The system should have the capability to automatically plan loading and unloading routes to optimize operational efficiency.Re6 The system should log detailed records of each loading and unloading task, including time, location, operation status, and other information.Re7 The system should seamlessly integrate with the navigation system of the unmanned ship to ensure that the cargo handling process is coordinated with the sailing schedule.Re8 The system should provide a real-time monitoring interface displaying current loading and unloading progress and status.Re9 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities to automatically identify and report fault types when issues arise.Re10 The system should support the handling of various types of cargo, including but not limited to containers and bulk goods.Re11 The system should operate normally under different weather conditions, including rainy and foggy environments.Re12 The system should have an energy-saving mode to reduce power consumption in standby or low-load states.Re13 The system should be capable of integrating with port management systems to achieve data sharing and process automation.Re14 The system should be equipped with an emergency stop button to ensure all actions can be quickly halted in any situation for safety.Re15 The system should support regular maintenance reminders to ensure long-term stable operation of the equipment.Re16 The system should be able to receive updates over the network to keep the software and hardware up-to-date.Re17 The system should provide a user-friendly interface to enable operators to get started quickly.Re18 The system should have data backup functionality to prevent the loss of important information..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Public Transport Vehicle Scheduling SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to input and edit bus route information through an interface.Re2 The system should display all registered buses and their current locations.Re3 When the system detects that a vehicle has deviated from its predetermined route, it should notify the dispatcher through a pop-up or message.Re4 The system should allow dispatchers to create, edit, and delete vehicle information.Re5 The system should authenticate logged-in users to ensure that only authorized personnel can access sensitive information.Re6 The system should provide real-time updates on vehicle location and status (e.g., in operation, out of service, under maintenance).Re7 The system should support adjusting departure intervals based on actual needs.Re8 The system should be able to predict and display the estimated arrival times at each station.Re9 The system should allow passengers to query the nearest bus stop and estimated arrival time via a mobile application.Re10 The system should provide vehicle maintenance reminders based on mileage or usage time.Re11 The system should record and analyze historical data to optimize scheduling plans.Re12 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re13 The system should be capable of handling emergencies, such as temporary route changes or vehicle scheduling during emergencies.Re14 The system should allow dispatchers to manually intervene in the automatic scheduling process to handle special situations.Re15 The system should provide detailed reporting functions, including operational efficiency and passenger flow.Re16 The system should support integration with other traffic management systems to achieve data sharing.Re17 The system should provide a user-friendly interface for ease of use by non-technical dispatchers.Re18 The system should support multiple communication methods to ensure that scheduling information is promptly conveyed to drivers and passengers.Re19 The system should have high availability and fault tolerance to ensure service continuity.Re20 The system should support mobile applications to facilitate real-time viewing of bus dynamics by passengers.Re21 The system should provide API interfaces to enable third-party developers to extend application functionality..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Pet Adoption Information PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to register an account on the platform and set a username and password.Re2 The system should verify the email address provided by the user to ensure its validity.Re3 The system should allow users to log in using their email and password.Re4 The system should allow users to upload photos and fill out personal information (such as name, contact details, etc.) in their profile.Re5 The system should allow users to search for pets based on specific breed, age, or gender.Re6 The system should display all matching pet information based on the search criteria.Re7 When no matching pets are found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re8 The system should allow users to view detailed information about each pet, including images, age, gender, personality description, etc.Re9 The system should allow users to submit an adoption application, including filling out reasons for adoption, descriptions of the home environment, etc.Re10 The system should send the user's adoption application to the corresponding pet rescue organization or individual.Re11 The system should allow pet rescue organizations or individuals to view and manage received adoption applications.Re12 The system should provide a messaging system that allows users to communicate with pet rescue organizations or individuals.Re13 The system should allow pet rescue organizations or individuals to update the status of pets (e.g., adopted, awaiting adoption, etc.).Re14 The system should display basic information about pet rescue organizations or individuals, such as name, contact details, rescue mission, etc.Re15 The system should allow users to save favorite pets for easy reference later.Re16 The system should provide adoption guidelines to help users understand the adoption process and precautions.Re17 The system should allow users to rate and review their adoption experience, promoting improvements in service quality.Re18 The system should allow users to view reviews and ratings from other adopters as a reference.Re19 The system should offer community features that allow users to share adoption stories, exchange pet care experiences, etc.Re20 The system should periodically push pet care knowledge and event information to increase user engagement..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Fault Self-Diagnosis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for troubleshooting solutions by entering the device name or model.Re2 The system should display a list of troubleshooting solutions that match the search keywords.Re3 When no matching solution is found, the system should prompt the user via a pop-up and suggest contacting customer service.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set a personal password.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure account security.Re6 The system should provide a user dashboard displaying the status of all connected smart home devices.Re7 The system should automatically detect abnormal conditions of the devices and mark them on the user dashboard.Re8 The system should send fault alerts to users via email or in-app notifications.Re9 The system should allow users to manually report device faults.Re10 The system should recommend initial troubleshooting steps based on the type of device fault.Re11 The system should provide detailed troubleshooting guides, including video tutorials and illustrated instructions.Re12 The system should support remote diagnostic features, allowing technical support personnel to remotely access the device.Re13 The system should record the results of each fault diagnosis for users to view historical records.Re14 The system should provide a frequently asked questions (FAQ) section to help users quickly resolve issues.Re15 The system should allow users to submit feedback after resolving a fault to improve services.Re16 The system should regularly update the fault database to ensure the timeliness and accuracy of solutions.Re17 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re18 The system should offer 24/7 online customer support to assist users with complex problems..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Travel Itinerary Planning AssistantRe1 The system should allow users to enter their destination, date range, and other preference conditions in the search box.Re2 The system should display corresponding travel routes, hotels, transportation options, etc., based on the user's search criteria.Re3 When there are no matching results for the user's search criteria, the system should inform the user via a pop-up or message and provide suggestions for modifying the search criteria.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal accounts and set login credentials, such as usernames and passwords.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure that only legitimate users can access their personal information.Re6 The system should display saved travel plans, booking records, and past trips on the user's personal profile page.Re7 The system should require users to provide a valid email address during registration and maintain it as part of their contact information.Re8 The system should send trip confirmations, updates, and reminders to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to add interesting travel items to their favorites or wish lists.Re10 The system should offer multiple travel service options, including but not limited to accommodation, transportation, attraction tickets, and tour guide services.Re11 The system should support users in combining selected services to form personalized travel packages.Re12 The system should allow users to view and compare prices, reviews, and service details of different services.Re13 The system should provide an itinerary planning tool to help users schedule daily activities, including time management and budget control.Re14 The system should allow users to modify or cancel booked services and clearly display related fee policies.Re15 The system should support various payment methods, such as credit cards, debit cards, third-party payment platforms, etc.Re16 The system should allow users to submit reviews and ratings of services after their trip, for reference by other users.Re17 The system should collect user reviews and ratings to improve service quality and enhance user experience.Re18 The system should provide customer support services, including online chat, phone consultations, and FAQs.Re19 The system should support multiple languages to facilitate use by international users.Re20 The system should provide a mobile app version to enable users to plan and manage their travels anytime, anywhere..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Parking Lot Vehicle Recognition and Payment SystemRe1 The system should be able to automatically recognize the license plate numbers of vehicles entering the parking lot.Re2 The system should record the time when vehicles enter the parking lot.Re3 The system should support multiple entry and exit configurations to accommodate parking lots of different sizes.Re4 The system should be able to automatically calculate the duration of vehicle parking and corresponding fees.Re5 The system should provide an online payment interface that supports various payment methods (such as WeChat Pay, Alipay, etc.).Re6 The system should automatically deduct fees when a vehicle leaves and update the departure time of the vehicle.Re7 The system should have an exception handling mechanism, for example, providing a manual intervention option when a vehicle cannot be normally identified.Re8 The system should be able to generate detailed parking records reports for managers to view.Re9 The system should support membership card functions, allowing users to register as members to enjoy preferential policies.Re10 The system should be able to send reminders via SMS or app push messages to inform car owners about payment information.Re11 The system should provide query services, allowing users to check parking records and fee details through their license plate number.Re12 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re13 The system should support remote management, enabling managers to monitor and manage the operation status of the parking lot remotely through the network.Re14 The system should have anti-cheating mechanisms to prevent economic losses caused by illegal operations.Re15 The system should be able to connect with urban traffic management systems to achieve data sharing and management.Re16 The system should provide user feedback channels to collect user opinions and suggestions, continuously optimizing service quality.Re17 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of international users.Re18 The system should have good scalability, supporting future additional features and services..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned School Bus Safety Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow real-time monitoring of both inside and outside the school bus through cameras, and transmit video streams to a central monitoring platform.Re2 The system should have facial recognition capabilities to automatically identify the identities of students getting on and off the bus, and record the times they board and disembark.Re3 The system should immediately send alerts to school administrators and parents when abnormal behavior (such as a student not getting off at the designated stop) is detected.Re4 The system should monitor the driving status of the school bus, including speed and deviation from the route, to ensure that the vehicle follows the prescribed route.Re5 The system should have an emergency response mechanism, such as automatically dialing emergency numbers and sending the current location to rescue centers in case of traffic accidents or vehicle malfunctions.Re6 The system should allow parents to check their child's boarding status via a mobile app, including whether they have boarded, the estimated arrival time, and the current driving position.Re7 The system should provide vehicle maintenance reminder functions, suggesting regular inspections and maintenance based on vehicle usage and manufacturer recommendations.Re8 The system should record data from each trip, including driving time, distance traveled, and stops made, for subsequent analysis and management.Re9 The system should support multi-user permission management, ensuring that different roles (such as drivers, school administrators, and parents) can only access data and functions relevant to their responsibilities.Re10 The system should integrate weather forecasting features, adjusting driving plans according to weather conditions to avoid the impact of adverse weather on driving safety.Re11 The system should automatically detect the fuel level and battery status of the vehicle, sending notifications to the school when these fall below set thresholds.Re12 The system should offer a historical trip playback function, allowing schools and parents to review trip details during specific time periods.Re13 The system should support remote control functions, such as remotely stopping the vehicle in emergencies.Re14 The system should have data encryption and protection measures to ensure the security of all transmitted and stored data, preventing unauthorized access.Re15 The system should perform regular self-diagnosis to identify potential technical issues and promptly notify technicians for repairs.Re16 The system should provide a user-friendly interface, making it easy for school administrators and parents to understand and operate various functions.Re17 The system should support multiple languages to meet the needs of users from different regions and cultural backgrounds.Re18 The system should have a log recording function, detailing the operational status of the system and user operations, which aids in troubleshooting and accountability tracing..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Vessel Cargo Tracking SystemRe1 The system should allow administrators to input search criteria such as vessel number and cargo ID on the screen.Re2 The system should display all matching cargo information based on the search criteria.Re3 When no matching cargo information is found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users (such as cargo owners, transport company employees) to create accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to access their account.Re6 The system should display the current location and status of the cargo in the user's account.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information as an essential part of the account.Re8 The system should send cargo status updates to the user via email or text message.Re9 The system should allow users to mark cargo as urgent or for priority handling.Re10 The system should display the real-time locations and navigation routes of different unmanned vessels.Re11 Cargo should be able to be designated to specific unmanned vessels for transportation.Re12 The system should allow users to select loading and unloading ports for the cargo.Re13 The system should provide full tracking information for the cargo from the starting port to the destination port.Re14 The system should display available payment methods to complete the payment of transportation fees.Re15 The system should allow users to select a payment method for transportation services.Re16 After the cargo reaches its destination, the system should allow the consignee to confirm receipt of the cargo.Re17 To improve service quality, the system should collect user feedback and suggestions on transportation services.Re18 The system should support a multilingual interface to facilitate international user usage.Re19 The system should have a fault reporting function that allows users to report any issues during the transportation process.Re20 The system should provide a historical transportation record query function to help users review past transportation details..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Public Transport Real-time Information Release SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for bus information by entering station names, route numbers, or other keywords.Re2 The system should display all bus routes that match the search keywords and their current status (such as approaching the station, passed the station, etc.).Re3 When the search does not find matching bus routes, the system should inform the user through a pop-up window or notification message.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and create a personal profile to save frequently used query locations and preference settings.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure secure access to personal profiles.Re6 The system should display in the user's personal profile the records of recently queried bus routes and saved favorite routes.Re7 The system should allow users to set and modify personal notification preferences, such as the time interval for arrival reminders.Re8 The system should send important service change notifications to users via SMS or email, such as route adjustments, temporary suspensions, etc.Re9 The system should provide real-time bus location information, including estimated arrival times and distances.Re10 The system should display the operation schedules of each bus route, including the first and last bus times and intervals between departures.Re11 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re12 The system should allow users to report bus issues or suggest improvements and provide a feedback channel.Re13 The system should be capable of handling a large number of concurrent requests to ensure stable operation during peak hours.Re14 The system should provide accessibility features to ensure that people with disabilities can use it conveniently.Re15 The system should have an offline map browsing function so that route information can still be viewed when the network is poor.Re16 The system should support multiple device platforms, including smartphones, tablets, and web versions.Re17 The system should regularly update bus route data to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the information.Re18 The system should provide a user help center, including FAQs and technical support contact information..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Garbage Classification and Recycling Tracking SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials.Re2 The system should verify the user's login credentials to access their personal account.Re3 The system should allow users to upload garbage images or scan barcodes to identify the type of waste.Re4 The system should automatically classify waste based on the uploaded information and provide detailed sorting suggestions.Re5 The system should display the correct disposal methods and locations of recycling points for each type of waste.Re6 The system should allow users to schedule recycling services, specifying the time and location for pickup.Re7 The system should remind users of the scheduled recycling service times via SMS or in-app notifications.Re8 The system should record the user's recycling history, including types, quantities, and dates of recycling.Re9 The system should calculate points based on the user's recycling records, which can be used to redeem rewards.Re10 The system should allow users to view their point balance and redemption history.Re11 The system should provide map functionality to help users find the nearest recycling stations or bins.Re12 The system should allow users to report issues with recycling sites, such as overflow or damage.Re13 The system should track the status of scheduled recycling services and update users in real-time.Re14 The system should support user evaluations and feedback on recycling services.Re15 The system should optimize service processes and recycling site management based on user feedback.Re16 The system should regularly push environmental knowledge and waste sorting guidelines to users.Re17 The system should allow users to set preferences, such as notification methods and frequency.Re18 The system should support multi-language interfaces to accommodate users from different linguistic backgrounds.Re19 The system should ensure the security and privacy protection of user data.Re20 The system should provide customer support to answer user inquiries and handle complaints..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Automatic Medication Dispensing System for Unmanned PharmaciesRe1 The system should allow users to search for medications by entering the drug name or describing symptoms through a touchscreen.Re2 The system should display all matching medications and their basic information, such as price and specifications, based on the search criteria.Re3 When no matching medication is found, the system should notify the user via screen prompt or voice message and provide common FAQs or suggest contacting customer service.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account using their mobile phone number and set a password.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to ensure secure access.Re6 The system should display the user's past medication purchase history and current order status in their personal profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as mobile phone number) as an essential part of their personal profile.Re8 The system should send order confirmation information to the user via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to add medications to their shopping cart or purchase them directly.Re10 The system should offer multiple payment methods for users to choose from, including but not limited to credit cards, debit cards, and mobile payments.Re11 The system should support both on-site pickup and courier delivery as delivery options.Re12 Users can select the pickup or delivery method that is convenient for them.Re13 If the user chooses courier delivery, the system should provide tracking information for the order.Re14 The system should allow users to rate and review the medications and services after picking up the medication or receiving the delivery.Re15 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality and medication supply.Re16 The system should provide 24/7 online customer service for users to inquire about medication usage or resolve other issues.Re17 The system should have inventory management capabilities to update the stock status of medications in real-time, preventing out-of-stock situations when users make purchases.Re18 The system should support a fast procurement process for emergency medications, allowing users to quickly obtain urgently needed medications through a special channel..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Parking Space Sharing SystemRe1 The system should allow users to register an account through a mobile application or website.Re2 The system should allow users to log in using their phone number or email address.Re3 The system should provide a password recovery function, allowing users to reset their password via email or SMS.Re4 The system should allow users to upload vehicle information, including license plate number, model, etc.Re5 The system should verify the user's vehicle information to ensure its legality and validity.Re6 The system should allow users to search for nearby available parking spaces and display their location, price, and availability time.Re7 When no matching parking space is found, the system should notify the user via a pop-up or message.Re8 The system should allow parking space owners to post rentable parking space information, including location, rent, and rental time.Re9 The system should allow users to book parking spaces and pay the reservation fee.Re10 The system should remind users of their parking space booking details via SMS or in-app notifications.Re11 The system should allow users to cancel bookings and receive partial or full refunds according to the policy.Re12 The system should provide navigation services to help users quickly find their reserved parking spaces.Re13 The system should allow parking space owners to view and manage their own parking space rental records.Re14 The system should provide online payment functionality, supporting various payment methods (such as credit cards, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc.).Re15 The system should ensure transaction security by using encryption technology to protect user payment information.Re16 The system should allow users to rate and review parking spaces to improve service quality.Re17 The system should collect user feedback to enhance services and optimize user experience.Re18 The system should allow parking space owners to set rental rules for their spaces, such as rental times, whether long-term parking is allowed, etc.Re19 The system should provide data analysis functions to help parking space owners understand the usage and revenue of their spaces.Re20 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Sweeping Vehicle Operation SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to specify cleaning areas on a map.Re2 The system should automatically generate the optimal cleaning path based on the specified cleaning area.Re3 The system should monitor the vehicle's position, speed, and operational status in real time.Re4 The system should provide functions for recording and replaying vehicle operation data.Re5 The system should support remote start and stop of vehicle operations.Re6 The system should have obstacle detection capabilities and be able to automatically navigate around or stop at obstacles.Re7 The system should be able to identify different ground types (such as sidewalks, asphalt roads, etc.) and adjust the cleaning mode accordingly.Re8 The system should provide vehicle fault alarms and diagnostic functions.Re9 The system should support the simultaneous scheduling and management of multiple sweeping vehicles.Re10 The system should be able to statistically analyze cleaning efficiency and energy consumption data.Re11 The system should provide a function for generating operation reports, including cleaned area, time, energy consumption, etc.Re12 The system should support integration with urban management systems to achieve data sharing.Re13 The system should have weather forecast integration capabilities to adjust operation plans according to weather conditions.Re14 The system should provide manual control options in emergencies.Re15 The system should support regular maintenance reminders to ensure the vehicle remains in good condition.Re16 The system should have user permission management functions to ensure that operators at different levels can only access authorized features.Re17 The system should record all operation logs to facilitate problem tracking and responsibility allocation.Re18 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of operators in different regions.Re19 The system should provide vehicle battery status monitoring to ensure that operations are not interrupted due to insufficient power.Re20 The system should support remote software updates to maintain the latest features and security of the system..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Irrigation Automation SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input the specific location and area of the farmland through a graphical interface or mobile application.Re2 The system should be able to automatically obtain weather forecasts and historical climate data for the region based on the entered geographical location data.Re3 The system should be capable of automatically adjusting the irrigation schedule based on crop type, growth stage, and soil moisture sensor data.Re4 The system should support manual start or stop of irrigation functions to handle emergencies or special needs.Re5 The system should have remote monitoring capabilities, allowing users to view the operational status of the irrigation system in real-time via the internet.Re6 The system should record detailed information about each irrigation session, including time, duration, water volume, etc., and generate reports.Re7 The system should be able to connect with external devices such as soil moisture sensors and rain gauges to monitor soil moisture and rainfall in real-time.Re8 The system should provide alarm functions to immediately notify users when abnormal conditions (such as leaks or pipe blockages) are detected.Re9 The system should support multi-user access permission management to ensure that users at different levels can only access authorized features.Re10 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities to automatically identify common issues and propose initial solutions.Re11 The system should be able to automatically adjust irrigation strategies based on seasonal changes and crop growth cycles.Re12 The system should offer a water-saving mode to reduce water resource waste by optimizing irrigation strategies.Re13 The system should support data export functions, allowing users to export irrigation records and other related data in CSV or PDF formats.Re14 The system should be scalable, supporting the addition of new sensors or control devices in the future.Re15 The system should provide user-friendly help documentation and online support to facilitate quick learning and problem-solving.Re16 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re17 The system should be able to integrate with other agricultural management systems through API interfaces, enabling data sharing and coordinated control.Re18 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security and system stability.Re19 The system should provide energy consumption statistics to help users understand the energy efficiency ratio of the irrigation system and optimize energy use.Re20 The system should support historical data analysis, providing irrigation effectiveness evaluations and improvement suggestions..

the user through a pop-up window.Re7 The system should allow users to view detailed information about each psychological counselor, including qualification certificates, areas of expertise, service prices, etc.Re8 The system should allow users to book services with a specific psychological counselor and select an appointment time.Re9 The system should send appointment confirmation via email or system should provide a help center to answer common questions users have about using the system.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds.Re20 The system should provide customer support to handle user complaints and suggestions..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Ship Cargo Handling SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input detailed information about transportation tasks on the console, such as starting point, destination, type of cargo, etc.Re2 The system should automatically plan the optimal route and display the estimated time of arrival.Re3 When it is impossible to plan a route or an insurmountable obstacle is encountered, the system should notify the operator through an alarm.Re4 The system should allow registered users to log in with a username and password to access advanced features.Re5 The system should verify login credentials to ensure that only authorized users can use specific functions.Re6 The system should record and display all ongoing transportation tasks and their status (such as departed, en route, arrived).Re7 The system should maintain account information for each user, including contact details and historical transportation records.Re8 The system should send confirmation information for transportation tasks to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow users to add new transportation requests or cancel existing requests in the task list.Re10 The system should provide multiple transportation mode options, such as express direct, economy mode, etc.Re11 Upon completion of a transportation task, the system should automatically update the task status and notify relevant parties.Re12 The system should allow users to select a transportation priority, which affects the order of task execution.Re13 The system should display the ship's location and status in real-time during the transportation process.Re14 The system should support various payment methods, such as credit card, bank transfer, etc., for paying transportation fees.Re15 The system should allow users to choose a payment method for completed transportation tasks.Re16 After completing a transportation task, the system should allow users to rate and review the service quality.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality and respond to user feedback.Re18 The system should have an exception handling mechanism, such as automatically adjusting routes or pausing tasks when encountering severe weather or mechanical failures, and promptly notifying users.Re19 The system should regularly perform safety inspections to ensure that unmanned ships are in good working condition.Re20 The system should provide detailed user guides and technical support to help users better utilize the system..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Security Alert SystemRe1 The system should allow users to set and manage security alert rules through an application or smart device interface.Re2 The system should continuously monitor various safety parameters in the home, such as smoke, carbon monoxide levels, door and window statuses, etc.Re3 When an anomaly is detected, the system should immediately push alert notifications to the user via the application.Re4 The system should support multiple alert notification methods, including but not limited to SMS, phone calls, and emails.Re5 The system should allow users to remotely control home security devices, such as door locks and cameras.Re6 The system should have video surveillance capabilities and be able to automatically record video clips when an alarm is triggered.Re7 The system should support users viewing historical alert records and video footage.Re8 The system should provide a user-friendly interface for easy configuration and management of security settings.Re9 The system should support multi-user access, with each user having different permission levels.Re10 The system should be capable of integrating with third-party smart home devices to enable control.Re11 The system should perform regular self-checks and notify users when hardware failures are detected.Re12 The system should support voice control and be compatible with mainstream smart voice assistants (such as Alexa, Google Assistant, etc.).Re13 The system should have advanced privacy protection measures to ensure the security of user data.Re14 The system should support a one-touch emergency assistance function to quickly contact predefined emergency contacts or security agencies.Re15 The system should provide detailed user guides and help documents to facilitate user operation.Re16 The system should allow users to customize alert response strategies, such as enabling or disabling certain alerts at specific times or under certain conditions.Re17 The system should support offline mode, maintaining basic security monitoring functions even when the network is unavailable.Re18 The system should have robust logging capabilities, recording all security events and system operations for post-incident analysis..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Enterprise Product Lifecycle Management SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input product information via the screen, such as name, model, etc.Re2 The system should display all matching products and their detailed information based on search criteria.Re3 When no matching products are found during a search, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to create accounts and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure login.Re6 The system should display user profiles, including but not limited to contact information, role permissions, etc.Re7 The system should maintain basic user information, such as email, phone number, etc., as essential parts of personal profiles.Re8 The system should send important notifications and update information to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to add, edit, or delete product information at different stages of the product lifecycle.Re10 The system should provide management functions for each stage of the product lifecycle, including design, development, production, sales, and after-sales service.Re11 The system should support multi-user collaboration, allowing multiple team members to simultaneously participate in the lifecycle management of a single product.Re12 The system should record the historical changes of each product version for traceability and auditing purposes.Re13 The system should provide cost analysis tools to help users optimize cost structures.Re14 The system should integrate supply chain management functions, supporting supplier management and procurement processes.Re15 The system should provide a quality management system, supporting product quality inspection and issue tracking.Re16 The system should support product documentation management, including the upload and version control of technical documents, user manuals, etc.Re17 The system should provide data reporting and analysis functions to assist management in decision-making.Re18 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re19 The system should have data backup and recovery capabilities to ensure data security.Re20 The system should provide API interfaces to support integration with other business systems.Re21 The system should have good scalability, capable of adding new functional modules as the company grows.Re22 The system should support mobile device access, enabling users to manage product information anytime, anywhere.Re23 The system should provide user training and support documentation to help users quickly get started with using the system..

You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Garbage Classification and Recycling Data Analysis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input the type of garbage or scan barcodes to identify items.Re2 The system should display the identified waste category and its corresponding processing method.Re3 When it cannot recognize the waste category, the system should guide users to manually classify through prompt messages.Re4 The system should allow users to register accounts and provide basic personal information.Re5 The system should verify user login information to ensure secure access.Re6 The system should display records of recycling activities in which the user has participated in their personal profile.Re7 The system should save the user's contact information for recycling notifications and services.Re8 The system should regularly send summary reports of recycling activities to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to record the amount and type of garbage recycled each time.Re10 The system should provide charts showing the user's recycling history and environmental contribution.Re11 The system should support users in querying nearby recycling sites and opening hours.Re12 The system should allow users to schedule door-to-door recycling services.Re13 The system should display booking status and expected service times.Re14 The system should offer a points reward mechanism to encourage active participation in garbage classification and recycling.Re15 The system should allow users to redeem gifts or services with points.Re16 The system should collect user feedback on recycling sites and services.Re17 The system should analyze user feedback to continuously improve service quality and user experience.Re18 The system should support a multi-language interface to meet the needs of different user groups.Re19 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure the security of user data.Re20 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate third-party application integration and data sharing..

actions to improve checkout efficiency..

credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to ensure secure access to personal accounts.Re6 The system should display saved travel plans and browsing history in the user's personal different countries and regions.Re15 The system should offer online customer support to resolve issues users encounter while using the service.Re16 The system should allow users to review and rate visited attractions, hotels, restaurants, and activities.Re17 The system should collect user reviews and ratings to improve service quality and provide references for other users.Re18 The system should provide budget management tools to assist users in planning travel expenses, including accommodation, meals, and transportation.Re19 The system should offer travel insurance recommendation services to enhance user safety.Re20 The system should allow users to export travel guides as PDF or Word documents for easy printing and carrying..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Taxi Dispatch PlatformRe1 The system should allow passengers to enter their destination address through the application.Re2 The system should display available unmanned taxis based on the passenger's entered destination.Re3 When no unmanned taxis are available, the system should notify the passenger through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow passengers to register an account and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the passenger's login credentials to access their account.Re6 The system should display the current trip status and past trip records in the passenger's account.Re7 The system should maintain the passenger's phone number or email as a necessary part of the account.Re8 The system should send trip confirmation information to the passenger via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow passengers to cancel booked trips.Re10 The system should display the estimated arrival time and cost estimate.Re11 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of passengers with different language backgrounds.Re12 The system should allow passengers to choose different car models or service levels.Re13 The system should update the trip status in real-time and show the vehicle location on the map.Re14 The system should provide multiple payment methods, such as credit card, mobile payment, etc.Re15 The system should allow passengers to select a payment method and complete the payment at the end of the trip.Re16 After the trip, the system should allow passengers to rate and review the service.Re17 The system should collect passenger ratings and reviews to improve service quality.Re18 The system should support an emergency contact function so that passengers can quickly contact customer service if an emergency occurs during the trip.Re19 The system should have an automatic dispatch function to optimize vehicle allocation and reduce wait times.Re20 The system should provide 24/7 customer service support to resolve passenger issues and concerns..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Soil Improvement SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input specific location information of farmland (such as GPS coordinates).Re2 The system should be able to automatically analyze key indicators of the soil in the area based on the entered location information, such as soil type, pH value, and organic matter content.Re3 The system should provide recommendations for soil testing tools to help users obtain more accurate soil data.Re4 The system should support uploading laboratory test reports of soil samples for further analysis.Re5 The system should propose specific improvement suggestions based on the results of soil analysis, such as applying specific types of fertilizers, adjusting the pH value, etc.Re6 The system should provide a database containing the soil condition requirements of different crops to help users choose suitable crops for planting.Re7 The system should allow users to record and track the effects of soil improvement measures, including crop growth conditions, yield changes, etc.Re8 The system should be able to generate reports on soil improvement plans for users to download and print.Re9 The system should provide expert consulting services, allowing users to communicate online with agricultural experts about specific issues.Re10 The system should allow users to set reminders to execute soil improvement measures at appropriate times.Re11 The system should integrate weather forecasting functions to help users plan the best time for soil improvement.Re12 The system should support data exchange with other agricultural management systems to achieve information sharing.Re13 The system should provide a cost estimation tool for soil improvement to help users budget for improvement costs.Re14 The system should allow users to save and compare soil data from different seasons or years to evaluate long-term effects.Re15 The system should support multiple languages to facilitate use by global users.Re16 The system should ensure the security and privacy protection of user data, complying with relevant laws and regulations.Re17 The system should provide user training resources, such as video tutorials and operation manuals, to help users better utilize system functions.Re18 The system should regularly update the latest developments in soil science and agricultural technology to maintain the scientific accuracy and timeliness of its recommendations..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Ship Cargo Handling Control SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input loading and unloading task instructions through an interface, including ship number, cargo type, and target location information.Re2 The system should display in real-time the positions, statuses (such as idle, loading, unloading, returning, etc.), and progress of all unmanned ships.Re3 When the system detects an unexecutable task (such as no available ship at the specified location, unreachable target location, etc.), it should notify the operator via pop-up or message.Re4 The system should allow operators to create and manage accounts, including setting usernames, passwords, and other personal information.Re5 The system should provide login functionality to verify the operator's credentials for accessing the console.Re6 The system should record and display each operator's operation history, including task assignments and completion status.Re7 The system should maintain contact information for each operator to facilitate communication in emergencies.Re8 The system should automatically record detailed information about each loading and unloading task and be able to generate reports for the operator to view.Re9 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of operators in different regions.Re10 The system should have fault detection capabilities, automatically stopping operations and alerting the operator when an unmanned ship malfunctions.Re11 The system should provide remote control functions, allowing operators to manually intervene in unmanned ship operations under special circumstances.Re12 The system should automatically adjust the work plan of unmanned ships based on environmental factors such as weather and sea conditions, ensuring safe and efficient task completion.Re13 The system should support data exchange with other logistics systems to achieve seamless integration and improve overall logistics efficiency.Re14 The system should have role-based access control, where operators at different levels have different operational permissions to ensure system security.Re15 The system should offer a training mode to help new operators become familiar with the system's operational procedures.Re16 The system should support multiple communication protocols to ensure compatibility with different models of unmanned ships.Re17 The system should have data analysis capabilities, optimizing future work plans and resource allocation through the analysis of historical data.Re18 The system should perform regular self-diagnosis, checking the status of software and hardware to ensure stable system operation..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Bus Vehicle Maintenance Warning SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to enter the vehicle identification number (VIN) or other unique identifiers on the interface to query information about specific vehicles.Re2 The system should display all maintenance records and warning information related to the entered vehicle identification number.Re3 When no information related to the entered vehicle identification number is found, the system should notify the operator through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow operators to enter new vehicle information, including model, purchase date, first use date, etc.Re5 The system should validate the newly entered vehicle information to ensure that required fields are complete and correctly formatted.Re6 The system should automatically generate maintenance schedules based on the vehicle's usage and the manufacturer's recommended maintenance cycles.Re7 The system should allow operators to manually adjust the automatically generated maintenance schedules.Re8 The system should regularly check the operational data of the vehicles, and automatically issue warning notifications when potential failures or upcoming maintenance tasks are detected.Re9 The system should support multiple warning notification methods, including but not limited to email, SMS, and in-app messages.Re10 The system should provide an interface for viewing the real-time status and historical maintenance records of all vehicles.Re11 The system should allow operators to set specific maintenance standards and warning thresholds for each bus.Re12 The system should be capable of integrating data from different sources, such as onboard sensors and GPS positioning systems, to enhance the accuracy and timeliness of warnings.Re13 The system should have data analysis capabilities to track and analyze the performance and maintenance costs of vehicles over the long term, helping to optimize fleet management.Re14 The system should provide report generation functions, allowing operators to create customized maintenance reports and performance analysis reports.Re15 The system should support multi-user permission management, ensuring that users at different levels can only access information within their permission scope.Re16 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure the security and integrity of important data.Re17 The system should provide detailed log recording functions, logging all operations and system events for easy problem diagnosis and accountability tracing.Re18 The system should support integration with other bus management systems (such as scheduling systems and ticketing systems) to achieve data sharing and process automation..

analysis tools to automatically retrieve and analyze user feedback and comments from major social platforms.Re8 The system should allow users to set access permissions to ensure the security of sensitive data.Re9 The system should provide a user-friendly interface that supports switching between multiple languages to meet international business needs.Re10 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure data security.Re11 The system should support API interfaces to facilitate integration with other internal systems or third-party services.Re12 The system should log all user operations for audit and issue tracing.Re13 The system should provide online help documents and user guides to enhance user experience.Re14 The system should support mobile device access to ensure that users can view and manage promotional data from any location.Re15 The system should regularly update and optimize algorithms to adapt to the ever-changing market environment.Re16 The system should provide customer support services to resolve issues encountered by users during use.Re17 The system should support multiple users collaborating online simultaneously to improve team work efficiency.Re18 The system should have advanced search functions, allowing users to quickly find historical data based on keywords, date ranges, etc.Re19 The system should provide data visualization tools to help users better understand market trends and consumer behavior.Re20 The system should support customizable dashboards, allowing users to adjust the displayed content and layout according to their needs..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Parcel Locker Management SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input their parcel tracking number or other identification information via the screen to locate their parcels.Re2 The system should display the location and status of all parcels that match the entered information.Re3 When no matching parcels are found, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set login credentials.Re5 The system should verify the user's login credentials to access their account information.Re6 The system should display a list of the user's parcels, including statuses such as pending pickup, picked up, and overdue unclaimed.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information as part of their account for notification and management purposes.Re8 The system should send notifications of parcel arrival to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to open the parcel locker by scanning a QR code or entering a verification code.Re10 The system should provide various sizes of parcel lockers to accommodate different parcel sizes.Re11 The system should record the usage details of each parcel locker, including usage time, user, and parcel information.Re12 The system should support batch operations for couriers, such as batch entry of parcel information and batch opening of locker doors.Re13 The system should be able to monitor the status of parcel lockers, including idle, occupied, and faulty states, and promptly notify administrators.Re14 The system should allow users to receive reminders when parcels are overdue and provide an option to extend the storage period.Re15 The system should support return operations, allowing users to apply for the return of uncollected parcels through the system.Re16 The system should provide a fault reporting function, enabling both users and couriers to report issues with the parcel lockers.Re17 The system should allow users to rate and provide feedback on the service provided by the parcel lockers.Re18 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure the security of user data.Re19 The system should support a multilingual interface to facilitate use by users from different language backgrounds.Re20 The system should provide API interfaces to integrate with other logistics systems for information synchronization..
