instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Smart Home Remote Healthcare Service PlatformRe1 The system should allow users to search for symptoms, diseases, or health advice through voice or screen input.Re2 The system should display all relevant medical information and recommendations based on the search, including but not limited to articles, videos, and options to consult with professional doctors.Re3 When no matching information is found from the search, the system should notify the user via a pop-up window and provide options to contact customer service or a professional doctor.Re4 The system should allow users to create personal health records, including personal information, medical history, allergy history, etc.Re5 The system should verify user identity to ensure secure access to personal health records.Re6 The system should display the user's health monitoring data, such as heart rate and blood pressure, which can be automatically synchronized from connected smart devices.Re7 The system should maintain the user's emergency contact information to quickly notify in case of an emergency.Re8 The system should send important health reminders and medical appointment notifications to users via SMS or email.Re9 The system should allow users to schedule online or offline doctor consultation services and manage these appointments.Re10 The system should provide multiple payment methods, including but not limited to credit cards, Alipay, WeChat Pay, etc., for users to pay for medical consultation fees.Re11 The system should support drug delivery services, allowing users to order prescription drugs through the platform and choose the delivery method.Re12 The system should display the status of drug deliveries, enabling users to check their order progress at any time.Re13 The system should allow users to fill out and submit electronic medical records on the platform, making it convenient for doctors to view and diagnose remotely.Re14 The system should provide mental health support services, including but not limited to online consultations, psychological tests, and recommended mental health resources.Re15 The system should allow users to participate in health communities to exchange health experiences and advice with other users.Re16 The system should provide personalized health plans and suggestions based on the user's health data and lifestyle habits.Re17 The system should allow users to rate and review the services they have used to help other users make choices.Re18 The system should have data encryption capabilities to ensure user privacy and data security.Re19 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re20 The system should regularly update its health knowledge base to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the information.Re21 The system should provide 24/7 customer service support to resolve issues and answer questions encountered by users..

system should allow users to create personal profiles, including basic information, preference settings, and travel history records.Re5 The system should verify user credentials, such as usernames and passwords, to ensure secure access to personal profiles.Re6 The system should display in the user's profile their booking history, current trips, and upcoming travel plans.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information, such as email and phone number, as part of the personal profile.Re8 The system should send booking confirmation information to users via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow users to add and remove travel products from their trip planning, such as hotel bookings, flights, and activities.Re10 The system should provide various itinerary planning tools to help users optimize their travel routes and time schedules.Re11 The system should recommend local transportation methods and services based on the user's location and preferences.Re12 The system should allow users to customize their travel itineraries, including adding personal notes and reminders.Re13 The system should display detailed information for each travel product, including price, availability, and user reviews.Re14 The system should support multiple payment methods, including credit cards, debit cards, and third-party payment platforms.Re15 The system should allow users to select a payment method for travel products and complete the online payment process.Re16 After the trip, the system should allow users to rate and review their experiences.Re17 The system should collect user ratings and reviews to improve service quality and recommendation algorithms.Re18 The system should offer travel insurance options and allow users to choose to purchase them during the booking process.Re19 The system should provide customer service support, including online chat, phone consultation, and FAQ answers.Re20 The system should regularly push personalized travel recommendations and promotional information to users based on their travel history and preferences..

multiple channels (such as websites, mobile applications, and telephone).Re2 The system should support customers in submitting various types of feedback, including but not limited to complaints, suggestions, problem reports, and service requests.Re3 The system should be able to automatically record the customer's contact information and the time of feedback submission.Re4 The system should provide an interface that allows customer service personnel to view and manage all customer feedback.Re5 The system should allow customer service personnel to categorize each piece of feedback for better management and tracking.Re6 The system should support multi-level priority settings, automatically assigning feedback to the appropriate customer service personnel based on its urgency.Re7 The system should provide real-time notification features, immediately notifying relevant customer service personnel when new feedback is submitted.Re8 The system should allow customer service personnel to respond to customer feedback and record all communication history.Re9 The system should provide a function to track the progress of feedback handling, allowing customers to check the status of their feedback using a unique number provided.Re10 The system should support internal routing of feedback, i.e., transferring from one customer service personnel to another or to a different department.Re11 The system should have data analysis capabilities, capable of generating reports on customer satisfaction, distribution of feedback types, etc.Re12 The system should support customer satisfaction surveys, inviting customers to evaluate after their feedback has been processed.Re13 The system should provide API interfaces to facilitate integration with other enterprise systems (such as CRM systems).Re14 The system should ensure the security and privacy protection of all customer data, complying with relevant legal and regulatory requirements.Re15 The system should support a multilingual environment to meet the needs of international business.Re16 The system should allow administrators to customize feedback forms to adapt to the needs of different business scenarios.Re17 The system should support batch import and export of customer feedback data for easy data management and backup.Re18 The system should provide archiving functions for historical feedback to ensure orderly long-term data storage management.Re19 The system should support self-service functions for customers, allowing them to view FAQs and solutions.Re20 The system should provide mobile optimization to ensure efficient use by both customers and customer service personnel on mobile devices..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Community Health Monitoring SystemRe1 The system should allow residents to input personal information (such as name, age, contact details, etc.) via a screen.Re2 The system should be capable of automatically detecting and recording residents' basic health data, such as body temperature and heart rate.Re3 When the system detects abnormal health data, it should notify the resident and community medical personnel through pop-up windows and SMS.Re4 The system should allow residents to create personal health records and set access passwords.Re5 The system should verify residents' access passwords to protect the security of personal health information.Re6 The system should display historical health data records and trend analysis in residents' personal health records.Re7 The system should maintain residents' contact information as an essential part of their personal health records.Re8 The system should regularly send health reminders and suggestions to residents via email or SMS.Re9 The system should allow residents to upload self-monitored data (such as blood pressure, blood glucose, etc.) to their personal health records.Re10 The system should provide online booking functions for community medical services, such as doctor consultations and physical examinations.Re11 The system should display available medical resources and service information within the community, including but not limited to clinics, pharmacies, emergency stations, etc.Re12 The system should allow residents to select different medical service items based on their needs.Re13 The system may show the current status and schedule of appointments.Re14 The system should provide multiple payment methods and support online payment of medical fees.Re15 The system should allow residents to choose a payment method to complete the payment for medical services.Re16 After receiving medical services, the system may allow residents to evaluate or rate their experience.Re17 To improve service quality, the system needs to collect residents' evaluations and ratings.Re18 The system should have a rapid response mechanism for emergencies, such as a one-click distress call function that directly contacts the community medical center or emergency department.Re19 The system should support a multi-language interface to facilitate use by residents with different language backgrounds.Re20 The system should regularly update its health knowledge base to provide the latest health information and preventive measures..

system should support batch import and export of data to simplify the data management process.Re18 The system should provide online training and help documentation to assist users in getting started quickly.Re19 The system should support multiple users operating simultaneously online to ensure system stability and response speed.Re20 The system should provide regular software updates and maintenance services to ensure the latest features and security..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Unmanned Library Self-Service Book Borrowing and Returning SystemRe1 The system should allow users to search for books by entering the ISBN number, book title, or author's name on the screen.Re2 The system should display all matching books based on the search, including the book title, author, publication year, and availability for borrowing.Re3 When no matching books are found, the system should notify the user with a pop-up message saying “No related books found.”Re4 The system should allow users to register an account and set a username and password.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure that only legitimate users can access their personal accounts.Re6 The system should display a list of borrowed books and past borrowing records in the user's personal account.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email address and phone number) as part of the personal account.Re8 The system should send users borrowing confirmations and due date reminders via email.Re9 The system should allow users to complete borrowing operations by scanning the barcode of the book at a self-service terminal.Re10 The system should support self-service book return functionality, allowing users to return books at any open time.Re11 The system should automatically update the user's borrowing status and the book inventory status to ensure data accuracy.Re12 The system should provide a renewal option, allowing users to request an extension of the borrowing period online.Re13 The system should show the remaining available copies of each book to help users understand the availability of the book.Re14 The system should have an overdue reminder function, notifying users via SMS or email that their books are about to or have already expired.Re15 The system should support fine payment functionality, allowing users to pay fines through the system for books returned late.Re16 The system should allow users to rate or review books and share their reading experiences.Re17 To improve service quality, the system should collect user ratings and reviews and use them to enhance book management and recommendation algorithms.Re18 The system should provide online consulting services, allowing users to ask questions to library staff through a chat window.Re19 The system should have a book recommendation feature, suggesting relevant books based on the user's borrowing history and preferences.Re20 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users with different language backgrounds..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Underwater Drone Seabed Exploration SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to set mission parameters through a control interface, such as depth, speed, and path.Re2 The system should be capable of displaying key data in real-time, including the position, depth, speed, and direction of the drone.Re3 The system should have an automatic obstacle avoidance function, which can automatically adjust the path when an obstacle is detected ahead to avoid collisions.Re4 The system should be able to record and store data from each mission, including video streams, sonar images, and other sensor data.Re5 The system should support remote control, allowing operators to control the drone from a safe location.Re6 The system should maintain stable communication with the ground station underwater, even in deep-sea environments, to transmit data.Re7 The system should have an emergency surfacing function, enabling the drone to quickly return to the surface in case of emergencies.Re8 The system should be equipped with various sensors, including but not limited to cameras, sonar, thermometers, and salinity meters, to comprehensively collect seabed environmental data.Re9 The system should have self-diagnostic capabilities, capable of periodically checking the working status of all components and alerting the operator when a fault is detected.Re10 The system should support multitasking, allowing for the execution of multiple different exploration tasks during a single dive.Re11 The system should provide data analysis tools to assist researchers in quickly parsing collected data.Re12 The system should be adaptable to different types of marine environments, including shallow seas, deep seas, and polar waters.Re13 The system should have the capability for long-duration operations, with a battery life of no less than 24 hours per charge.Re14 The system should be designed with easily replaceable battery modules to facilitate quick replacement and continuation of tasks.Re15 The system should support cloud synchronization of data, making it convenient for team members to access and analyze data remotely.Re16 The system should have excellent waterproof and pressure-resistant performance to ensure normal operation in extreme conditions.Re17 The system should have a modular design to facilitate future upgrades and the addition of new functional modules.Re18 The system should provide detailed user manuals and technical support to help operators and maintenance personnel better use and maintain the equipment..

should support multilingual interfaces to meet the needs of operators in different regions.Re17 The system should provide user training and help documentation to facilitate quick learning for new regions.Re18 The system should have good security performance to protect user data from unauthorized access..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:5G Network Coverage Optimization SystemRe1 The system should allow users to upload and import geographic area data, such as map files, geographic coordinates, etc.Re2 The system should be able to display the uploaded geographic area data and support zoom and pan operations.Re3 The system should allow users to define and adjust network coverage parameters, such as base station locations, power output, antenna direction, etc.Re4 The system should automatically calculate and display the expected coverage range of the 5G network based on user-defined parameters.Re5 The system should be able to identify and mark areas with insufficient coverage and provide optimization suggestions.Re6 The system should allow users to simulate network performance under different environmental conditions, such as weather changes, building density, etc.Re7 The system should support multiple users collaborating online simultaneously, allowing multiple engineers to optimize network design together.Re8 The system should provide historical data analysis functions to help users understand trends in network coverage changes.Re9 The system should allow users to export optimized network configuration reports, including coverage maps and optimization suggestions.Re10 The system should support integration with existing network management systems to achieve data synchronization and updates.Re11 The system should provide API interfaces for third-party applications and services to call its functions.Re12 The system should have user permission management functions to ensure that only authorized users can access sensitive data and perform critical operations.Re13 The system should record all user operation logs for audit and problem tracking purposes.Re14 The system should provide real-time monitoring functions to display network performance metrics and alarm information.Re15 The system should support multi-language interfaces to meet the needs of international users.Re16 The system should have high availability and fault tolerance to ensure stable service even in case of failure.Re17 The system should regularly conduct performance evaluations and provide optimization suggestions to improve system response speed and processing capabilities.Re18 The system should support access from various devices, including PCs, tablets, and mobile devices, ensuring users can access the system from anywhere.Re19 The system should provide detailed help documentation and technical support to help users get started quickly and solve problems.Re20 The system should support data backup and recovery functions to prevent data loss..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agricultural Pest and Disease Identification SystemRe1 The system should allow users to upload images of crops for analysis.Re2 The system should be able to identify common pests and diseases in the images and provide corresponding names and descriptions.Re3 If the system cannot identify a pest or disease, it should notify the user via a pop-up window and suggest manual lookup or contacting an expert.Re4 The system should allow users to create profiles and set credentials to save history and preference settings.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access their profile.Re6 The system should display a history of identified pests and diseases in the user's profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's contact information (such as email) as a necessary part of the profile.Re8 The system should send pest and disease identification reports and recommended control measures to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to mark images as 'Favorites' or 'Important' for future reference.Re10 The system should provide detailed information about each pest and disease, including its life cycle, transmission routes, and prevention methods.Re11 The system should integrate weather forecasting functions to help users predict the likelihood of pest and disease occurrence.Re12 The system should provide recommendations for pesticides and biological control methods, along with guidance on using these methods.Re13 The system should allow users to share pest and disease identification results and control suggestions on social media or specific agricultural communities.Re14 The system should support a multilingual interface to meet the needs of users from different regions.Re15 The system should regularly update the pest and disease database to ensure the accuracy and timeliness of the information.Re16 The system should allow users to submit pest and disease sample images for further diagnosis by experts.Re17 The system should provide online consulting services, allowing users to communicate with agricultural experts through text or video.Re18 The system should allow users to set reminders, so that when the high season for specific pests and diseases approaches, the system automatically sends out warnings..

Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Factory Production Line Optimization SystemRe1 The system should allow operators to input production task parameters through the interface, such as product type, quantity, etc.Re2 The system should display the real-time status of the production line, including but not limited to machine operation status, material supply conditions, and product quality inspection results.Re3 When a fault or anomaly occurs on the production line, the system should automatically issue an alarm and notify the operator of the specific issue via a pop-up window on the screen.Re4 The system should allow administrators to create and manage user accounts, setting different permission levels such as operator, engineer, and management.Re5 The system should verify user login credentials to ensure that only authorized personnel can access the system.Re6 The system should record and display historical data for each production batch, including key indicators such as production time, output, and pass rate.Re7 The system should support querying and analyzing historical production data to assist management in making decisions.Re8 The system should provide a production planning function, allowing administrators to adjust production plans based on market demand.Re9 The system should be able to automatically schedule the production line according to the production plan, optimizing resource allocation.Re10 The system should integrate a quality control system, automatically detecting whether products meet standards and marking non-conforming items.Re11 The system should support remote monitoring, allowing managers to view the status of the production line through mobile devices.Re12 The system should have a maintenance reminder function, prompting operators to perform regular maintenance based on machine usage.Re13 The system should be able to generate detailed production reports, including production efficiency, cost analysis, etc., to assist management in evaluation.Re14 The system should support integration with other enterprise systems, such as ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) and SCM (Supply Chain Management) systems, to achieve data sharing.Re15 The system should have data backup and recovery functions to ensure the security and integrity of production data.Re16 The system should provide a user-friendly interface, simplifying operational procedures and reducing errors.Re17 The system should support multiple language versions to meet the needs of users in different regions.Re18 The system should have a self-diagnostic function, capable of automatically detecting potential issues with software and hardware and proposing solutions.Re19 The system should support customized development, allowing for functional expansion based on specific enterprise needs.Re20 The system should record all user operation logs for audit and responsibility tracing..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Intelligent Agriculture Precision Irrigation SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input basic information about their farmland through the interface (such as soil type, crop variety, area, etc.).Re2 The system should automatically recommend an appropriate irrigation plan based on the entered farmland information.Re3 When the system cannot recommend an irrigation plan based on the existing data, it should prompt the user to contact technical support or provide more detailed information.Re4 The system should allow users to set specific irrigation schedules, including start times and durations.Re5 The system should be able to adjust irrigation plans according to weather forecasts to avoid unnecessary irrigation during rainy days.Re6 The system should have remote control capabilities, allowing users to start or stop irrigation through a mobile app or web interface.Re7 The system should monitor soil moisture in real-time and automatically adjust the irrigation amount based on preset thresholds.Re8 The system should provide a function to query historical irrigation records to help users analyze irrigation efficiency and crop growth conditions.Re9 The system should support multi-user management, allowing multiple administrator accounts to simultaneously monitor and manage different farmlands.Re10 The system should have a fault alarm function that notifies users promptly when equipment malfunctions or network connection issues are detected.Re11 The system should provide detailed instructions for use and answers to frequently asked questions to help users get started quickly.Re12 The system should be able to interface with third-party meteorological service platforms to obtain accurate weather data for irrigation decision-making.Re13 The system should support data analysis, capable of generating irrigation effectiveness reports to assist users in optimizing future irrigation strategies.Re14 The system should have security measures to prevent unauthorized access and operations.Re15 The system should allow users to define their own irrigation zones, setting personalized irrigation parameters based on the characteristics of crops in different areas.Re16 The system should provide energy consumption statistics to help users understand the energy usage of the irrigation system, promoting energy conservation and emission reduction.Re17 The system should be able to integrate with other smart agricultural devices (such as drones, sensors, etc.) to achieve comprehensive management.Re18 The system should support multilingual interfaces to facilitate use by users in different regions..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Online Food Nutrition Analysis SystemRe1 The system should allow users to input food names or ingredients on the screen for search.Re2 The system should display all matching foods and their detailed nutritional information based on the search.Re3 When no matching food is found in the search, the system should notify the user through a pop-up window.Re4 The system should allow users to create profiles and set credentials.Re5 The system should verify user credentials to access their profile.Re6 The system should display a list of saved foods and nutrition analysis reports in the user's profile.Re7 The system should maintain the user's email information as an essential part of the profile.Re8 The system should send nutrition analysis reports to users via email.Re9 The system should allow users to upload food images to assist with food identification and nutritional analysis.Re10 The system should provide a standard database of food nutritional components for user queries.Re11 The system should automatically generate daily nutritional intake recommendations based on the food information entered by the user.Re12 The system should allow users to set personal health goals (such as weight loss, muscle gain, etc.) and adjust nutritional recommendations accordingly.Re13 The system should provide a food diary function to record the user's daily dietary situation.Re14 The system should be able to regularly generate nutrition summary reports based on the user's food diary.Re15 The system should allow users to share their nutrition analysis reports on social media.Re16 The system should provide a nutrition knowledge base containing articles and videos related to healthy eating.Re17 The system should allow users to subscribe to specific types of nutritional updates or reminders.Re18 The system should support a multilingual interface to facilitate use by users from different regions.Re19 The system should have privacy protection features to ensure the security and confidentiality of user data.Re20 The system should allow users to export their own nutrition analysis reports for backup or sharing with professionals..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should allow users to view a list of all departments in the current inventory.Re2 The system should support browsing all categories under a department.Re3 The system should provide a function to edit department settings on the department level interface.Re4 Department names must be unique within the inventory.Re5 The unique tag (Unique Tag) of a department must be unique within the inventory.Re6 The length of the POS department code must not exceed 3 characters.Re7 The length of the department's unique tag must not exceed 18 characters.Re8 The system must ensure there is an available slot in the department matrix before creating a new department.Re9 The system must not allow the deletion of a department that contains categories or items.Re10 Before deleting a department, the system must require user confirmation of the action.Re11 The system should allow users to add new categories at the department level.Re12 The system should allow users to move existing categories at the department level.Re13 Category names must be unique within the inventory.Re14 The unique tag (Unique Tag) of a category must be unique within the inventory.Re15 The length of the category's unique tag must not exceed 18 characters.Re16 The system must ensure there is an available slot in the category matrix before creating a new category.Re17 The category editing function should be located on the category level interface.Re18 Before deleting a category, the system must require user confirmation of the action.Re19 Material, surface treatment, color, and characteristic options in category details should be based on the definitions of the associated department.Re20 The 'Details' field in category details should be based on the predefined attribute definitions of the category.Re21 The system should support adding new items to the inventory, supporting types such as unique items, stock items, and items priced below $5.Re22 When adding a unique item, quantity, condition, and price are mandatory fields; if the category is a general category, description is also mandatory.Re23 When adding an item priced below $5, the description is a mandatory field.Re24 When adding a stock item, all fields are preset and cannot be modified.Re25 The system should allow users to select the category of an item through the inventory matrix.Re26 Material, surface treatment, color, and characteristic options in item details should be based on the definitions of the associated department.Re27 The 'Details' field in item details should be based on the attribute definitions of the associated category.Re28 The system should provide price suggestions when users are entering items.Re29 For unique items, users can accept the suggested price, enter a custom price, or leave it blank.Re30 For stock items, the price is a preset value and cannot be modified by the user.Re31 The system should allow users to manage stock items (view, update).Re32 All fields except the system-generated item number can be edited.Re33 The system should provide a function to adjust item quantities.Re34 When reducing the quantity, the 'Reason' field is mandatory.Re35 When increasing the quantity or the reason is 'Other,' the 'Remarks' field is mandatory.Re36 Valid reasons for adjusting quantity include: Scrap, Gift (Free Box), Discard, Damage, Loss (Stolen or Lost), Correction (Data Entry Error), Other (Requires Explanation).Re37 The system should support the splitting of items.Re38 When splitting items, the new quantity and condition are mandatory fields.Re39 The split item list must contain at least two items (including the original item).Re40 The 'Clone' button can duplicate a row of item data (item number is empty).Re41 The 'Add Item' button can guide users to select a new category through the inventory matrix and enter the editing interface.Re42 Clicking the category name in the split list should redirect to the corresponding item's view/edit page.Re43 The system should provide a function to sell items.Re44 The system should support generating various business reports.Re45 The system should have a user-friendly interface to ensure easy operation.Re46 The system should guarantee high availability to support daily business continuity.Re47 The system should have high reliability to prevent data loss or errors.Re48 The system should implement security mechanisms to protect user and inventory data.Re49 The system should meet performance requirements to ensure timely response to operations.Re50 The system should support compatibility with client platforms to ensure normal operation.Re51 The system should support data migration from the old system.Re52 The system should have disaster recovery, backup, and business continuity plans.```.

var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>AddNewItems</var><var>UniqueItemPriceOptions</var></imp></rule><rule><imp><var>AddNewItems</var><var>StockItemPresetPrice</var></imp></rule></constraints><comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should support simplified employee login methods, such as card swiping or using personal account passwords to log into terminals.Re2 The system should allow system administrators to create reusable report templates for staff to use directly or make limited modifications as needed, ensuring the reliability of the output results.Re3 The system should provide fine-grained permission control, restricting different users' permissions to create, clone, and run reports, and support managing data access scope through shared folders.Re4 The system should provide a user-friendly query tool interface that supports querying all record types, including field selection, dropdown value selection, regular expressions, and Boolean operators, with administrators controlling access permissions to tables and fields.Re5 The system should provide predefined board reports, including basic statistical data (such as data required for annual state aid reports) and service usage statistics (such as borrowing, returning, and reserving), and support cross-analysis based on terminal, branch, library system, time period, reader age, reader type, and geographical location.Re6 Transaction data should be archived in a way that protects reader privacy, complying with state legal requirements, while retaining the ability to generate useful demographic information.Re7 The system should support generating periodic management reports, such as records of reserved items, items not borrowed for a long time, item-level reservations, items of invalid item types, items in transit with pending reservations, items in transit for more than X days, the last copy in the system, long call number items, missing items, bibliographic records without item records, and invalid readers in family libraries.Re8 After a query is executed, the system should display the query conditions used and their results.Re9 The system should support a report queuing mechanism and allow users to view the position of their reports in the queue.Re10 The system must be able to support the specific PINES report example functions listed in Appendix A of the document.Re11 The system must be able to support the specific fine-grained PINES report requirements listed in Appendix B of the document.Re12 The system should be able to generate statistical information for analyzing and predicting reader behavior and usage patterns, such as average book return times, likelihood of renewals, and the proportion of renewals at a particular branch out of total loans.Re13 The system should be able to generate anonymized demographic information, including transaction data statistics by geographic area, age range, etc., ensuring no personally identifiable information is disclosed.Re14 The system should be able to statistically track the total collection size of a specific library at specific points in time, covering new acquisitions, on-shelf, and loaned-out statuses, and can be categorized (such as total, reservation count, adult fiction, picture books, etc.).Re15 The system should provide an interface showing the capacity situation of each branch (based on the definition in Re14).Re16 The system should be able to compare the proportions of genres and formats in total circulation, collection ratio, and total shelf space, and support generating reports for individual libraries or the entire system.Re17 The system should support inventory management of uncataloged materials (such as paperbacks, children's hardcover books) to enable rapid distribution, minimize branch workload, and track usage, which will be included in circulation statistics and reports.Re18 The system should provide a tool for batch transferring items, supporting candidate resource queries, saving common queries, manual entry selection, updating item location information (such as changing the affiliated branch, generating pick-up lists), and supporting the restoration of items to their original locations under specific times or conditions.Re19 The system should provide a report on lost and damaged items by branch.Re20 The system should generate a list of items in transit for more than X days (X configurable), summarized by branch and system, and merge 'sent' and 'received' information for frontline personnel use.Re21 The system should provide tools and reports for identifying records of items to be cleared, with customizable clearance criteria (such as 'lost' status for more than X months, 'weeding/culling' status, etc.), and provide auxiliary reports for status transitions, last copy reports, and efficient methods for deleting volume records and their subordinate copy records, as well as bibliographic records not associated with any items.Re22 The system should have the capability to statistically track and trace record deletions (such as item records, reader records), with separate statistics by location and system.Re23 The system should support querying and reporting by multiple reader characteristics (such as age range, postal code, county of residence, affiliated branch, reader type, preferred language).Re24 The system should be able to generate a list of readers who have had no checkouts or electronic activities in the past X days (X configurable), and support filtering by system, affiliated library, county, etc.Re25 The system should maintain transaction history for X days (X configurable), with monthly and annual aggregated information permanently stored.Re26 The system should support grouping transactions by hour, terminal, branch, and system, with transaction types including returns, checkouts, fine collections, reader registrations, etc., and support querying by all or specific types.Re27 The system should separately and cumulatively track various return methods: drop boxes, manned counters, and self-service devices.Re28 The system should separately and cumulatively track various checkout methods: staff processing, self-checkout machines, staff renewals, self-renewal machines, online renewals, and OPAC renewals.Re29 The system should separately track the number of all reservation requests, including the initiation method: manned counter, in-library public computers, remote operations.Re30 The system should be able to generate transaction reports, covering reservation and checkout situations, with statistics by reader, library, selected library group, system, county, etc., displaying the number of checkouts and reservations for each reader, with reservations classified by status (e.g., active, frozen, unfrozen on a specific date).Re31 The system should be able to generate collection value reports, based on data from item records, to calculate the value of the entire or partial collection, such as the total value of long-overdue items, the value of children's DVD collections, or the total value of the system's collection.Re32 All reports and data archiving must comply with standard accounting practices and audit requirements at the state, county, and city levels.Re33 The system should link fines, charges, reductions, and electronic payment information in reader and item records, tracking reduction and collection situations at each library, and support convenient financial information updates, such as querying reader accounts with debts exceeding X dollars.Re34 The system should provide financial reports, including: account balances by reader, affiliated library, and system; cumulative fees by time period (e.g., past 12 months, year-to-date, last month) and fee type (late fees, damage compensation, lost item compensation, etc.); reduction amounts by time period and branch; and payment records by time period and payment method (manned counter, self-service station, OPAC).Re35 The system should maintain a reader payment ledger, recording the deduction items corresponding to each payment, facilitating financial reconciliation and auditing.```.

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should operate on a fully relational, SQL-based database and support the execution of SQL queries on any data table, with access to the database via ODBC. Re2 The system should provide real-time processing capabilities, such as instant updates of pull lists, and support real-time shelf checking and removal operations. Re3 The system should support simultaneous access and modification of reader and collection records by multiple users, including staff terminals, self-service lending and returning machines, SIP2/NCIP protocol interfaces, and OPAC systems; according to permission settings, staff can view all fields, while readers can only access selected fields; when records are changed, users should be prompted that the record has been modified. Re4 The system should allow administrators to identify the usage status of any reader or collection record, including usage location, user, lock time, etc. Re5 The system should support personal and shared staff login accounts; control the scope of modules accessible by each account through 'role' or 'permission' mechanisms; personal accounts should support user-level preference settings and audit trails. Re6 System documentation should be customized for libraries, follow standard technical document formats, based on the current software version, presented in web form, organized by function, and have indexing and full-text search capabilities. Re7 System upgrades and updates should come with written guidelines, including server and client update steps, as well as lists of new, changed, and removed features. Re8 The system should provide read and write access permissions to all configuration files. Re9 The system should provide complete access permissions to all log files, allowing logs to be viewed without stopping system services; support enabling, disabling logs, and setting retention periods. Re10 The system should provide root shell access permissions to facilitate underlying system management. Re11 The system should support the creation of custom dashboards to display current and historical data on system performance, data changes, circulation transactions, etc.; administrators can set up dashboards and grant access permissions to specific users or user groups. Re12 The system should fully support SNMP, monitoring disk space, CPU load, memory usage, system processes, network interfaces and ports; alarm thresholds can be configured, and alarms can be sent via management dashboards, emails, SMS, etc., supporting unlimited recipients. Re13 The system should allow setting a record lock duration threshold and list all long-occupied/locked records; administrators can unlock one or more records from the same console. Re14 The system should provide a performance monitoring and management dashboard, displaying the PID, owner username, IP address (if applicable), CPU and memory utilization, and runtime of each process; automatically identify out-of-control processes; system status is indicated through visual indicators (such as traffic lights). Re15 The system should provide a server management console, including functions for software shutdown, startup, server shutdown, and restart. Re16 The system should provide a management dashboard, showing the last full and incremental backups, scheduled/unplanned restart times, recent software upgrades, current version numbers, pending transaction counts, log file sizes, statistics on various types of records (such as documents, bibliographies, readers, etc.), and database usage. Re17 The system should provide a client management console, displaying the names and IP addresses of workstations running client software, and providing tools to manage sessions and terminate sessions. Re18 The system should provide a circulation business dashboard, displaying key performance indicators such as hourly borrowing volumes, return volumes, reservation volumes, daily allocation volumes, etc.; indicators can be limited to a single branch or the entire system. Re19 The system should provide a unified configuration file console, centrally accessing all configuration files; support assigning read and write permissions for individual configuration files to users and user groups. Re20 The system should provide a log file dashboard to facilitate locating and viewing various log files. Re21 The system should provide a single interface for reviewing and controlling scheduled tasks, including manually scheduled tasks, automated reports, data imports and exports, software updates, etc. Re22 The system should allow access and editing of email configuration parameters, including quick menus for common settings (such as spoofing senders, log retention policies, bounce handling, etc.). Re23 The system should support SMTP protocol for email transmission. Re24 The system should support restriction mechanisms based on business rules, such as prohibiting the deletion of collection records in loan status, or prohibiting the deletion of bibliographic records with reservation requests. Re25 The system should provide customizable 'blocking rules' to determine whether readers and staff can view authority, bibliographic, order, and collection records in the staff interface or public OPAC; record visibility can be limited to specific workgroups, all personnel at specific locations, or all personnel across the system. Re26 The system should allow the creation and modification of reservation rules to determine whether readers can request reservations for certain resources; rules can be based on reader type, current number of reservations, account balance, resource type, status, and collection site code; and support staff with specific permissions overriding certain conditions. Re27 The system should allow the creation and modification of lending rules to decide whether to lend resources, calculate lending periods, and determine the number of renewals; rules can evaluate reader type, current number of loans, account balance, resource type, status, collection site, and lending location; support considering the opening and closing times of lending locations when calculating due dates; and allow staff with specific permissions to override some rule conditions. Re28 The system should allow setting default values, data validation rules, automatic formatting, and required properties for any field. Re29 The system should support online execution of incremental and full backups, including data and transaction logs; and be compatible with third-party backup software (such as EMC NetWorker). Re30 The system should record data changes (such as record deletions) and provide an 'undo' function; ideally, it should have version control capabilities. Re31 The system should support cluster deployment of servers to achieve failover capabilities. Re32 The system should ensure that reader data is securely protected during all transmissions. Re33 System administrators should have full visibility and control over user permissions. Re34 The system should support secure communication protocols, including SFTP (active and passive modes), SSL, and SSH, and can be configured according to supplier requirements. Re35 The system should support single or batch import/export of MARC format bibliographic and authority records, supporting all or selected fields; imported records can overwrite existing short records or complete records; import batches can be saved and operated as selection lists. Re36 The system should support an unlimited number of record sets, allowing batch import/export of members; record sets can be used for batch field updates, limited query ranges, and deletion of original records (supporting pre-deletion previews, error logging, and undo deletion operations). Re37 The system should provide a dedicated interface for creating new staff accounts; the account creation process should support configurable templates and provide fine-grained account creation, modification, and deletion permissions. Re38 The system should provide a dedicated interface for creating new reader accounts; the creation process should support configurable templates, field validation, required item settings, and default value configurations. Re39 The system should support scheduled maintenance tasks, report generation, and data export; tasks can be executed in sequence (e.g., 'start task B after task A completes'), and can be modified or canceled at any time before they start. Re40 The system should allow regular staff to be authorized to schedule tasks, reports, and data exports; system administrators should be able to view and manage tasks created by others. Re41 The system should support administrator and user-defined keyboard macros and shortcuts; shortcuts can be bound to macros (such as 'insert field') or text strings; macros should be centrally managed on the server side, support import/export, and their use and editing can be controlled through permissions. Re42 Staff and group accounts should be independent of specific workstations; client installations should not be tied to specific physical locations. Re43 Client software installation and updates should be centrally managed, supporting streaming updates via standard or proprietary network management tools; specific clients can be designated for updates; VNC or remote desktop management is supported. Re44 All client configuration files should be based on server storage; configurations can be imported and exported between clients. Re45 The system should support fully customizable report layouts and appearances; reports can be displayed, printed, emailed, or saved in standard formats such as CSV, Excel, or custom formats. Re46 The system should provide a user-friendly query design interface, supporting queries on all record types; staff can select query fields, choose values from drop-down lists, use regular expressions, and apply full Boolean operators; administrators can control employee access to tables and fields. Re47 System administrators should be able to create report templates for frontline staff to use; employees can run templates directly or customize them as needed. Re48 The system should provide fine-grained permission controls, allowing or prohibiting employees from running specific reports or performing ad-hoc queries on specific datasets. Re49 The system should report the current record number, total number, deleted number, and cleared number by record type (such as readers, bibliographies, collections, orders, invoices, etc.); access to record numbers should be controlled by user/user group permissions. Re50 The system should support defining and selecting four types of printers: receipt printers, general printers, label printers, and form printers; all Windows printers should be supported.```.

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should allow users to submit new model tasks through a graphical interface or command-line tool.Re2 The system should support setting and submitting real-time or offline weather FDDA model tasks (such as GMOD, RTFDDA).Re3 The system should support setting and submitting climate model tasks (such as ClimoFDDA, CAM).Re4 The system should allow users to select the numerical model (MM5 or WRF) to be used and configure related parameters.Re5 The system should provide predefined model domain options and allow users to customize domains or upload terrain files.Re6 The system should allow users to define the task runtime, frequency, forecast duration, and loop interval.Re7 The system should support configuring whether to generate and write restart files and set the write frequency.Re8 The system should allow users to choose standard or custom initial/boundary condition (IC/BC) data sources.Re9 The system should support using standard or user-provided preprocessing scripts to handle initial/boundary condition data.Re10 The system should allow users to add additional preprocessing modules (such as LDAS) or provide custom preprocessors.Re11 The system should support multiple observation data sources (such as WMO, SAMS, MADIS, etc.) and their processing workflows.Re12 The system should allow users to add custom observation data sources and corresponding processing scripts.Re13 The system should provide appropriate executable program options based on the selected model and resource configuration.Re14 The system should allow users to specify running tasks on a particular cluster or have the system automatically schedule them to the optimal cluster.Re15 The system should allow users to configure execution options for final analysis (Final Analysis) and preliminary analysis (Prelim. Analysis).Re16 The system should support additional processing of model outputs (such as bias correction).Re17 The system should allow users to choose to save model outputs to MetVault and specify the file types to be archived.Re18 The system should support automatically triggering post-processing tasks after model runs.Re19 The system should allow users to set the locations for post-processing products such as pseudo-soundings, cross-sections, and pseudo-observation points.Re20 The system should support submitting 'post-processing' tasks that only process existing model outputs.Re21 The system should allow users to select various post-processing types, including: NCL/RIP plotting, NAPS, MDV, station data, MEDOC, 3D plots, verification, etc.Re22 The system should allow users to provide custom configuration files for post-processing tasks or use default configurations.Re23 The system should allow users to specify the target host and storage path for post-processing output results.Re24 The system should support submitting 'manually set' tasks (by-hand jobs) to run user-defined scripts.Re25 The system should require users to provide necessary information for 'manual tasks,' including task ID, script path, run time, estimated duration, executable filename, maximum run time, number of nodes, and output path.Re26 The system should allow users to configure the repetition frequency and other optional metadata for 'manual tasks.'Re27 The system should support loading task parameters from external configuration files and submitting tasks.Re28 The system should allow users to modify loaded task configurations and resave them.Re29 The system should support retrieving previously saved task configurations by users.Re30 The system should allow users to modify saved task configurations and resubmit them for execution.Re31 The system should provide an interface for users to view currently scheduled, running, and historically completed tasks.Re32 The system should display key attributes of tasks, including user ID, task ID, task type, priority, start time, remaining/used time, run phase, status, cluster and node information, number of processors, etc.Re33 The system should allow users to view detailed information and log files for any task.Re34 The system should allow users to delete pending tasks in their own task queue.Re35 The system should allow users to stop, restart, or resume their own running tasks.Re36 The system should allow superusers to manage all users' tasks (view, delete, stop, restart, resume).Re37 The system should support sending email notifications to users when tasks start, complete, or terminate.Re38 The system should support task scheduling and resource management across multiple computing clusters.Re39 The system should allow users to save current task configurations to local files for future reuse.```.

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should allow users to browse all storage areas in the computer system (such as disks, desktop, documents, etc.) and the files and archive objects within them.Re2 The system should provide navigation functions such as 'Back,' 'Forward,' 'Up One Level,' and 'Refresh' in the file management interface, supporting user navigation between directories.Re3 The system should support quick access to frequently used paths via bookmarks.Re4 The system should support viewing a list of recently opened archive files for quick access.Re5 The system should allow users to access specific objects by entering a path or directly opening an archive file.Re6 The system should support selecting all files and archive objects displayed in the current interface.Re7 The system should support inverse selection of currently selected/unselected files and archive objects.Re8 The system should allow users to batch filter and select objects based on conditions such as file extension, attributes, size, and date.Re9 The system should support sorting files and archive objects by selection status.Re10 The system should provide a one-click function to jump to the archive creation interface.Re11 The system should provide a one-click function to jump to the archive extraction interface.Re12 The system should support switching browsing modes (standard directory view and flat view) to uniformly display all objects within the current path or archive.Re13 The system should provide a refresh function to update the content currently displayed.Re14 The system should integrate system-level tools, including disk cleanup, disk defragmentation, control panel, computer management, task manager, and other system management functions.Re15 The system should provide a system performance benchmarking function to evaluate the host system's MIPS (millions of instructions per second) and equivalent Core 2 Duo processor frequency (MHz).Re16 The system should support displaying environment variables in Windows and Linux environments.Re17 The system should provide a secure deletion function that achieves irreversible deletion of files and folders through multiple overwrites.Re18 The system should support byte-by-byte comparison between two files to precisely locate differing bytes.Re19 The system should provide a file verification function to detect duplicate files and file corruption (supporting verification based on known checksum values).Re20 The system should support file splitting and merging functions, allowing users to split large files into multiple volumes and recombine them into the original file.Re21 The system should provide a file information display function, including the number of selected files, latest/oldest modification time, total occupied space, and maximum/minimum file size.Re22 The system should support previewing file contents in hexadecimal format.Re23 The system should support creating new archive files and allow users to choose from various archive formats.Re24 The system should support updating the contents of existing archive files.Re25 The system should allow users to automatically append timestamps to archive filenames for backup and archiving purposes.Re26 The system should support encrypting archive files with two-factor authentication (password + key file).Re27 The system should support extracting content from compressed archives to a specified folder while keeping the original archive file unchanged.Re28 The system should support reading the following archive formats: 7z, 7z-sfx, ARC/WRC, BZ2/TBZ2, GZ/TGZ, PAQ/LPAQ, PEA, QUAD/BALZ, split, TAR, UPX, ZIP, ACE, ARJ, CAB, CHM, COMPOUND (MSI, DOC, XLS, PPT), CPIO, ISO, Java (JAR, EAR, WAR), Linux (DEB, PET/PUP, RPM, SLP), LHA/LZH, LZMA, Mac (DMG/HFS), NSIS, Open Office files, PAK/PK3/PK4, RAR, SMZIP, U3P, UDF, VHD, WIM, XAR, XPI, XZ, Z/TZ.Re29 The system should require users to provide a password and (if applicable) a key file to access the contents when encrypting archives.Re30 The system should provide a graphical monitoring interface to display the progress of all ongoing operations in real-time.Re31 The system should allow all functions to be executed via command line and support exporting generated commands to a text file.Re32 The system should support cross-platform operation, compatible with 64-bit and 32-bit Microsoft Windows systems (including 95/98/NT/2000/XP/Vista).Re33 The system should support running on POSIX-compatible systems, including various Linux, BSD, and Unix-like operating systems.Re34 The system should provide a portable version that does not require installation and does not modify the host system.Re35 The system should include all required compression/archive tools internally, without requiring users to install additional dependencies (except for standard GTK/GDK libraries).Re36 The system should provide a settings menu that allows users to customize various function parameters and usage preferences.Re37 The system should support applying multiple management functions simultaneously to individual files or archives.```.

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:```Re1 The system should allow economic operators to apply for and manage their VCD accounts, including creating, updating, and maintaining sensitive corporate data.Re2 The system should support economic operators in initializing VCD requests and automatically generating evidence compilation recommendations that meet tender requirements.Re3 The system should allow economic operators to adjust VCD compilation recommendations based on specific procurement needs to meet the requirements of different tenderers.Re4 The system should have an automatic collection function capable of gathering corporate qualification evidence from multiple electronic issuance services, reducing administrative burden.Re5 The system should provide VCD instance compilation services, integrating different types of data into a uniformly structured VCD simple data package.Re6 The system should support the reuse of evidence in existing VCD data packages to generate new VCDs, reducing the cost of repeated submissions.Re7 The system should have a VCD data merging function, capable of combining VCD information from multiple economic operators (such as consortia, main contractor-subcontractor) into a comprehensive VCD package for a single candidate entity.Re8 The system should support context-relevant data processing, enabling key qualification information to be understood across languages without full text translation.Re9 The system should allow for the processing of multilingual contextual data through a 'selective translation' mechanism, enhancing interoperability based on a common terminology dictionary.Re10 The system should provide secure identity authentication mechanisms to ensure that both economic operators and procurement agencies can safely access the VCD transmission system.Re11 The system should support encrypted transmission of VCD data packages to ensure the security and reliability of cross-border data exchanges.Re12 The system should implement submission and retrieval functions for VCD data packages, supporting economic operators in sending VCDs to procurement agencies, which then receive and view them.Re13 The system should provide controlled access mechanisms to ensure that only authorized users can view sensitive corporate data.Re14 The system should support online viewing of VCD content by procurement agencies and the assessment of the applicability and validity of the requested evidence.Re15 The system should integrate pre-VCD mapping tools to achieve automatic matching of corporate evidence from one country to the tender requirements of another.Re16 The system should be operated by national VCD service providers, serving as a single point of access to connect various electronic certification and issuance services.Re17 The system should support the verification and use of cross-border digital signatures to ensure legal validity and technical mutual recognition.Re18 The system should define qualification integration processes and role matching rules applicable to legal structures such as consortia and subcontractors.```.
