Customer then clicks on the button or link to initiate registration process. The system prompts the customer to fill out his first name, last name, billing address, shipping address, email address, and password. The system validates the customer's information. The system creates a new account for the customer and displays to customer, the account home page.#F2 When the customer clicks on the button or link to initiate the login process, the system prompts the customer for his email and password. The system verifies the information and displays account home page to the Customer#F3 When the customer specifies the quantity of items to be ordered, the system checks the availability of the product. The customer drags the desired product and selects it. The customer confirms the products to be selected and returns to product listings.#F4 When the customer clicks on the payment button or link to initiate the payment process, the customer enters the credit card number and pin code. The system verifies credit card and pin code number and displays account home page to the Customer.#F5 In order to perform account logout, the customer clicks the logout button or link to initiate the logout process. Then, the system displays the home page.#F6 After the payment translation is completed, the product is delivered to customer on the address provided by customer. #F7 To initiate the login process the customer clicks on the login button or link. The system requests the customer for his email and password. After providing the details the system verifies the information and displays account home page to the Customer.#F8 To initiate Add Product process the system prompts the Organizer to fill out product name, product id, product description, product price, upload a product image, number of items in inventory, and availability of product. The system validates the new product information and creates a new product page for the new product. The system displays the newly created product page.#F9 To initiate Remove Product process the organizer clicks the Remove Product button or link. The system prompts the organizer to select a product by searching or viewing a list of products. The system validates the product information and then the system removes the product page and product information from the system. The system displays the newly created product page.#F10 When the organizer updates the product page and product information within the system the system displays to the organizer the newly updated product page.#F11 When the organizer clicks the logout button or link in order to initiate a logout process, the system displays the home page..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:The system shall display all the products that can be configured.#O2 The system shall allow user to select the product to configure.#O3 The system shall display all the available components of the product to configure.#O4 The system shall enable a user to add one or more component to the configuration.#O5 The system shall notify the user about any conflict in the current configuration.#O6 The system shall allow user to update the configuration to resolve conflict in the current configuration.#O7 The system shall allow user to confirm the completion of current configuration.#O8 The system shall display detailed information of the selected products.#O9 The system shall provide browsing options to see product details.#O10 The system shall display detailed product categorization to the user.#O11 The system shall enable user to enter the search text on the screen.#O12 The system shall enable user to select multiple options on the screen to search.#O13 The system shall display all the matching products based on the search keywords.#O14 The system shall display only ten matching search result on the current screen.#O15 The system shall enable user to navigate between the search results.#O16 The system shall notify the user when no matching product is found on the search.#O17 The system shall allow user to create profile and set his credential.#O18 The system shall authenticate user credentials to view the profile.#O19 The system shall allow user to update the profile information.#O20 The system shall display both the active and completed order history in the customer profile.#O21 The system shall allow user to select the order from the order history.#O22 The system shall display the detailed information about the selected order.#O23 The system shall display the most frequently searched items by the user in the profile.#O24 The system shall allow user to register for newsletters and surveys in the profile.#O25 The system shall provide online help, FAQ, customer support, and sitemap options for customer support.#O26 The system shall allow user to select the support type he wants.#O27 The system shall allow user to enter the customer and product information for the support.#O28 The system shall display the customer support contact numbers on the screen.#O30 The system shall display the online help upon request.#O31 The system shall display the FAQ upon request.#O32 The system shall maintain customer email information as a required part of customer profile.#O33 The system shall send an order confirmation to the user through email.#O34 The system shall display detailed invoice for current order once it is confirmed.#O35 The system shall optionally allow user to print the invoice.#O36 The system shall provide shopping cart during online purchase.#O37 The system shall allow user to add and remove products in the shopping cart.#O38 The system shall display different shipping options provided by shipping department.#O39 The system shall enable user to select the shipping method during payment process.#O40 The system shall display the shipping charges.#O41 The system shall display tentative duration for shipping.#O42 The system shall allow user to enter the order information for tracking.#O43 The system shall display the current tracking information about the order.#O44 The system shall calculate tax for the order.#O45 The system shall display tax information for the order.#O46 The system shall display available payment methods for payment.#O47 The system shall allow user to select the payment method for order.#O48 The system shall display the orders that are eligible to change.#O49 The system shall allow user to select the order to be changed.#O50 The system shall allow user to cancel the order.#O51 The system shall allow user to change shipping and payment method.#O52 The system shall notify the user about any changes made to the order.#O53 The system shall display the reviews and ratings of each product, when it is selected.#O54 The system shall enable the user to enter their reviews and ratings.#O55 The system shall display all the available financing options.#O56 The system shall allow user to select the financing option.#O57 The system shall notify the use about the financing request.#O58 The system shall allow user to view detailed sitemap.#O59 The system shall display all the available promotions to the user.#O60 The system shall allow user to select available promotion.#O61 The system shall allow user to confirm the purchase.#O62 The system shall enable user to enter the payment information..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:If customer wants to buy the product then he or she must be registered.#S1.1 Unregistered user cannot reach the shopping cart. #S1.2 The customer logs into the system by entering a valid user id and password for shopping purposes.#S1.3 The system allows customer can make changes to the cart.  The customer can make an order or cancel an order of a product from the shopping cart after login or registration.  #S1.4 Customer can use many types of secure billing like prepaid as debit or credit card, or postpaid as after shipping, check or bank draft. The security will provide by the third party like Pay-Pal etc.   #S1.5 After making a payment or viewing the product, the customer will be logged out.#S1.6 After all transaction are completed, the system can generate the portable document file (.pdf) and then sent one copy to the customer's Email address and another one for the system database to calculate the monthly transaction.#S2 The system will work on client-server architecture. It will require an internet server, which will be able to run PHP application. The system should support some commonly used browser such as IE and etc.#S3 There will be a screen displaying information about product that the shop has.#S4 If the customers select the buy button, then another screen of shopping cart will be opened.#S5 After each transaction, the system makes the selling report as portable document file (.pdf) and sent to the customer E-mail address.#S6 The System must run over the internet, all the hardware shall require to connect the internet and will be hardware interface for the system. For example, Modem, WAN ?LAN, Ethernet Cross-Cable..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:The application entitled 'On-line Mobile Shopping' enables customer to buy mobiles or accessories from anywhere through online. #R2.2 This application advertises some of the products for shopping. #R2.3 To buy products, customers have to create an account. Those who do not have an account, can only view the available product, but can't buy it.#R2.4 Once the customer has created an account, not only he can view the products, he can also add the products to the cart and also he can place an order to buy those products. The application then generates bill for that particular customer. #R2.5 After the products' order confirmation, the customer has to enter his credit card details to buy those products.#R2.6 The application stores all the information in the database, which can be retrieved whenever needed and all the validations are performed during the entry of the data by the user thus the application should ensure that the user cannot enter any wrong data which could cause problem later.#R2.7 Initially, a customer has to register to the website to access most of the features of the application.  The customer has to enter details like username, password etc. #R2.8 After registration customer will be able to purchase products and the purchased product can be added to the cart. Later, a customer has to enter his credit card details to buy the products. The confirmation of debit card numbers will be handled by the Pay pal website.#R2.9 The Admin adds the new product, accessories and stores in the database which can be retrieved and used whenever needed. All the validation are performed during the entry of the data. Thus the application ensures that the user cannot enter any wrong data which would cause problem later.#R2.10 The application allows the user to access all the products available. To buy the products, customer must create an account in this website.#R2.11 When the admin enters the Login Id and password, the Login module checks if the login Id and password are valid or not. The admin is directed to next page where he can add, delete or update the products.#R2.12 When the customer enters the details to create new account, the module checks whether he entered all the details or not. The customer is directed to the next page where he can view all the available products#R2.13 When the admin adds a new product, which can be viewed by the users, the module checks, whether all the fields are entered properly or not. The records will be added to the database.#R2.14 The search module helps the customer to ease his search, based on his interest. The search can be done on different categories like mobile model name, model number, color, price and etc. the search module retrieves the selected category from the database and displays what the customer like to search.#R2.15 A user can select any mobile number and add to the cart. The user can also remove it later from the cart if he dislikes . The module checks whether all the fields are entered properly or not. The records will be added to the database.#R2.16 The payment module describes the payment done by the customer. The payment information can include information like the model purchased, quantity, mode of payment etc. The module checks whether all the fields are entered or not and displays the payment done by the customer..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Administrator can access any component or area of the system including accounts of other users.#2Librarian can access the catalog management features of the system.#3Patron can access the general library features, including browsing, searching, check out, check in, reserve, and purchase.#4Studentsame as a Patron, except may not access Purchase features.#5The system must provide user management to manage the user role assignments. Each user can have multiple user roles assigned.#6Users must be able to create Patron or Student accounts by registering online. A suitable registration page or pages should be provided.#7New users must go thru a verification process (TBD) to confirm their email address before their account is activated in the system.#8Once verified, users must be able to log in to the portal.#9Users must be able to change their password (but not their user name/ID).#10There must be a way for users to retrieve a lost password.#11Users must be able to log out. There must be a session timeout mechanism that will automatically log the user out after a period of time (period TBD).#12On logout, the contents of user’s Select List and Cart are cleared. The contents of the Reserved List is preserved.#13Users must be able to search for eBooks.#14The system should provide interfaces for both “simple” and “advanced” searches:#14.1 “simple” should be a search on any one of fields Author, Title, or ISBN.#14.2“advanced” should provide an easy way to construct complex searches on multiple fields with different logic (e.g. AND, OR, NOT)#15The system should provide several “quick search” options:#15.1Newest eBooks – returns a listing of the 10- 50 (configurable) most recently added eBooks#15.2Top 20 Titles – returns a listing of the  20 most frequently borrowed eBooks#15.2.1 The actual number should be configurable by an administrator#15.2.2 The UI should provide a pick list of values: 10, 20, 25, 50, 100#15.3Latest Returns – returns a list of 10-50 (configurable) most recently checked-in eBooks#15.3.1Either explicitly checked in by a patron, or lending period expired freeing the eBook for loan#15.3.2eBooks listed in this set must not have any reservations… must be available for immediate loan#16Users must be able to browse the eBooks in the catalog.#17Users must be able to select how they want to browse:#17.1Browse by Author#17.1.1Must be able to select an alphabetical subset… e.g. author names beginning with A, or M for example#17.2Browse by Title#17.2.1Must be able to select an alphabetical subset… e.g. author names beginning with A, or M for example#17.3Browse by genre (e.g. fiction, non-fiction, science fiction, etc.)#18Users should be able to browse by Publisher.#19Users should be able to browse by Book Award.#20Users should be able to browse according to a combination of data, such as by Author + Genre, Title + Year of Publication, Author + Book Award, etc. #21The Select List is similar to a shopping cart except that the checkout processes a loan of the eBooks in the list rather than a purchase.#21.1Each user must be able to save a list of eBooks they want to borrow – their “Select List”#21.2The Select List is only for the current session and is cleared when the session terminates#21.3Each eBook added to the Select List remains in the list for 20 minutes. During this time, the number of copies available for loan is reduced by 1 and the number available is shown to other users. #21.3.1If the time expires and the eBook is removed from the Select List, then the number of copies available for loan is increased by 1 and the number available is shown to other users.#21.4The number of eBooks user may add to their Select List is limited to the checkout limit defined in the system configuration minus  the number of eBooks patron has currently checked out. #21.4.1If user currently has the maximum number checked out, then all Add to Select List links should be disabled for that user.#21.5If all copies allowable under the eBook’s DRM are currently on loan to other users, then the eBook cannot be added to any user’s Select List (the UI widget is disabled) and the UI must inform the user that no copy is currently available for loan.#22User should be able to navigate to Check Out any time via a readily visible link or button.#23The checkout page must display the eBooks in the user’s Select List.#24The user must be able to remove eBooks from the Select List at this point.#25Via an appropriate UI widget, user should be able to execute check out which processes on all the eBooks left on the Select List.#26When checkout is complete, user must be presented with a page of the checked out titles, each title having a DOWNLOAD widget.  Clicking the widget downloads a copy of the eBook with appropriate DRM applied. #27Each checked out eBook should remain listed on the user’s Downloads page until the loan period expires. #28Users must be able to “return” any eBook on their Downloads page that has not yet been downloaded via an appropriate “RETURN THIS EBOOK” widget.#29Executing the return must remove the eBook from the user’s downloads page, decreases the count of eBooks the user currently has checked out (if that value is greater than zero), and increases by 1 the number of copies of the eBook available for loan..

<feature name='BrowseByPublisher'/>                    <feature name='BrowseByBookAward'/>                    <feature name='CombinedBrowse'/>                </or>            </and> <var>CatalogManagement</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>Student</var>                <not><var>PurchaseEBook</var></not>            </imp>        </rule>                <!-- Feature dependencies -->        <rule>            <imp>                <var>AdvancedSearch</var>                <var>BasicSearch</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>CombinedBrowse</var>                <var>BrowseByAuthor</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>CombinedBrowse</var>                <var>BrowseByTitle</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>TopTitles</var>                <var>ConfigureSystemSettings</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>SelectList</var>                <var>CheckOut</var>            </imp>        </rule>        <rule>            <imp>                <var>CheckOut</var>                <var>Download</var>            </imp>        </rule>    </constraints>    <comments/></featureModel>

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:The system allows the user to buy or sell products online across global internet connection.#R1.2 Administrators are users who add or administer categories for the products, and administer the Vendors.#R1.3 Vendors or sellers are users who add their products to the database, which will be presented in the website to the end users or customers. #R1.4 Customers can buy the products by selecting the vendor or seller they need. #R1.5 Vendors will have the special privileges than the end users, and have ability to manage the products added by them.#R1.6 The end user will be the one who visits the website and buys products online from the ones that were added by the vendors or sellers.#R1.7 When an end users buy a product, the main constraint of the system would be the checking of the genuineness of the buyer.#R1.8 The developed system should run under any platform (Unix, Linux, Mac, Windows and etc.) that contains a web browser which supports PHP, JavaScript and AJAX.#R1.9 The details related to the product, customer, payment and service transaction are provided manually by the vendor.#R1.10 The Website Order system shall send a confirmation e-mail, to the customer specifying that the items they ordered will be delivered to the shipping address along with user identification information.#R1.11 The Master Maintenance module consists of information about the products and services. This includes two sub-modules, Product master and Price master.#R1.12 Product master includes the information about particular product, such as product number, item, name, category, images of products, description, features, constraints of products, which are to be displayed on the website.#R1.13 The Price master deals with the cost of the product, discounts applicable for the particular product of a vendor or seller.#R1.14 All transactions undergoing in the website will be controlled and managed by the Price master module. #R1.15 The reporting module, deals with report management of the entire system. This includes three sub-modules Stock Report, Order Report and Delivery Report.#R1.16 Order Report will manage the list of the ordered products and the customer details who have bought the undelivered products.#R1.18 The Housekeeping Module deals with backing up of data for future references.#R1.19All the inputs should be checked for validation and messages should be given for the improper data by the system. The invalid data are to be ignored and error messages should be given by the system.#R1.20 Details provided by the vendor during his sign up should be stored in database by the system.#R1.21 While adding the products to the system by the vendor, mandatory fields must be checked by the system for validation whether the vendor has filled appropriate data in these mandatory fields. The system will store the data in database for later retrieval.#R1.22 If the mandatory fields are not filled by the vendor, a proper error message should be displayed by the system.#R1.23 All mandatory fields should be filled by a customer, while buying the items from the cart..

instruction: You are a professional business analyst who specializes in analyzing software requirements to define a software product line (SPL) feature model. You are aware that there are six possible types of constraints in a SPL feature model, encompassing mandatory, optional, or, xor, require and exclude. “mandatory” applies for individual mandatory features. “optional” applies for individual optional features. “or” applies for one-to-many constraints where at least one child feature must be present but two or more can coexist when a parent feature is present. “xor” applies for one-to-many constraints where child features coexist in a mutually exclusive way when a parent feature is present. “require” applies for two disconnected features that depend on each other. “exclude” applies for two disconnected features that are mutually exclusive. Please generate a SPL feature model based on the following software requirements:Should support the mandatory aspects of OAIS.#2Must accept and store any multimedia and text-based file format for storage, including compressed and uncompressed formats such as TIFF and WAV.#3As a minimum, the system must be able to import and export simple Dublin Core records.#4The system should support additional metadata standards, for example Dublin Core application profiles, VRA, CDWA, PREMIS, PBCORE, LOM, MPEG-7 and other XML-based metadata formats. Should be extensible for new schemes.#5Should support rich, complex, structured metadata, such as hierarchies and multi-entity description sets.#6Should support RDF-encoded metadata creation, e.g. for use by semantic Web applications, and storage, e.g. in an rdf triple store.#7Should support XML-encoded data, for metadata exchange.#8Must support the extension of metadata profiles with customised schemes both for internal use and for export and import.#9Should support the ability to provide multiple custom of metadata for different user roles and content types, both for deposit and access.#10Should support the capture of metadata for different purposes, such as administrative, preservation, technical, descriptive and rights metadata.#11Must support an extensible set of relationship types between metadata resources/objects; examples might include part/whole, child/parent relationships or citations. These relationships may be captured using RDF.#12Should support relationships between internal and external resources; examples might include a citation between a resource in the digital library and a publication held in White Rose Research Online.#13May support automatic suggestions for related items both at deposit and access.#14Should capture audit trails for metadata creation, identifying the users involved in metadata creation by session rather than by edit, with roll-back functionality.#15Must support METS as a packaging standard for deposit, export and content management.#16Should support other packaging standards, such as IMS CP and DIDL and provide extensibility for new standards such as ORE resource maps.#17Must support customisable mapping of metadata and/or package structure to internal data stores to ensure metadata or packages can be ingested or extracted.#18Should support OCR conversion of text-based images.#19Must be able to deliver large high-quality audio and video resources on-demand. #20Must support collections. It must be possible to include resources in multiple collections, by reference, rather than by duplication.#21Must support management and navigation of hierarchical collections, for example archival collections.#22Should support annotation of collections and individual resources by users, including annotation of marked points or areas, e.g. a section of an image.#23Must manage multi-object aggregations as a single resource or collection, with a persistent, unique identifier.#24Should support the creation of collections or aggregations from resources within and outside the system, for example a collection of images on a theme, which references images from externally-managed sources.#25Must support internal name authority and selection of names from an internally-generated list.#26Should support access to different taxonomies for different user roles, for example subjects-specific taxonomies.#27Should create mappings between synonymous keywords and subject terms, and name acronyms or pseudonymns.#28May support automatic subject classification or suggested classifications.#29Should support user-defined keywords or tagging.#30Must support the creation of unique identifiers (HTTP URIs).#31Identifiers should resolve to an appropriate representation of the resource identified. Example resource might include physical, digital and conceptual resources, e.g. metadata records, data files and people.#32May support the use of relationships to identify equivalent identifiers/locators/resources, for example owl:sameas.#33Should support deep linking from Blackboard VLE (including the reading list module and CMS) and from the Web.#34Should support XML-encoded data formats. In particular, should support XML-based mark-up languages used for tagging text resources, for example TEI or EAD.#35Must support user deposit and metadata creation.#36Must support deposit through a Web-based user interface.#37May support deposit to multiple locations from a single deposit point, for example for deposit into the digital library and into a funding council required repository, or deposit of a specific file type to the digital library and another to WRRO.#38Should support automatic generation of some metadata; examplesmight include deriving author name from University systems or document properties, capture of metadata from embedded image data, ID3 audio tags or use of remote metadata creation web services.#39Should support duplicating metadata records for deposit of multiple similar objects.#40Should support customisable spell-checking of metadata, e.g. for certain metadata elements only, or should integrate with external tools.#41Should support duplicate or equivalence checking for resources already within the digital library.#42May support deposit by-reference, i.e. ingest or obtain a file and/or package by supplying a URI. This may be extended to support ORE resource maps.#43May support Web archiving, for example grabbing a web page and associated files and depositing into the repository.#44Should support deposit of metadata only, with references to externally-held data objects if available.#45Must determine file format on deposit.#46Must support customisable re-sizing, e.g. of images.#47Must support Create, Retrieve, Update and Delete actions on deposits.#48Should support deletion and archiving, both purging for permanent deletion (with support for dealing with orphaned URIs), and dark archiving (no further access).#49Must be accessed via a Web-based user interface.#50Must support HTTP download of resources.#51Should support control of format delivery by user role or user choice.#52Should support user customisation of default formats.#53Must support search across all collections, selected collections and individual collections.#54Must support advanced search features. Advanced search must be customisable to any combination of metadata elements, e.g. artist, author, subject, keywords, dates etc.#55Must support filtering of search results, e.g. by resource type or date. Should support user customisation or personalisation of search results display, e.g. by date or relevance.#56Should support custom advanced search features for different collections.#57Should support spell checking of search terms, if desired.#58Should support synonym suggestions for search terms.#59Should provide suggestions for alternative searches where both zero or large results sets are returned.#60Must support browsing by taxonomy or specific metadata elements, for example resource type.#61Should support a combination of browse and search, e.g. search within a sub-section, browse by specific metadata elements in search results.#62Must support access control based on a customisable set of user roles (student, staff, administrator etc.) and groups (course, Department, research group, Institution).#63Should support access control based on date/time, for example for embargoed materials, but also for video clips where restrictions on use might specify that they are only accessible for a period of time to a specific role/group.#64Must support access control based on individual object, object type or system-selected collection.#65Must support administrator roles for enhanced access to administrative functions.#66Should support policy administration and applying policies to deposit and access processes.#67Must generate statistics for usage, deposit, access, download and a range of other aspects.#68Must provide web-based access for performing routine systems and administrative tasks.#69Should support web-based customisation of administrative interfaces and functions.#70The system must provide online help facilities.#71The online help facilities should be context-sensitive.#72The online help content should be customisable.#73The supplier should provide an online system for problem/fault/query logging and tracking.#74The system must run under one of the following operating systems: #74.1Solaris 10 or later (SPARC or x86)#74.2Windows Server 2003R2 or later#75The system should be supported when running on virtualised hardware, such as VMWare or Solaris Zones.#76The system must support one or more of the following for core database functionality (if required):#76.1Oracle 10g or later (preferred)#76.2SQL Server 2000 or later#76.3MySQL 4 or later#77Any filestore-based content must be stored using networked filestore. The system must support this technology.#78Copies of user passwords must not be stored on the persistence layer of the system.#79The system must support session management in a clustered environment..
